<h3>Consumers Like Us are the Engine That Drives 70%
of the American Economy

The average American has far more power to effect positive change than we realize. Help publish the book that will show the average consumer how to use that power to bring about real change for all Americans, not  just the wealthiest 400 people that together own most of the assets in the country.

The book shows how to make small painless changes to where we deposit, spend, insure, invest, etc. and earn our money to places where we actually own part of the place. We can save money and pay less in fees because these places aren't large corporations who's main goal is to earn profits from you to pay investors.

Because you own the place you also have a say in the way they're run. If you have an idea about how to improve something or have a complaint you have a right to be heard. You can even put your hat in the ring to help run it if you wish. Try that at Mega-mart. Many of these places are already quietly in your area, if not the book shows how to help get them started.
When the crisis in 2008 brought on by the greed and fraud of a few behemoths that are only now starting to be brought to justice, the

column2: government and huge corporations huddled together and bailed each other
out, seemingly forgetting about the average American and small

business owners on Main Street.The irony is that many of the bailed out institutions are now the ones facing court for causing the mess in the first place. The ""too big to fail"" banks are far bigger now than they were before the crisis that wiped out trillions of dollars in wealth. Help reduce the threat to our economy by too big to fail conglomerates by keeping the money out of their pockets in the first place.


Help publish the book that shows how we can spend almost all of our money where it strengthen our local community.

Eliza Jayne is a young lady with an extraordinary gift. She can communicate with the spirit world. With her faithful dog, Buddy, by her side she uses her gift to guide lost spirits, help confused ghosts, and dispel mischievous poltergeists.

But what happens when Eliza is faced with a truly evil apparition, one that wants to take over her soul?! Find out in ""Eliza Jayne: Ghost Huntress!""



Hi folks! I'm Eliza Jayne, a model and actress.

I've been long involved with the horror industry and have developed a wonderful fan base over the years. Truly, they are the reason for where I am today and a huge part of why I do what I do. As such, I am always looking for new ways to connect with them. This book is my way of doing that. 

I've teamed up with author and illustrator Rickman, to create this storybook, loosely based on my own history and experiences.  It will offer fans both old and new, another way to find out who Eliza Jayne is, and what I'm all about. I really believe that you all will have as much fun reading it, as I am having with creating it! Join us on my latest endeavor and be part of the process!

ELIZA AND RICKMAN DISCOVER YET MORE CREEPINESS IN CENTRALIA, PA!

For those of you that have known me for some time, this is our chance to make a mark together, to help expand my presence into a new format, the printed word. And for fans of horror, this an opportunity to help create a product that can connect kids with the genre, in a fun, approachable way. 

The sum we're seeking is for printing costs for an initial run of 1000 copies of the book, shipping and handling, e-book conversion, advertising, and costs to attend a couple of conventions where we will promote it. 

We're offering a wide range of pledge rewards, including the book itself, pages of original artwork from the book, personalized photos of me where you get to play director, modeling outfits of mine, your likeness in the book, and even a chance to sit down and have dinner with me and the team! Copies of the book are of course available, as both print and PDF versions. 

PLEASE NOTE: All pledge levels at $40 or above will receive an autographed copy of the book, in addition to whatever is offered at the particular pledge level. 

All pledge levels of $60 and above, also get an autographed copy of Zach Meets the Zombie, by Rickman!

ALL PLEDGE LEVELS FROM $1 THROUGH $80 ARE STACKABLE!

For example, if you pledge $60, you will receive all perks from $1 through $60. At any pledge of $100 or more, you will receive all perks from $1 through $80, plus the perk of the particular amount you pledge ($100, $150, $200, $250 or $500).



If you want to help out, but decide not to pledge, you can help spread word of our project by posting about it on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms, or sharing it on sites like Reddit and Stumbleupon. 

Thank you for checking this out!

Most novels in this YA category feature male protagonists, so I wanted to write one with a female protagonist. Penelope is a ten year old girl who has powers she can't control and doesn't understand. She is the daughter of a mundane mother and a father who is a wizard. This is the story of her journey to self knowledge and finding out who and what she is, all with the help of her talking cat, Hecate.

I started the book in 2000, so it has been a long process, more off than on. This year, I decided to take the NaNoWroMo challenge; write a novel in a month. 50,000 words in 30 days. The challenge has really motivated me to sit down and finish it. I am currently at 28,768 words as of today. I envisioned the ending yesterday, and I am already getting images and ideas for the first chapter of the second book!

I also have more than a few young people impatiently waiting for me to finish, so they can read the rest of the story! How can I let them down?

My name is Laurenn Barker. I have been a lifetime artist and writer, having spent more than 30 years in the fields of communications and publishing.  My career has incorporated graphics, illustration, photography and writing and I have designed and produced six books, in addition to the five Lae Lae books which are currently available.

At the same time, however; I have also been active in children's causes in three states across the U.S. and have been on the boards of several organizations devoted to child and family services.  I am also a mother of three and a grandmother of six.

The future of the world literally depends on what we teach our children today and I am deeply committed to the well-being of children now and into the future. Children need love, support and positive guidance to grow into happy, self confident, responsible adults.  The Lae Lae collection is devoted to these goals.

In this era of the ""disappearing book"" when everything is online and children are left in front of the television for long periods, books like the Lae Lae books are increasingly important.   It has been proven that reading to a child for just twenty minutes a day makes a huge positive difference in the life of the child.  The Lae Lae books are developed for children, ages 2 to 6, a most vulnerable and impressionable age, to be used for the all important ""cuddle time"" with a parent or caregiver.  The lessons children learn at this age will stay with them for life.  The books feature a real child not a cartoon character and real experiences which a child will have, both happy and also challenging.

Each book is 8.5 x 8.5, 4 color, soft cover, and 40 pages in length. Each includes a short story, coloring pages and activities for the child to enjoy with an adult.  Each book also includes a CD with pages from the book and stickers that can be printed out on the computer.  A separate insert of parent's notes with suggestions of teachable moments and thought provoking questions to ask a child based on the story are also included with each book.
What We Need & What You Get
<div>

Funding from this campaign will be used to develop new books and to translate all books into languages other than English.  The next two books are in development now; one is about Lae Lae's learning to play with a new friend who has a physical challenge and the other is about Lae Lae and her friends visiting the ocean and learning about the life of the ocean.

The books are being produced by a major print on demand company and will be sold primarily through Internet sales but also locally through preschools and organizations devoted to very young children.  If the entire funding goal is not met, whatever funding does come in will be stretched as far as it can be to reach those goals.
A portion of the sales of the books is being donated to causes that benefit children, animals and the environment.
I am asking for contributions for $10 to $500.
For contributions of $10, the contributor will receive a thank you via email and a thank you on the Lae Lae Facebook fan page.
For contributions of $25, the contributor will receive a signed copy of the first book in the series, the ""Lae Lae Adventures"" and a thank you on the Lae Lae Facebook fan page.

For contributions of $50, the contributor will receive a signed ""Lae Lae Adventures"" book, a signed Lae Lae print suitable for framing, a thank you on the Lae Lae fan page and acknowledgement in upcoming books.

For contributions of $75, the contributor will receive a signed copy of all five books currently available in a beautiful gift box, a thank you on the Lae Lae fan page and acknowledgement in upcoming books.

For contributions of $100, the contributor will receive a signed copy of all five books currently available in a beautiful gift box, a Lae Lae T-shirt for you or your child (please designate size), a thank you on the Lae Lae fan page and acknowledgement in upcoming books.
For contributions of $150, the contributor will receive all of the above and a small gift box with personal accessories for the child which matches the collection. The box will ship flat.
For contributions of $250, the contributor will receive all of the above and a framed and autographed Lae Lae book cover.

For contributions of $500, the contributor will receive all of the above and the option of helping write a Lae Lae collection book which will be dedicated to the contributor. The book subject must be compatible with the collection as it is being developed and must be suitable for the 2 to 6 year old age range.
Other Ways You Can Help
<div>

Please support the project on the Lae Lae  Facebook fan page and let your friends and family know about the campaign.  Thank you so much for your positive encouragement and support in what I and my advisors are committed to do to improve the lives of our children now and for the future.

We raised our goal amount of $6000! Thank you to everyone who donated, contributed, supported and shared our campaign. Our book, Voice to Voice, will be published in spring 2015!

In these last hours we are issuing a challenge goal: to raise $1000 ABOVE our goal to directly fund the writers. Every dollar past $6000 will directly support participants by republishing chapbooks, providing transit money to and from readings, or supplying contest entry funds.  The writing life is full of little bites in the wallet that can prevent total engagement in the literary community. Thursdays Writing Collective wants to equal the playing field for our excellent participants! 

If you have not yet contributed, know that your support is going to change someone's life. If you have donated already, don't be afraid of re-upping! We have until Wed Aug 27 at midnight PST! 

Our Original Goal

Thursdays Writing Collective has one month to raise $6000 for publishing our seventh book of creative writing, Voice to Voice. With your help we'll create 500 copies of this book on the theme of music and transformation. Voice to Voice will launch in June 2015 in tandem with a live performance of several new music compositions based on poems and stories appearing in Voice to Voice. 

Here are three ways to help our book come to life:
<li>
Donate any amount from $5 to...$6000 - each donation is a boon!
<li>
Share this campaign with others via email and social media. You could be the one to put us in touch with a funding hero!
<li>
Like our Facebook page

Who and What is Thursdays Writing Collective?

Thursdays Writing Collective is a non profit organization that joyfully and raucously converts creativity into text in weekly creative writing sessions. We are more than 150 activists, academics, slam poets, novelists and storytellers who explore issues of self-determination through creative writing. 

Founded in 2008, the Collective holds free, drop-in writing sessions in Vancouver's Downtown Eastside at Carnegie Community Centre and performs at festivals, literary events and readings.
Despite challenges related to poverty, mental health, addiction and prejudice we’ve

published six books that have helped us connect with people in our Downtown Eastside neighbourhood, across Canada and throughout the US and Europe.  Our writers have won awards for their writing, been published in literary magazines such as Geist, Poetry is Dead, Megaphone's Literary Voices, been the subject of documentary videos, received highly competitive SSHRC university grants and small arts grants as well as major international governmental grants, have headlined at public readings, been invited to read at literary festivals, written and self-published books, signed book contracts with independent presses, edited books, newsletters and blogs and been active in arts initiatives of all sorts.

You can read about us here: www.thursdayswritingcollective.ca or in this article on Rabble.ca, where they called us, “a small-but-mighty cultural force within the city… Taking part in a Thursdays session is an immersive experience, and an eye-opening one, too. This room is bursting with talent.”
With your help, we will publish our seventh anthology, Voice to Voice, in Spring 2015.

About Voice to Voice

Voice to Voice is the name of the book growing out of a year-long collaborative project of the same name between Thursdays Writing Collective, Instruments of Change (Laura Barron), UBC musicians and singers (Rena Sharon) and Ray Hsu. 

Beginning in Sep 2014 Thursdays Writing Collective will explore writing on the theme of music and transformation (of individuals, communities, ideas and creative endeavours). We’ll pass our poems, stories and texts to composers who will create original songs (for classical voice and piano) that will be performed in concert by trained musicians in June 2015.
Our book, Voice to Voice, will incorporate the musical scores of these works as well
as other written texts produced throughout the year by Thursdays Writing Collective

members.

Although we are supported by institutions such as Carnegie Community Centre, Simon Fraser University and Canada Council for the Arts with funds and in-kind donations, we need help finding the money to publish on our own terms. In the past we have worked with ace designers and printers and have brought out beautiful books that push the edge of collaborative innovation. As with our previous books, Voice to Voice will be published by Otter Press, have an ISBN and form part of the Library of Canada's permanent collection.

Our goal 

Our goal is to raise $6000 to create and publish 500 copies of a perfect-bound book-length anthology, Voice to Voice. But if we surpass that amount, we’ll use the funds for a subsequent book or reprintings of our popular chapbooks!

This is a fixed funding campaign which means we have to reach our entire goal or we get nothing. If we don't meet our goal of $6000 we will refund all contributions and no perks will be delivered.

Our printing costs are about $4000, design and layout about $1500. The extra $500 covers shipping and miscellany.

Publishing a book allows our members to participate in readings and literary events as authors. It's also pragmatic: each Collective member may buy the book at production cost and handsell the anthology for profit. 


Writing together and publishing our work is an act of self-determination and survival. “In a world where our ideas about the urban space are influenced by virtual reality, media and politically preferred images, the voice of a marginalized group is extremely valuable.” - writingplace.org

We hope you'll click through this page and support the Collective's creative, hard-working, award-winning writers. If you can donate, THANK YOU! 

If you are not able to contribute financially, we hope you might consider spreading the word. We look forward to seeing you at our launch!

PS: If you would like to donate and remain anonymous, you may. We appreciate your support. Also, you may choose to donate back the ""perk"" to the campaign.

Thank you to the talented and big-hearted team of Quinn Bennett, Creative Strategist + Communications Consultant, and Mateo J. Zepeda, Creative Strategist + Digital Storytelling Consultant, for developing the Indiegogo Campaign Strategy and Indiegogo Crowdfunding Video.

Who and What is Thursdays Writing Collective?Thursdays Writing Collective is a non profit organization that joyfully and raucously converts creativity into text in weekly creative writing sessions. We are more than 150 activists, academics, slam poets, novelists and storytellers who explore issues of self-determination through creative writing. Founded in 2008, the Collective holds free, drop-in writing sessions in Vancouver's Downtown Eastside at Carnegie Community Centre and performs at festivals, literary events and readings.
Despite challenges related to poverty, mental health, addiction and prejudice we’ve

published six books that have helped us connect with people in our Downtown Eastside neighbourhood, across Canada and throughout the US and Europe.  Our writers have won awards for their writing, been published in literary magazines such as Geist, Poetry is Dead, Megaphone's Literary Voices, been the subject of documentary videos, received highly competitive SSHRC university grants and small arts grants as well as major international governmental grants, have headlined at public readings, been invited to read at literary festivals, written and self-published books, signed book contracts with independent presses, edited books, newsletters and blogs and been active in arts initiatives of all sorts.You can read about us here: www.thursdayswritingcollective.ca or in this article on Rabble.ca, where they called us, “a small-but-mighty cultural force within the city… Taking part in a Thursdays session is an immersive experience, and an eye-opening one, too. This room is bursting with talent.”
With your help, we will publish our seventh anthology, Voice to Voice, in Spring 2015.

About Voice to VoiceVoice to Voice is the name of the book growing out of a year-long collaborative project of the same name between Thursdays Writing Collective, Instruments of Change (Laura Barron), UBC musicians and singers (Rena Sharon) and Ray Hsu. Beginning in Sep 2014 Thursdays Writing Collective will explore writing on the theme of music and transformation (of individuals, communities, ideas and creative endeavours). We’ll pass our poems, stories and texts to composers who will create original songs (for classical voice and piano) that will be performed in concert by trained musicians in June 2015.
Our book, Voice to Voice, will incorporate the musical scores of these works as well
as other written texts produced throughout the year by Thursdays Writing Collective

members.Although we are supported by institutions such as Carnegie Community Centre, Simon Fraser University and Canada Council for the Arts with funds and in-kind donations, we need help finding the money to publish on our own terms. In the past we have worked with ace designers and printers and have brought out beautiful books that push the edge of collaborative innovation. -Not-Forgotten: The Writer Who Overcame Anxiety and Depression
What is the book about?

-Not-Forgotten: The Writer Who Overcame Anxiety and Depression is about four individuals that I met during my last South American trip. A Writer, a Musician, an Old Sculptor, and a Nurse. These four had an extraordinary creativity and peculiarity that they used to fight their life problems. Their stories were simply majestic. And, although their stories are entirely true, I wrote the book using a poetic writing-style.
The Main Protagonist: The Writer

Amanda is an introverted girl who struggles with her speech. She can't communicate well with others because of her frequent anxiety attacks. Because of that, she doesn't have friends and family. This leads her to have several suicide attempts. However, she discovers the power of writing.
The Musician

Tania is an extroverted musician who is trying to get recognition in a world where musicians are not taken seriously. Her constant failures cause her to consider her life worthless and unimportant. Her life changes when she meets Amanda.

The Old Sculptor

Gaudencio Tómas is a Politician and an Sculptor. He dedicated his whole life to politics in order to save his country; however, he achieved nothing. He is diagnosed with terminal cancer and has only a few months left to live. Moreover his anxiety increases monumentally. Nonetheless, before his anxiety makes him insane, he decides to dedicate the rest of his life to inspire his fellow citizens for a political change. Then, he meets Amanda.
The Nurse
Eduarda is a young nurse. She believes that there is no ""bad"" in the real world.  However, her notions are shattered when several revolts take place. (Based in the recent Venezuelan Revolts)
Where are the funds going to?

As an inexperienced and new author, I didn't know a lot of things. In fact, I almost fell for a ""vanity publisher"". I know that being a new author is not an excuse for not knowing things that I should have known.
Now, thanks to numerous persons in my life, I was able to know more about the publishing industry and the publishing process; and I also got to know how much better it is to self-publish. 

And now, that I'm self-publishing, I also understand that I'm not an expert. I understand where I'm standing. And I also understand that I need the help of experts in order to do a professional work.  That's exactly where the funds are going.  The funds are in order to pay properly the professionals who will help me in the tasks listed above.
What Do You Get?
• If you contribute $1-5, you will receive a customized thank-you email. Or if you just want a normal thank-you email, that's also fine.

• If you contribute $10-15, you will receive a customized illustrations. You can ask me anything you want me to illustrate and I will do so. It can be your portrait or the portrait of a loved one. Or, a feeling, an emotion, a memory, a story. Anything you want me to illustrate.
• If you contribute $25, you will receive a PDF version of -Not-Forgotten , one week before the official launch release.
• If you contribute $50, you will receive a printed version of -Not-Forgotten, one week before the official launch release.
Other Ways You Can Help?
For
those of you who'd like to contribute but are unable to do so
financially, that's okay. Here's how you can help... and yes, it
will really help!
Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Let your Facebook friends know about this and give them the link.
And that’s all there is to it.
Sincerely yours,

Purpose

My gift is to be an inspiration of what's possible in the world, living from your heart through hope, faith and love. My plan is to bring my message to a greater audience. I've written a book which documents my jouryney to wholeness, healing and greater consciousness as told through a beautiuful French love story.
This campaign is important to me because it will help me take my message to a greater audience than I could ever achieve through my private practice or community work.
Visit my website for my bio and more details about the book- www.confessionsofalovedream.com.
Goal

My goal is to raise $10,00 to hire a professional national publicist to help me get interviews on national television and radio. It takes money to work with top name agents and promotial people who are well connected in this arena.

I've also had  enormous expenses in working with a professional editor, web design team, internet strategist, translator and more. I've worked very hard on this project for over four years, while also keeping two kids in college.
<div>
How You Can Help
1.  Spread the word!  Please tell your friends, post my info on facebook, twitter etc directing them to: confessionsofalovedream.com
2. Join Team Love Dream at confessionsofalovedream.com to see behind the scenes videos and get the latest news as to when the book will be published!

3. Make a contribution (of any size) to help support my success AND receive first edition signed copies of the book, limited edition tote bags and more! If you like, you can also make a tax-deductable dontation of books and tote bags to be given to a women's shelter or public library of your choice.
<div>
The Impact

This world is so hungry for authentic connection and what we see on national media is such a poor example of what's possible for humanity. After years of working on my own life as an example, I'd like to be visible as a voice for health, healing and wholeness. I'd like to stand as an example of what's possible for people when they use adversity to thrive in becoming more authentic.

The Words That Move You
Atlanta’s amazingly talented youth poets have
the esteemed opportunity to attend and compete in the Brave New Voices poetry
slam festival this summer. But to get there, we need your help! There are only
50 spots for teams at the competition, and Team Atlanta's invitation is contingent upon our
raising the money to register for and get to the competition. <b>We have already selected
a strong team of youth poets, and have experienced coaches and mentors training
and preparing them for the competition, but now we need the backing of our
community. And with your support, we’ll have the chance to put our southern city
on the literary map and our team of poets upon the finals stage.
So please consider contributing to the arts, to
youth in arts, and to the Atlanta spoken word movement by donating your money,
your time, your talent, and your love.
(Team Atlanta's youth poets, coaches, and mentors.                           -- Credit: Dwayne Boyd Photography)
More About Brave New Voices (BNV)
This summer, 6 dynamic young people from Atlanta will be
representing our city in the 2014 <a href=""http://youthspeaks.org/bravenewvoices/"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Brave New Voices International
Youth Poetry Slam Festival. For those who aren’t already aware, Brave New
Voices can best be likened to the youth poetry Olympics, which was first
organized in 1998 by YouthSpeaks and remains the largest ongoing
spoken word event in the world. Brave New Voices is so inspiring and impacting that<a href=""http://www.hbo.com/russell-simmons-presents-brave-new-voices#/"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">HBO
even made an entire series in 2010 about the participating teams preparing
for and competing in the festival. But even when not in the limelight, at its
core, Brave New Voices is a platform for over 1,000 youth poets from all across
the world to perform on an international stage and partake in fellowship with
one another.
This year, the 17th annual Brave New Voices will be hosted
in Philadelphia, PA from July 16-19. And for the 6<sup>th</sup> straight year, Atlanta
Word Works will be fielding the official Atlanta Team, hoping to surpass last

year’s achievement of verbally sparring in the semi-finals round. 


Meet Team Atlanta 2014
The top 6 youth poets from the greater Atlanta area have already
proven themselves in 2 local, qualifying slams, and now they’re primed and ready
to share their words with the world. Our 2014 team is comprised of the
brilliant minds and truthful poetics of these talented young people. Read

more about how awesome they are below.


The Youth Poets
Jai Amirrah Rodgers
Jai is an 18 year old Tri-Cities High School graduate who
will be attending Howard University in Washington, D.C. this fall. Though she
was born in Dallas, TX, she lives in East Point, GA with her
professional-singer mother, from whom she has inherited her own vocal talent.
Jai’s favorite things to do around town are sitting in her secret writing spot
on a shaded hill in Old Fourth Ward Park and eating her favorite hot lemon
pepper wings at one of Atlanta’s many American Delis, which she supplements
with a daily green apple and kale salad. Her favorite book is <u>The Skin I’m
In</u> by Sharon G. Flake, and she loves to watch historical documentaries. The
band that has influenced and inspired Jai the most is Paramore, citing their
“Misguided Ghosts” as her favorite song. Maya Angelou is her favorite poet
because she gave Jai a voice to believe in when she was still trying to find
her own. The first spoken word artist she’d ever heard of was Jasmine Mans, and
she has inspired Jai to keep writing ever since. Jai loves Atlanta Word Works for
helping her to uncover those things we all keep hidden, and she believes that

it is a place where one can find “healing through writing.”


Anthony Gagliardi

Anthony is
17 years old and attends Hillgrove High School in Powder Springs, GA. Despite
being born between the Powder Springs and Marietta areas, he loves the downtown
Atlanta space –especially at night or early in the morning – and he’s awed by the
energy and atmosphere in Little 5 Points. Anthony relates most to John Green’s
debut novel <u>Looking for Alaska</u>, and The Mountain Goats is his favorite
band, which he enjoys because of the lead singer’s longevity and consistency.
His favorite poet is Allen Ginsberg, and his favorite spoken word artist is Eric
Darby. Anthony specifically recalls Darby’s “Scratch and Dent Dreams” as the
first poem that drew him into the art of spoken word poetry.  Anthony thrives from living outside of his
comfort zone and building new friendships to take in new experiences, which is

why he likes being a member of Atlanta Word Works.

Jessica Vernon

Jessica is
a 17-year-old Southwest Dekalb High School graduate who will be attending
Georgia Southern University in the fall. She was born and raised in Atlanta, and
her favorite places to frequent are Little 5 Points and downtown. Not only is
Jessica a phenomenal writer, she is also a professional photographer. Of all the
books she has read, <u>Siddhartha</u> by Hermann Hesse has stimulated and
encouraged her the most, and the film version of <u>RENT</u> has influenced her
tremendously. Jessica’s favorite band is Coldplay, describing them as an
“honest and touching collective.” Walt Whitman is her favorite poet – as his
words often inspire her to be original and honest – and she is moved by the
unapologetic presence that Kai Davis provides by simply stepping on stage. More
than anything else, Jessica loves Atlanta Word Works because of the group’s love,

closeness, and that “it feels like family.”

Francisco Ormando Velasquez

Francisco is
a 16-year-old Shiloh High School student who plans to be enrolled in the Savannah
College of Art and Design by fall of next year. He’s an unexpected “underdog”
who is far more industrious than people typically perceive. He lives in
Snellville, not far from the landmark Stone Mountain, and his two favorite
spots in Atlanta are Atlantic Station at night and, as one might expect, standing
atop Stone Mountain. Francisco has been inspired by the storytelling in both
the book and the film adaptation of <u>The Wolf of Wall Street</u>, as originally
written by Jordan Belfort. The spoken word artist who has encouraged him the
most is Joshua Stewart, but Francisco has not settled on a favorite poet as of yet.
His favorite aspect of Atlanta Word Works is that “we all come from different
walks of life, but we all accept our differences,” and he is most excited for
the connections he now has the opportunity to make, not only through Atlanta

Word Works, but also with the various poets at Brave New Voices. 

Cole Xavier Jones-Ford

Cole is an 18-year-old graduate of Martin Luther King, Jr. High School who will
be attending Georgia State University in the fall. When he’s not writing poems,
you’ll likely find him somewhere in Atlanta sharpening his chess skills, and
one would expect nothing less from the president of the high school chess club,
which he also founded. Cole hails from the East Atlanta/Decatur region, and one
of his favorite places to frequent in the city is Atlantic Station, which he
enjoys for its open and inviting atmosphere. His favorite book, <u>Holes</u> by
Louis Sachar, is also his favorite movie, which Cole likes because the story
“centers on hope, faith, and the importance of friendship.” He cites Linkin
Park as his favorite band, and their song “Waiting for the End” as his most
loved. The poet from which Cole draws most of his inspiration is Kali Scurdy, and
his most revered spoken word artist is Christopher Wallace (better known by his
stage names Notorious B.I.G. or Biggie Smalls). Finally, the main thing Cole
likes about Atlanta Word Works is the group’s loving atmosphere, and that it truly
exists as a “safe zone.”

Ruby Gleber

Ruby is
an 18-year-old Habersham Central High School graduate from Gainesville, GA who
will be attending the Georgia Institute of Technology in the fall. She loves cross
fit training and also works a personal fitness trainer. Her favorite movie is <u>The
Rocky Horror Picture Show</u> simply because it “defies normalcy and crosses
boundaries.” Her most-loved musician and artist is Michael Jackson, and one of
her many favorite songs of his is “Human Nature.” <u>Siddhartha</u>, by Hermann
Hesse, is Ruby’s favorite book because the main character’s efforts of finding
peace within herself mirror those of her own. The revolutionist poet Pablo
Neruda has influenced Ruby mostly through his love poems, and the spoken word
artist Alysia Harris inspires her to have an insightful and creative
perspective of life. Above all else, what Ruby likes most about Atlanta Word
Works is “the honesty and immediate acceptance” the group extends to all its

members.


The Coaches

Natalie Cook: 21, Head Coach, AWW Founder and Executive Director

Natalie is a writer, performance artist, and
community organizer. She is currently an undergraduate student at the University
of Wisconsin-Madison where she is pursuing degrees in both English (Creative
Writing) and Afro-American Studies. Natalie is also a member of the First Wave Urban Arts program – the only
collegiate, hip-hop theatre ensemble and learning community of its kind in the
country.
Born and raised in Atlanta, Natalie
began showcasing her gift for poetry at a very young age. And because poetry
had such a positive impact on her life, she began laying the groundwork for Atlanta
Word Works when only sixteen in hopes that young people would find ways to
express themselves through creative writing and spoken word poetry, just as she
had.
Aside from teaching aspiring poets in Atlanta Word
Works, she has also taught numerous workshops in writing and spoken word at The Global Village, as well as at her
alma mater, the DeKalb School of the Arts. Natalie was once a competing member
of the Atlanta slam team she now coaches, has individually won several writing
contests and poetry slams, and has performed at many venues around the country
and across the globe. She has also shared the stage with artists such as John

the esteemed opportunity to attend and compete in the Brave New Voices poetry
slam festival this summer. But to get there, we need your help! There are only
50 spots for teams at the competition, and Team Atlanta's invitation is contingent upon our

More About Brave New Voices (BNV)
This summer, 6 dynamic young people from Atlanta will be
representing our city in the 2014 Brave New Voices International
Youth Poetry Slam Festival. For those who aren’t already aware, Brave New
Voices can best be likened to the youth poetry Olympics, which was first
organized in 1998 by YouthSpeaks and remains the largest ongoing
spoken word event in the world. Brave New Voices is so inspiring and impacting thatHBO
even made an entire series in 2010 about the participating teams preparing
for and competing in the festival. But even when not in the limelight, at its
core, Brave New Voices is a platform for over 1,000 youth poets from all across
the world to perform on an international stage and partake in fellowship with
one another.
This year, the 17th annual Brave New Voices will be hosted
in Philadelphia, PA from July 16-19. And for the 6th straight year, Atlanta
Word Works will be fielding the official Atlanta Team, hoping to surpass last
year’s achievement of verbally sparring in the semi-finals round. Meet Team Atlanta 2014
The top 6 youth poets from the greater Atlanta area have already
proven themselves in 2 local, qualifying slams, and now they’re primed and ready
to share their words with the world. Our 2014 team is comprised of the
brilliant minds and truthful poetics of these talented young people. Read

Nat. Brut (pr. nat broot) is a biannual journal of art and literature dedicated to advancing equality and inclusivity in all creative fields.

While gender representation in literary publishing may be gradually improving, it has by no means been solved, and it's still as serious a problem as ever in the fields of art and comics publishing.

We took a look through the table of contents in recent issues of three magazines on our shelves, and the proportions were troubling.

In an interview in Issue Five of Nat. Brut, novelist Merritt Tierce offers an eloquent summary of these concerns from her perspective as a writer, suggesting that “what is published, in contemporary fiction especially, is a myopically distorted view of reality. It’s too straight . . . too cis-het. And too white.”

____________________




All this being said, the publishing world has reached a tipping point. Organizations like VIDA and individuals who are experiencing these disparities on the front lines are working hard to raise public awareness and amplify the conversation, and the call to carve out safe spaces for marginalized voices is louder than ever. 

As for the question, “What can be done?”, in her 2014 essay, “Beyond the Measure of Men”, Roxane Gay puts it simply: “The solutions are obvious. Stop making excuses.” Nat. Brut wholeheartedly agrees with Gay’s assertion that change merely requires intent and effort. More importantly, writers, artists, and publishers who want to create this change for themselves must work together and push each other to do better.
At Nat. Brut, we strive to be mindful and inclusive in everything we do.

We strive for the highest standards in the quality of the content we publish, and in the social responsibility we hold as a publication. Fortunately, these two goals go hand in hand. Part of what makes our content so stunning is the array of diverse perspectives we feature.

Our magazine is a broadly interdisciplinary safe space. We publish short fiction,  poetry,  visual art,  comics,  found photos,  and artifacts from the public domain. Most of our staff and contributors are women, and we work hard to draw attention to voices that advance intersectional feminist perspectives.

____________________

Issue Six features new fiction by Morgan Jerkins, poetry by Adam Fitzgerald, art by Daniela Yohannes and Chitra Ganesh, a photo series by Kameelah Rasheed, an interview with Jayson Musson, and much more. 

    

   Sample pages from Issue Six / Cover art by Daniela Yohannes


All of our print issues are bundled with two supplements. Issue Six comes with a 18.5"" x 26"" fold-out poster featuring an all-female volume of our comics section, Early Edition, edited by Kayla E. and Whitney Taylor. This veritable mini-anthology includes work by some of the best emerging voices in alternative comics, including Amanda Baeza,  Maren Karlson,  Katie Parrish,  Lale Westvind,   Annie Mok,  Yumi Sakugawa,  Tyler Cohen,  and Meghan Turbitt, among many others.

Early Edition Vol. 4


. . . and a 32-page risograph-printed feminist re-mix of 1950s horror comics! Inspired by the Harvey Comics series Witches Tales, Kayla E. has re-drawn four comic stories from the public domain, and editor RL Goldberg has enlisted Stine An,  Carrie Guss,  Ashley Keyser,  and Meghan Lamb to re-write them. 

From editor RL Goldberg's introduction: ""[Witches Tales was] a comic series vilifying female empowerment and autonomy and, in its 50s logic, equaling feminist liberation with witchcraft. . . All of Them Witches reconfigures this delimitation and declares the aspirational female condition to be one in which women are able to provoke and desire, without abasement and without compromise.""

 Sample pages from All of Them Witches / Art by Kayla E.


We're also offering copies of Issue Five from our limited remaining stock. Issue Five features poetry by Camille Rankine, fiction by Koa Beck and Robyn O'Neil, art by Susan Te Kahurangi King and Trenton Doyle Hancock, and an interview with Merritt Tierce. It also comes bundled with a fold-out poster of Early Edition vol. 3 (co-curated by Kayla E. and Bill Kartalopoulos) and SALE!, a 32-page comic book-style alt-lit experiment full of side-splitting satirical advertisements by the likes of Alexis Wilkinson and Chris Ware.

Issue Five / Cover by Deborah Grant

If you select the Nat. Brut Deluxe Bundle, You'll also receive two bonus items from our very limited back-stock: Inspired by an exciting and disturbing road trip across the west coast, our Nat. Brut Out West Postcards come in a hand-packaged set of 15 and are printed on 100% recycled paper.
Set of 15 Nat. Brut Out West Postcards / Designed by Kayla E.

...and Kayla Sees America is a black and white, 24-page-comic by Kayla E. pairing street photographs of American cities taken by the artist and YouTube comments from videos about each corresponding city.
Kayla Sees America Mini-Comic by Kayla E.

At Nat. Brut, we promote environmental sustainability in both form and content. We use only 100% post-consumer recycled and FSC-certified materials for all of our printed products, and we make an effort to publish work and curate features that confront environmental issues. 

____________________



After moving into print earlier this year with Issue Five, we've learned through experience exactly how much we need to produce an issue. Each issue costs just over $8,000 to print, shipping runs about $1,300, and 7% of our donations go to our fiscal sponsor. Any further funding we receive is reserved for our Issue Six launch event. Our previous launch event  took place at Harvard University's Carpenter Center, and involved a film screening and a panel in which Kayla E., Alexis Wilkinson, Koa Beck, Phoebe Robinson, and Robyn O'Neil discussed gender disparities in their respective fields. We're currently planning a launch event for Issue Six, which will take place in New York City this October.

Lto R:  Alexis Wilkinson,  Kayla E.,  Koa Beck,  Phoebe Robinson,  Robyn O'Neil


We recently gained 501(c)(3) status through fiscal sponsorship with our umbrella organization, Fractured Atlas, which means all of your donations are tax-deductible. It will take us about a year to benefit from this status by securing grants to offset our production costs, but in the meantime, we rely solely on your readership.

Earlier this year, we successfully crowdfunded the printing of our fifth issue. We've since since developed a strong relationship with our eco-friendly printer in Canada, The Prolific Group, and what was a handful of staff members has grown into a passionate team of 20 skilled professionals who have served as editors, publishers, and art directors for magazines such as The Harvard Lampoon and The Harvard Advocate.

Nat. Brut has always been, and continues to be, a labor of love. All of our staff members are volunteers who are dedicated to creating the change we want to see, and working together to carve out a safe space that we want to be a part of. 

By supporting Nat. Brut, you’re helping us improve the standard of art, literature, and comics publishing. 

____________________

If you believe in what we're doing, please share our campaign! Use the Facebook and Twitter buttons in the sidebar to the left to spread the word, and be a part of the responsible future of art and literature.

Issue Six comes with a 18.5"" x 26"" fold-out poster featuring an all-female volume of our comics section, Early Edition, edited by Kayla E. and Whitney Taylor. This veritable mini-anthology includes work by some of the best emerging voices in alternative comics, including Amanda Baeza,  Maren Karlson,  Katie Parrish,  Lale Westvind,   Annie Mok,  Yumi Sakugawa,  Tyler Cohen,  and Meghan Turbitt, among many others.Early Edition Vol. 4. . . and a 32-page risograph-printed feminist re-mix of 1950s horror comics! Inspired by the Harvey Comics series Witches Tales, Kayla E. has re-drawn four comic stories from the public domain, and editor RL Goldberg has enlisted Stine An,  Carrie Guss,  Ashley Keyser,  and Meghan Lamb to re-write them. From editor RL Goldberg's introduction: ""[Witches Tales was] a comic series vilifying female empowerment and autonomy and, in its 50s logic, equaling feminist liberation with witchcraft. . . All of Them Witches reconfigures this delimitation and declares the aspirational female condition to be one in which women are able to provoke and desire, without abasement and without compromise."" Sample pages from All of Them Witches / Art by Kayla E.We're also offering copies of Issue Five from our limited remaining stock. Issue Five features poetry by Camille Rankine, fiction by Koa Beck and Robyn O'Neil, art by Susan Te Kahurangi King and Trenton Doyle Hancock, and an interview with Merritt Tierce. It also comes bundled with a fold-out poster of Early Edition vol. 3 (co-curated by Kayla E. and Bill Kartalopoulos) and SALE!, a 32-page comic book-style alt-lit experiment full of side-splitting satirical advertisements by the likes of Alexis Wilkinson and Chris Ware.Issue Five / Cover by Deborah Grant

If you select the Nat. Brut Deluxe Bundle, You'll also receive two bonus items from our very limited back-stock: Inspired by an exciting and disturbing road trip across the west coast, our Nat. Brut Out West Postcards come in a hand-packaged set of 15 and are printed on 100% recycled paper.
Set of 15 Nat. Brut Out West Postcards / Designed by Kayla E.

...and Kayla Sees America is a black and white, 24-page-comic by Kayla E. pairing street photographs of American cities taken by the artist and YouTube comments from videos about each corresponding city.
Kayla Sees America Mini-Comic by Kayla E.

At Nat. Brut, we promote environmental sustainability in both form and content. We use only 100% post-consumer recycled and FSC-certified materials for all of our printed products, and we make an effort to publish work and curate features that confront environmental issues. ____________________After moving into print earlier this year with Issue Five, we've learned through experience exactly how much we need to produce an issue. Each issue costs just over $8,000 to print, shipping runs about $1,300, and 7% of our donations go to our fiscal sponsor. Any further funding we receive is reserved for our Issue Six launch event. Our previous launch event  took place at Harvard University's Carpenter Center, and involved a film screening and a panel in which Kayla E., Alexis Wilkinson, Koa Beck, Phoebe Robinson, and Robyn O'Neil discussed gender disparities in their respective fields. We're currently planning a launch event for Issue Six, which will take place in New York City this October.Lto R:  Alexis Wilkinson,  Kayla E.,  Koa Beck,  Phoebe Robinson,  Robyn O'NeilWe recently gained 501(c)(3) status through fiscal sponsorship with our umbrella organization, Fractured Atlas, which means all of your donations are tax-deductible. Brut has always been, and continues to be, a labor of love. All of our staff members are volunteers who are dedicated to creating the change we want to see, and working together to carve out a safe space that we want to be a part of. By supporting Nat. Brut, you’re helping us improve the standard of art, literature, and comics publishing. ____________________

EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL FAMILIES

LGBTIQ* families (defined as families where at least one parent self-identifies as lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, intersex or queer) live all over the world. As diverse as the societal and political situation may be, recognition and equal rights are a basic necessity for all families. This annual report introduces the organisations involved in the International Family Equality Day as well as the work done by the IFED Committee and highlights the activities that were held in the different countries to celebrate this day. It also aims to serve as an inspiration for the fifth IFED, which will take place 1 May 2016 and for LGBTIQ* parents, LGBTIQ* activists and other interested parties to get involved in the
struggle for equality and recognition for rainbow families the world over.

HOW TO STRENGTHEN LGBTIQ* FAMILIESThe IFED Annual Report 2015 will be used as a practical tool to address lobbying strategies and as a means to strengthen the visibility of rainbow families around the world. It can be used to forge alliances with other family organisations as well as with policymakers and the authorities towards the goal of recognition for all families. The collective solidarity should be strengthened in collaboration with different family forms because together, we are strong.


International Family Equality Day (IFED) in the European Parliament in Brussels. This was the first time IFED was celebrated in
the European Parliament. The event was made possible with the support of
the Intergroup on LGBT Rights of the European Parliament.

WHERE YOUR DONATION WILL GO

We will use your donation for the cost of printing the IFED Annual Report 2015 to enable us to hand it over personally to authorities, experts, LGBT activists, human rights experts and politicians in the course of our advocacy work. In the picture below we had the opportunity to hand the IFED Annual Report 2014 to Yooomi Rënstrom, Current Affairs Committee (Council of Europe) and the U.S. Department of State’s first-ever Special Envoy for the Human Rights of LGBT Persons, Mr. Randy W. Berry, personally.
IFED Annual Report 2015

We look forward to sharing the IFED Annual Report 2015. It will allow us to forge alliances with representatives from public services, institutions and politics in our struggle for recognition of all families. This year the IFED was celebrated in 67 Towns in 32 Countries worldwide.

WHAT WE WILL ACHIEVE

Through visibility and the promotion of research on same-sex families we will be able to break down prejudices and at the same time strengthen and empower families, authorities, politicians and experts.

Thank you so much for your help.

Yours cordially,
The International Family Equality Day (IFED) Network

Canada: LGBT Family Coalition & LGBTQ Parenting Network
Europe: Network of European LGBT Families Associations (NELFA)
East Asia: Japan Rainbow Family
USA: Family Equality Council
Western Asia: The Keshetfamilies & The Association of Israeli Gay Fathers

Hello Dear Ones,

Have you ever wondered what happened to kindness, to love and to gratitude in today’s society? Have you ever thought about how to make our world a better place for all so that our children, our future leaders, will live in a respectful and dignified world? Have you ever thought about imparting wisdom and understanding to both children and adults alike? If so, you know either consciously or not, that you are on this planet for a special reason; and it is why you were guided to this Campaign.
Who am I? What is my mission? Why now?

My name is Marilyne Woodsmall. I began asking these questions decades ago. In my work as an International Trainer, professional Behavioral Modeler, Author, Mind Coach®, Speaker, and Expert in Human Typological Studies, I have addressed these issues using my knowledge and wisdom to help others grow to new levels of being. This has always been and continues to be my mission and passion!

I know that understanding is the key to all learning. And it is my goal to impart this wisdom and understanding in a variety of contexts and content in my writing, coaching and in my teaching. In so doing, I help people enhance their knowledge base and performance, remove behavioral blocks, and connect to their true mission in life. And I have known that the other part of my mission has to do with guiding children to be enlightened future leaders who are creative, who are able to think critically and who operate out of the heart center with respect, integrity and dignity. My book, Alphabet Angels™, and the Alphabet Angels™ Coloring Book for which I am fundraising in this Campaign, is an integral part of my mission.

So, I welcome you with heartfelt, gracious gratitude to my Alphabet Angels™ Indiegogo Campaign! By contributing to my passionate mission, you are participating in my movement to bring hope and to spread kindness around the globe one person at a time, and in particular to a group of courageous, precious children….to the amazing, young cancer patients at St. Jude’s Children's Research Hospital!

By donating my Alphabet Angels™ Book and Alphabet Angels™ Coloring Book, your Act of Kindness will leave its mark by giving back, and offering them the Light of Hope, the Beauty of Divine Grace, the Power of Divine Love, the Blessing of Angelic Support, the Joy of Appreciation, the Expression of your Gratitude and the Power of Healing!

Your contributions will be used for the printing and shipping of these books. You are also doing your part in shifting global consciousness as Alphabet Angels™ brings upliftment to all! This Campaign is my personal Act of Kindness that will spark a wave of kindness among all those who take part…

You will also be helping children to learn the Alphabet by means of angelically inspired verses which express what I call the simple, basic “Truths of Being” which are enhanced with beautiful Winged Letters! There is so much more to my personal mission, which you will come to understand as you listen to my audio presentation.

In my heart, I know that the time has come for this work to be out in the world. Alphabet Angels™ was from the very start, a major element in my desire to contribute to the world as part of my life mission. For almost thirty years, my work has involved intellectual subject matter in my writings, teachings as a professional Behavioral Modeler, and expert in human typologies and learning.  My work in modeling involves decoding what experts do on an unconscious level (hence, I am known as “the expert on experts.” In most of my work, I have always combined the behavioral with the spiritual, left brain with right brain. Interestingly, Alphabet Angels™ was born in the middle of an analytic task that was not at all connected to Angelic inspiration.

This book came about for a special reason. I totally believe that there are no coincidences in life…there is only Divine Timing! And for this reason, I know that given the current state of affairs in the world, with the growing violence and hatred, and the utter disconnect that exists among people in all walks of life, that the timing of this Fundraising Campaign is happening exactly when it is supposed to be. In fact, it is twenty years ago today, on 2/22, February 22, 1998, that I was inspired to write this work. And I can tell you from experience over the years, that you will now begin to notice the number 222 more and more, and in places and at times that you might not have imagined before….

Alphabet Angels™ is part of a series of books and audios that I have created over the years to inspire both children and adults to higher levels of being, to engender what I have always referred to as “The New Way of Being.” It is a new paradigm, a new essence for thinking, for doing, for understanding, for seeing, and, most importantly, for being.
So why now?

As always, it is truly Divine Timing perfectly at work because Alphabet Angels™ is coming out at a time when the world really needs it. There is so much discord, disrespect, incivility, and hatred appearing in many different forms throughout our society. There is great turmoil and more and more violence on the world stage with each new day. As frustrating as it was to me to have written this book so long ago and not get it out into the public at that time, it was, in fact, the Angelic Kingdom that made it very clear that 1998 was not to be the date of publication.

Our world is now at a crossroads of the battle between the forces of Light and Dark. At present, we are living in an extremely challenging, muddled, and confused reality on all levels: socially, politically, culturally, and educationally. More than ever, people everywhere need to be reminded of the power and importance of kindness, eternal love, and compassion towards all life.

We are confronted every second of every day with the challenges of technological advances. We live in a world in which technology has accomplished some incredibly wonderful things. At the same time, technological advances have manipulated the minds of so many young and old (and particularly teens and young adults) to the point where reality and fantasy are no long distinguishable.

The popularity of video games has negatively impacted our youth such that some (more and more) are turning to violent behavior at school, in the home and elsewhere. We are bombarded on all levels with images of that which is “unreal” from a spiritual perspective. We live in a culture that respects all that is not true reality, where the masses are programmed to adore all that is fake and devoid of dignity and meaning.
Alphabet Angels™ shines the Light of Hope!

Just as disconcerting is the fact that with the onset of gadgets and cell phones, tablets, and the like, we are connecting less and less with our hearts. Human beings are totally disconnected from one another. We are encouraging Duality Consciousness. We are ignoring that special place within us, which I call the “sacred space” that embodies our Essence qualities of Being. People are in their own little worlds, at times, totally isolated from each other because technology has replaced real time heart to heart connection. Have you ever noticed people eating at a restaurant with cell phones in hand, not even talking to each other? Teens, young children and of course, many adults, have lost that ever so precious human connection. This is insane! The time has come to reconnect with one another, to express unity consciousness, and to reestablish the all-important bonds of true friendship and family, and to connect on a higher level to shift global consciousness one person at a time by spreading positive vibrations!
Alphabet Angels™ shines the Light of Hope!

A big part of my Mission is to support parents as they take on the greatest responsibility of their lives: raising a child with love and to teach them the path to powerful personal growth evolution where they can make a positive difference in the world. Alphabet Angels™ teaches children the alphabet using angelically inspired verses that reflect simple, basic Truths of Being that embody the all-important life qualities of kindness, gratitude, respect, integrity, dignity, and more. It is our duty to teach children manners and responsibility for their actions. It is important both to explain things and to teach your children for understanding, and to do so in a kind way. We are living in the most challenging times to raise children, and they need love and guidance more than ever before. May Alphabet Angels™ serve as a guide for “being” as you teach your children and others the alphabet and the Essence Qualities.

Alphabet Angels™ elegantly transforms the letters of the alphabet into beautiful Winged Letters. In turn, each letter represents a quality of being which is not only manifest among the heavenly Angels...Each winged letter also embodies the innate qualities and values that children, who are some of our terrestrial angels, exhibit when they come into this life before exposure to negative societal influences.

So, how can you help get the message out by supporting this Campaign? You have several ways to “Spread Your Kindness”! You can donate books and coloring books to St. Jude’s Children's Research Hospital. You can buy them for your family and friends. You can also participate by spreading the word to your loved ones and even to people you don’t know well. Remember this is about performing an Act of Kindness in whatever way you see fit!

You may also donate to my Mission by choosing to have a personal coaching session with me, the Mind Coach® in the context of your choice: performance enhancement, eliminating emotional obstacles, building self-esteem, personal growth, parenting, values, entrepreneurship, behavioral change, spirituality, learning, cultural change, discovering your personal typological template, or other areas of my work and expertise over the years. You can even have dinner with me and my husband, experience my personalized coaching and receive autographed copies of my other books! Even if you don’t choose to donate books to St. Jude’s or buy them for yourself, you can also contribute by sending positive thoughts and energetic support to the success of this Alphabet Angels™ Campaign!

Most of all, trust your Inner Knowing and you will do what you are meant to do!  I invite you to be creative!  Share it with friends, teachers, parents, talk to your hair stylist, to people at the grocery store, to fellow students, business associates and to all those who cross your path! Remember that you are spreading a powerful vibration in so doing! Remember, too, that whatever Act of Kindness you choose with the Alphabet Angels™ Campaign, it is wonderful in itself, in that it is a reflection of your personal goodness! I believe that it expresses your appreciation of the precious nature of life in all of its wonder. Remember that your gesture will contribute to the printing of these books so that we can bring hope and joy and love to the Children of St. Jude’s and to all those who would like to be reminded of our innate Essence Qualities: kindness, goodness, compassion, gratitude, eternal love, truth and Dignity!
Be uplifted and part of a noble cause to create a unified world in which mutual love and respect prevail!
Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
Spread your Kindness!
DEDICATION
This book is dedicated to all of the precious children
of our planet who are the lightbearers
of love, integrity, and kindness
to guide us through the continuum of time and space…
past, present, and future, all one…
MW 2-22
Be part of this Mission! Spread Your Kindness!
With Love, Gratitude and Angelic Blessings to all,
Marilyne Woodsmall

In 2013, Harley-Davidson will celebrate its 110th Anniversary with a series of international rallies demonstrating how motorcycles bring people of all backgrounds together with a sense of fun and freedom.

As an automotive editor and motorcycle journalist, I would love to document this amazing year in prose and photographs. From India to Italy, South Africa to Australia, I'd attend and ride in those international rallies, talking to the locals and those who also traveled to the event. I'd also share my own travel experiences from the back of a motorcycle.

Informe de La Piel del Desierto (nov 2013)

Como todos ustedes saben “La Piel del Desierto” empezó como un proyecto con una clara idea política que implica editar, de manera absolutamente independiente y autogestiva, la crónica literaria con el mismo nombre; adherirse a la defensa del desierto sagrado de Wirikuta; y dedicar la mitad de lo ganado de la venta del tiraje de 1,000 ejemplares a la recuperación de la inversión por parte del equipo de “La Piel del Desierto”, y la otra mitad al cuidado de los centros ceremoniales wixaritari. Nuestra intención era publicar el primer tiraje de mil ejemplares de la crónica en octubre. Sin embargo, aunque hasta la fecha no se han podido recaudar los fondos necesarios para la impresión del libro (alrededor de 110,000 pesos mexicanos u 8,400 USD) , el proyecto ha avanzado de manera más que notable.

En alrededor de 4 meses se han conseguido los fondos para cubrir la impresión de nuestros pósters, postales y playeras, la totalidad de los costos de diseño y de traducción al inglés, y aproximadamente la mitad de los fondos necesarios para subsanar la impresión de los 1,000 ejemplares del libro. Todo ello gracias a la participación de alrededor de 100 personas.

Nuestras finanzas son abiertas para los coeditores y colaboradores. Al convertirte en coeditor recibes un enlace que te permite revisar los ingresos pagados, los pendientes verificados, y los egresos correspondientes.

Por otra parte, aunque el trabajo ha sido arduo, “La Piel del Desierto” ha logrado darse a conocer exitosamente en diversos medios como las redes sociales, el radio y en entrevistas con diversos medios:
https://soundcloud.com/user860007912/entrevistaenelabcradio
https://soundcloud.com/user860007912/lapieldeldesiertoen1079
https://soundcloud.com/user860007912/compartiendo5julio2013edit
http://cuartoscuro.com.mx/2013/08/lapieldeldesierto/

Simposios académicos sobre arte y política en El Instituto de Artes de Hidalgo:
http://on.fb.me/1apfLCf

Eventos nacionales de fotografía como “Foto 13” en Tlaxcala:
http://camara.cc/foto13festivaldelaimagenentlaxcala/
Pláticas y conferencias en la facultad de filosofía y letras y de ciencias en la UNAM en México.

Uno de los avances más importantes es que la galería de arte Huichol ""Arte Yawí"" (http://www.arteyawi.com/ ), el café y galería de arte ""Terrascalli"" (http://www.terrescalli.com/ ), varios comerciantes de artesanía wixárrika, y alrededor de una decena de persona se han solidarizado para promover y distribuir el material de “La Piel del Desierto"". Recientemente, la “Minnning Watch Canada” se ha ofrecido para difundir el proyecto.

La recepción de nuestras postales, pósters y playeras ha sido tan buena que nuestros artículos, por sí mismos, ya configuran un proyecto autosustentable, que combina la literatura, la fotografía, la política y la edición independiente. Muy pronto tendremos también tazas de “La Piel del Desierto”.

Después de una reestructuración, hemos decidido que ""La Piel del Desierto"" se transforme en un proyecto permanente en el que realizamos comercio de nuestros artículos con el fin de obtener recursos en primera instancia para la publicación impresa del libro (la versión electrónica será como desde el inicio se prometió de acceso abierto), pero de manera permanente para la obtención de fondos para el colectivo y las comunidades wixaritari.

Sin embargo, dado que la impresión del libro puede tardar aún algunos meses, nos sentimos obligados a pedirle a nuestros coeditores paciencia. Por supuesto, todos los coeditores que adquieren paquetes que incluyen sólo posters, playeras o postales reciben de manera inmediata sus artículos. Asimismo, los que compran paquetes con el libro y otros materiales, recibirán a la brevedad todos su artículos con excepción del libro impreso. Los que decidan comprar a precio de preventa el libro les enviaremos próximamente la versión digital de la crónica mientras logramos imprimir el libro.

Sin embargo, pese a nuestros esfuerzos, el principal problema al que nos enfrentamos es la falta de una estructura amplia de difusión, distribución y venta. Es por eso que decidimos realizar la siguiente convocatoria (http://bit.ly/1fYGFcu) .

Finalmente, los invitamos cordialmente a que nos sigan acompañando en este proyecto de emancipación por el respeto de los lugares sagrados del pueblo wixárika y la creación artística comprometida con los conflictos sociales de nuestra sociedad. Asimismo, los invitamos a que sigan adquiriendo los artículos de “La Piel del Desierto” y, si así lo desean, a atender a la convocatoria arriba sugerida y convertirse en colaboradores especiales de “La Piel del Desierto”.
Si quieres adquirir algunos de estos artículos lo puedes hacer aquí (http://bit.ly/1dKRz5a) o aquí (http://lapieldeldesierto.com/galeria.html).

** English Version **
What is “The Skin of the Desert”?

""The Skin of the Desert"" is the title of a photo-literary chronicle in a bilingual edition (Spanish-English). This chronicle tells the story of what happened during the ""Traditional Report"" conducted by the representatives of the wixárika people (Huichol) in the Cerro Quemado, near the Mexican town of Real de Catorce, on the 6th and 7th of February, 2012.

In this work, by means of rigorous inquiries, artistic convictions and a highly respectful attitude towards the wixárika culture, we combine the possibilities of visual and literary languages to raise awareness on the wixárika people's rich worldview and defend the bio-cultural magnificence of Wirikuta.
What happened during the wixárika ""Traditional Report""?

For the first time representatives of all communities set out on a pilgrimage to Cerro Quemado to consult their deities on the steps to be taken with regard to the exploitation of the sacred area by mining and agro-industrial companies.

Having consulted with their deities, the wixaritari announced the alliance of all communities to fight against and prevent the establishment of any industry that would threaten the bio-cultural heritage of the sacred area of Wirikuta.
Who is behind “The Skin of the Desert”?

“The Skin of the Desert” is possible because of the work of a group of a group of people scattered across different countries (Belgium, England, Canada and Mexico, among others) working on the project under the name of ""Colectivo Carcoma"".

The authors of the chronicle are Luis Ramírez Trejo and Christian Palma Montaño. In addition to the authors, many people collaborate on the project. Fabian Espinosa is in charge of the art design for the book and the website, the English translation is done by Laura Vega Meyer, and Tine Defoor and Coyle Lindy work on the promotion of the project.
If you are interested in our professional background, you can se the link “about us” in our page lapieldeldesierto.com.
The Project has the consent and support of ""Frente de Defensa de Wirikuta"" (Wirikuta Defense Front) from which the ""Consejo Regional Wixárika"" (Wixárika Regional Council) is part of.
What is the political intention of “The Skin of the Desert”

“Colectivo Carcoma"", far from hiding under some supposed neutrality, joins in the struggle to put value on the rich cultural heritage of the wixaritari and defend the sacred desert of Wirikuta. That is the reason because, after paying for the publishing costs, 50% of the proceeds obtained during the raising fund campaign and from the total sale of the book and promotional items will be directly donated for the care of the wixaritari ceremonial centres, and for the support of projects managed by the wixárika communities.

We, the ""Colectivo Carcoma"", in one way or another share the view that the opportunity to change the world rests more on the drive and responsibility of those who take their ideals seriously, rather than on the dreams and goodwill that pile up on the shelves of oblivion.
What is the publishing policy of “The Skin of the Desert”?

The chronicle will be openly published with a Creative Commons license. In an effort to spread the work as widely as possible, the chapters of the book will be released periodically during the fundraising campaign. On launch day the last chapter of the book is to be released and that will make ""The Skin of the Desert"" fully available in PDF format so that all those interested can access it freely, the only requirement being an internet connection.
What do we need?

The publication of all the material demands a minimum investment of about €7,500 or $10,000 USD. A much comfortable estimate reaches the €8,700 or $11,300 USD. If we succeed in raising more money, we can improve substantially the quality of the book (e.g. we can make a book with a beautiful hard cover).
What are the specifications for the book and the promo items?

The book will be published in a square format (25 x 25 cm). It has 140 pages made from couché paper of at least 130 gr. and printed in full color. (The amount of pages may be different depending from the final printing requirements).
Post cards will be printed in couché paper of 300 gr. (9 x 5 cms).
Posters will be printed in sulfatade paper (35 x 45 cm).
You will be able to choose t-shirts among several design in sizes small, medium and large.
During this raising fund campaign, we will publish pictures of all promo ítems.

** Versión en Español **
¿Qué es “La Piel del desierto”?

""La piel del desierto"" es el título de un libro con una crónica fotográfico-literaria en edición bilingüe (Español-Inglés) sobre el ""Peritaje Tradicional"" llevado a cabo por los representantes del pueblo wixárika (Huicholes), los días seis y siete de febrero del 2012, en el Cerro Quemado cerca del pueblo mexicano de Real de Catorce.

En este trabajo, mediante una indagación rigurosa, una convicción artística y una actitud llena de respeto hacia la cultura wixárika, compaginamos las posibilidades de los lenguajes visual y literario para difundir la rica cosmovisión del pueblo wixárika y defender la riqueza bio-cultural de Wirikuta.
¿Qué pasó en el “Peritaje Tradicional” de los wixaritari?

Por primera vez todos los representantes de las comunidades del pueblo wixárika (Huicholes) peregrinaron de manera conjunta al Cerro Quemado para consultar a sus divinidades sobre las medidas a tomar con respecto a la explotación del área por parte de las compañías mineras y agroindustriales.
Después de la consulta con sus deidades, los wixaritari anunciaron la unión de todas las comunidades para luchar contra las mineras y evitar la instalación de cualquier industria que atente en contra del patrimonio bio-cultural del área sagrada de Wirikuta.
¿Quiénes hacen “La Piel del Desierto”?

“La Piel del Desierto” es posible gracias a un grupo de personas, residentes en varios países (Bélgica, Inglaterra, Canadá y México, entre otros) que colaboran bajo la rúbrica del ""Colectivo Carcoma"".

Los autores de la crónica son Luis Ramírez Trejo (escritor) y Christian Palma Montaño (fotógrafo). Además de los autores, mucha gente colabora en el proyecto. El diseño de arte final del libro y la página web corre a cargo de Fabian Espinosa. La traducción al inglés la lleva a cabo Laura Vega Meyer. Tine Defoor y Lindy Coyle participan en la promoción y difusión del proyecto.
Si quieres saber más de nuestra trayectoria puedes consultar la sección “quiénes somos” en nuestra página oficial: lapieldeldesierto.com.
El proyecto recibe la anuencia y el acompañamiento del Frente en Defensa de Wirikuta del que forma parte el Consejo Regional Wixárika.
¿Cuál es la intención política de “La Piel del Desierto?

""Colectivo Carcoma"", lejos de esconderse bajo alguna supuesta neutralidad, se suma con este proyecto a la lucha por valorar la herencia cultural de los wixaritari y por defender al desierto sagrado de Wirikuta. Es por ello que, una vez cubiertos los costos de la edición del material, el 50% de lo recaudado y de la venta total del libro y los artículos de promoción se canalizará de manera directa al cuidado de los centros ceremoniales wixaritari, y al apoyo de proyectos gestionados por las comunidades wixárika.

En el ""Colectivo Carcoma"" compartimos, de una u otra forma, la idea de que la posibilidad de cambiar el mundo se encuentra más en la decisión y la responsabilidad de quienes toman en serio sus ideales, que en los sueños y buenos deseos que se enmohecen en los anaqueles de la desidia.
¿Cuál es la política de publicación de “La Piel del Desierto”?

El libro se publicará bajo un esquema de contenidos abiertos y una licencia Creative Commons. En un esfuerzo por difundir lo más posible este trabajo, los capítulos del libro serán liberados periódicamente durante la campaña de recaudación de fondos. El día del lanzamiento del libro se liberará el último capítulo y eso hará que “La Piel del Desierto” se encuentre disponible íntegramente en formato PDF para que todo aquél que lo desee —y que tenga acceso a Internet— pueda adquirirlo gratuitamente.
¿Qué necesitamos?

La publicación de todo el material requiere una cantidad mínima de unos 137.000 pesos mexicanos, 10.340 dólares estadounidenses o 7,800 euros. Un estimado mucho más cómodo y nuestra meta real es de 150.000 pesos mexicanos, 11,300 dólares estadounidenses u 8.700 euros. Si logramos recaudar más dinero podremos mejorar la calidad del libro (la portada puede ser en tapa dura, por ejemplo).
¿Cómo va a ser el libro y el resto del material?

El formato del libro es: 25 x 25 cm aproximadamente, 140 páginas (esto puede cambiar dependiendo de los requerimientos finales de impresión), papel tipo couché de al menos 130 grs, impresión a todo color.
Las medidas de las postales serán impresas en papel couché de 300 gramos (9 x 5 cms).
Los posters son en cartulina sulfatada de 12 puntos 35 x 45 cm.
Las playeras podrán ser elegidas en las siguientes medidas (chica, mediana, grande). Habrá varios diseños a elegir.
Durante la campaña publicaremos fotos de muestras de cada uno de los materiales de promoción.
