","La ""Asociación Lucha de Clases"" está orgullosa de presentar una obra que tardó 80 años en ser producida. La obra maestra inacabada de Trotsky, “Stalin”. Traducida directamente de la edición inglesa publicada por Wellred Books en julio de 2016.El 20 de agosto de 1940 la vida de Trotsky fue brutalmente apagada cuando un agente estalinista hundió un piolet sobre su cabeza. Entre las obras que dejó sin terminar se encontraba la segunda parte de su biografía sobre Stalin. El Stalin de Trotsky es una obra única en la literatura marxista en la que intenta explicar algunos de los acontecimientos más decisivos del siglo XX, no sólo en términos de las transformaciones económicas y sociales que forjaron la época, sino de la psicología individual de uno de los protagonistas de un gran drama histórico. Es un estudio fascinante del modo en que  el carácter peculiar de un individuo, sus trazos y psicología individuales, interactúa con los grandes acontecimientos.  ¿Cómo pudo ser que Stalin, que comenzó su vida política como un revolucionario bolchevique, terminara como un tirano y un monstruo? ¿Estaba esto predeterminado por factores genéticos o por las vivencias de su infancia? Extrayendo una masa de material reunido cuidadosamente de sus archivos personales y de otras fuentes, Trotsky proporciona la respuesta a estas preguntas.En la actual edición hemos reunido todo el material que estaba disponible en los archivos de Trotsky en inglés junto a material suplementario traducido del ruso. Es la versión más completa del libro que se haya publicado nunca. En el centenario de la Revolución de Octubre, creemos que Stalin, de Trotsky, es más relevante e inspirador que nunca.LA HISTORIA DE LA BIOGRAFÍA INACABADA DE STALIN, DE LEÓN TROTSKYPor Rob SewellEl libro ""Stalin"", de León Trotsky, fue encargado por la editorial Harper Brothers de Nueva York en febrero de 1938 y se publicó por primera vez en inglés en 1946. “Stalin” fue la última obra importante de Trotsky. Sin embargo, su vida se vio truncada por un asesino estalinista el 20 de agosto de 1940. El libro nunca fue terminado.Mientras Trotsky trabajaba en el libro, el manuscrito estaba siendo traducido al inglés por Charles Malamud. Tras su asesinato, los manuscritos inacabados fueron entregados a Malamud, no sólo para la traducción, sino en realidad para editar el trabajo para su publicación. Cualquiera que fuera el talento de Malamud, esta era una tarea política para la cual era completamente inadecuado. Cuando el libro se publicó finalmente, la nueva versión ""corregida"" contenía grandes trozos de material insertados por el editor, que eran claramente una violación del pensamiento político de Trotsky. Pese a las protestas indignadas de la viuda de Trotsky, Natalia Sedova, el material ofensivo fue mantenido por los editores.La razón principal para la reedición de esta edición recientemente ampliada del Stalin de Trotsky es poner fin a esta violación e insertar el material que fue excluido por el editor. Este proyecto de volver a publicar el Stalin original de Trotsky en esta forma actualizada ha llevado más de una década para su edición. El volumen elimina las inserciones políticas de Malamud, que ascendieron a más de diez mil palabras, y restaura el manuscrito original a partir del material inédito de los archivos de Trotsky depositados en la Universidad de Harvard.

Montaje contemporáneo de los líderes bolcheviques de la revolución. Nota: Stalin no está incluido. Cortesía de David KingEsta nueva edición es la más completa que haya sido publicada nunca en ningún idioma, incluyendo el inglés o el ruso, y ha aumentado el tamaño en comparación con el original en más de un treinta por ciento. Representa el trabajo más extenso jamás realizado para ""reconstruir"" el libro, y comprende casi cien mil más palabras más que la edición original de 1946. Malamud explicó que él había dejado tal cual estaban los primeros siete capítulos, ""a excepción de unas pocas eliminaciones de material repetitivo"". Nos hemos tomado la libertad de restaurar este material lo mejor que hemos podido. En lugar de seguir la disposición de Malamud, hemos elegido nuestro propio criterio, siguiendo la cronología de los acontecimientos. La edición de este material para asegurar su máxima continuidad fue llevada a cabo por Alan Woods, que también tradujo el grueso del material en ruso. Los archivos de Trotsky En el año 2003, mientras estaba en un viaje político por los Estados Unidos, visité Boston y aproveché para visitar los archivos de Trotsky en la universidad cercana. Trotsky había acordado que el material fuera enviado a Harvard para su custodia. ""Los archivos se van [a Estados Unidos] esta mañana en el tren"", escribió Trotsky el 17 de julio de 1940, poco más de un mes antes de su asesinato. (Suplemento de los Escritos de 1934-1940, p.863) Me sorprendió la gran cantidad de material contenido en el archivo. Me llamó la atención el material sobre el último libro de Trotsky –Stalin. Para mi sorpresa, descubrí que había nueve grandes cajas de manuscritos en el archivo, los manuscritos Harper (piezas H1 - H28), que contienen todos los materiales preparatorios para el libro de Stalin. Estos contenían todos los archivos originales, los borradores, las pruebas de galería, recortes de prensa y notas manuscritas y mecanografiadas, así como un número de cajas que contienen todas las traducciones al inglés de Charles Malamud de los originales rusos de Trotsky.
Universidad de Harvard

El archivo contiene                                            unos 20.000 documentos,                                         incluyendo unas 4.000 cartas.Lo primero que llama la atención acerca de la colección del Stalin son las diferentes capas, acumuladas como capas geológicas, que finalmente se utilizaron para producir la primera mitad del libro, es decir, la que llega hasta 1917. Estos primeros borradores contenían textos manuscritos y mecanografiados, y los segundos borradores que estaban completamente mecanografiados, traducidos y luego devueltos a Trotsky para su posterior corrección, edición y pulido. Trotsky sin duda tomaba a mucho orgullo ""pulir"" sus escritos, así como buscar la manera de mejorar las traducciones en inglés, para que el significado pudiera ser lo más preciso posible. Mi primera visita a Harvard identificó simplemente lo que había allí. En visitas posteriores, pedí ver todo el archivo del Stalin, que me fue entregado en la sala de lectura en un gran carrito. Los archivos que contienen los materiales se encuentran en grandes cajas de archivo y numerados en carpetas separadas (bsmRuss 13.3) H1 - H28. Estos también contienen todos los recortes de periódicos y diversos materiales que fueron traducidos al inglés, pero no utilizados en la edición final del libro, incluyendo los borradores originales, conservados en las carpetas H14 - H19.  Charles MalamudLa primera parte del Stalin se ocupa de manera magistral del papel del individuo en la historia, trazando la evolución de Stalin desde que era un muchacho joven en el Seminario hasta que se convirtió en un revolucionario profesional en los años previos a la Revolución de 1917. Sin embargo, la segunda parte incompleta, que, incluso en la edición mutilada publicada, contiene material extremadamente interesante, se vio empañada por las adiciones introducidas por Charles Malamud. Esto no era simplemente un material de puente para salvar algunas lagunas en los escritos, como él lo justificó, sino que fue compuesto de trozos enteros de texto en ciertos capítulos, que contradicen claramente la línea política del libro. Cuando la viuda de Trotsky, Natalia Sedova y el abogado de Trotsky, Albert Goldman, vieron el texto, se opusieron vehementemente a la publicación del libro en esta forma vulgarizada. Esteban Volkov, nieto de Trotsky, también intentó sin éxito impedir la re-publicación del libro a finales de 1960. ¿Cómo pudo un hombre como Malamud terminar la edición del Stalin de Trotsky? El conocimiento de Charles Malamud del ruso era ciertamente útil y su talento fue puesto a buen uso en la traducción de algunos de los artículos de Trotsky. Trotsky, como veremos, nunca estuvo muy impresionado por este joven ""simpatizante"" ni por sus habilidades. Sin embargo, Trotsky estaba muy necesitado de ayuda y tenía que trabajar con el material que estaba a su disposición.

El papel de Trotsky en la Revolución Rusa, suprimido de la historiaEl 15 de febrero de 1938 (el día anterior al asesinato de León Sedov, hijo de Trotsky, en París), Trotsky fue abordado por Harper Brothers, los editores norteamericanos, con una oferta de 5.000 dólares, que se pagarían a plazos, para escribir una biografía de Stalin. Trotsky, que estaba profundamente afectado por la trágica pérdida de su hijo, no estaba en absoluto interesado en la oferta de la editorial. La muerte de Sedov fue un golpe devastador para Trotsky y Natalia, otro acto de venganza de Stalin. Por otra parte, Trotsky ya había comenzado a trabajar en otro libro, a saber, una biografía de Lenin, la primera parte de la cual ya había terminado en noviembre de 1934. Presionado por serias dificultades financieras, Trotsky eventualmente superó su renuencia y aceptó la propuesta de Harpers. Charles Malamud, que había traducido algunos de los escritos menores de Trotsky, estaba disponible, y por lo tanto se le encargó la tarea de traducir la obra recién encargada. Claramente encantado ante la perspectiva de una oferta tan tentadora, Malamud escribió en una carta: ""Stalin promete ser un hito en mis esfuerzos de traducción."" Trotsky sin embargo, no estaba totalmente convencido, pero tenía pocas alternativas ante la falta de traductores rusos disponibles. Por otra parte, había recibido la seguridad de que él podría supervisar y refrendar personalmente todas las traducciones antes de su publicación. El trabajo comienza - y los problemas A principios de abril de 1938, el trabajo sobre el Stalin comenzó en serio. El 26 de abril Trotsky escribió a Sara Weber donde le informaba que estaba ""trabajando ahora en el libro de Stalin"". Sin embargo él había encontrado un problema que quería que ella resolviera. ""En cada página me enfrento a la investigación de datos geográficos, históricos, cronológicos, biográficos, etc."", así que le pidió, ""¿no sería posible encontrar una enciclopedia de la época pre-revolucionaria [rusa] en Nueva York? ... La cuestión es muy importante para mí porque de lo contrario mi trabajo se entorpecería constantemente"". Al cabo de unos meses Malamud recibió el manuscrito ruso del primer capítulo: ""La familia y la escuela"". Las cosas parecían proceder bastante rápidamente. El segundo capítulo fue enviado por correo a Malamud el 16 de agosto y el tercer capítulo el 12 de septiembre. Pero el trabajo no pudo proseguir tan bien debido a varias interrupciones. Antes del final del año, Harpers le había negado a Trotsky anticipos financieros sobre la base de que era lento en la entrega de las porciones del manuscrito. Había otros problemas con el libro. Sin pedir permiso a Trotsky, Malamud había mostrado el manuscrito a terceras partes, a saber, Max Shachtman y James Burnham que estaban encabezando una minoría en el SWP norteamericano [el grupo trotskista de EEUU, NdT] que se oponía al análisis de Trotsky del carácter de la URSS. Cuando Trotsky tuvo conocimiento de esto se puso furioso, tomando el incidente como un abuso de confianza. Trotsky se quejó a Joseph Hansen: ""Entonces, en contra de todas mis advertencias, él [Malamud] se permitió una indiscreción condenable con mi manuscrito. Protesté. Su deber elemental debería haber sido disculparse por su error y todo habría estado de nuevo en orden. También me parece que los camaradas Burnham y Shachtman cometieron un error al entrar en una discusión con él acerca de la calidad del manuscrito sin preguntarle a él si tenía o no mi autorización para darles el manuscrito. Lo mejor hubiera sido que los camaradas Burnham y Shachtman, por iniciativa propia, hubieran explicado que, junto con Malamud, fueron algo indiscretos y que era lo mejor reconocerlo como tal y dejar las cosas así"". En esta carta, Trotsky concluyó sin rodeos: ""Malamud parece tener al menos tres cualidades: que no sabe ruso; que no sabe inglés; y que es tremendamente pretencioso. Dudo que él sea el mejor de los traductores... ""(Suplemento de los Escritos 1934-1940, P.830, el énfasis es mío - RS) En estas pocas palabras Trotsky revela una apreciación perspicaz de la pretensión de Malamud, que fue ampliamente demostrada por los acontecimientos posteriores. Sin embargo, no hubo más remedio que seguir utilizando sus servicios.                          El trabajo más exhaustivo acometido                                   para “reconstruir” el libro,                              con la incorporación de más de                          cien mil palabras más que la edición                                              original de 1946.La indignación de Trotsky con esta indiscreción reflejaba su profunda preocupación por la seguridad y el temor de que el manuscrito del Stalin pudiera caer en las manos equivocadas. Este era un peligro muy real en ese momento. Trotsky estaba comprometido en una lucha a vida o muerte contra los crímenes del estalinismo. Stalin estaba obsesionado con Trotsky y estaba determinado a silenciarlo. Por lo tanto, ordenó a sus agentes de la policía secreta - la GPU - que penetraran en el movimiento trotskista y llevaran a cabo el máximo de sabotaje. Los agentes estalinistas ya habían logrado prender fuego a su casa en Prinkipo (durante su exilio en Turquía) donde algunos de sus papeles y documentos fueron destruidos. ""La GPU va a hacer todo lo posible para poner sus manos en mis archivos"", escribió Trotsky el 10 de octubre de 1936. (Escritos, 1935-6, p. 440). Un mes más tarde, sus archivos encomendados al Instituto Holandés de Historia Social fueron saqueados en París y ciertos documentos robados. ""Con el fin de dejarme impotente frente a la difamación, la GPU está tratando de poner sus manos en mis archivos, ya sea con el robo, el allanamiento de morada, o el asesinato"", declaró Trotsky. (Ibid, p.462) Mark Zborowski, un agente estalinista, se había infiltrado en el movimiento en Francia y se había colado en el círculo de confianza de León Sedov. Los rusoparlantes eran escasos y el movimiento tenía una necesidad desesperante de ayuda. Con el tiempo, llegó a ayudar en la edición del Boletín de la Oposición en París. Zborowski, cuyo nombre de partido era ""Etienne"", pronto tuvo acceso a la caja de seguridad que contenía la correspondencia entre Sedov y Trotsky. Haciendo uso de su posición, pasaba regularmente información sobre Trotsky a la inteligencia soviética, que después se la pasaba a Stalin personalmente. Fue Zborowski quien se aseguraba de que las copias de los escritos de Trotsky fueran colocados sobre el escritorio de Stalin antes incluso de que se publicaran. Stalin leía cada número del Boletín de la Oposición, prestando especial atención a los artículos sobre él mismo. Trotsky temía que a través del robo u otros medios, los agentes de Stalin trataran de robar o destruir los borradores. Por lo tanto, se tomaron todas las precauciones para mantenerlos a salvo. Estos temores estaban bien fundados. Cuando Stalin fue informado sobre el nuevo trabajo de Trotsky, se puso furioso y estuvo dispuesto a llegar a cualquier extremo para evitar su publicación. A lo largo de 1939, Trotsky siguió adelante con el Stalin, pero se encontró con más interrupciones, sin olvidar la necesidad de salir de la casa de Diego Rivera en mayo, tras la ruptura de Rivera con el trotskismo, y luego la batalla legal por la custodia de su nieto, Sieva (Esteban Volkov). Sieva iba a dejar Europa y tomar posesión de su nuevo hogar con Trotsky y Natalia en la Ciudad de México el 6 de agosto de 1939. El asesinato de Trotsky En abril de 1940, en el momento del primer intento de asesinato de su vida, la mitad del libro ya había sido terminado (hasta 1917) y el resto del libro estaba en diversas fases de ejecución. El libro estaba ahora en espera, con casi todo el trabajo dedicado a atender las disposiciones legales necesarias para la investigación del ataque, así como a los tribunales mexicanos. Trotsky también tuvo que responder a una descarga continua de mentiras y calumnias de los periódicos estalinistas de México y del extranjero, ya que intensificaron sus ataques verbales. En el momento del asesinato de Trotsky el 20 de agosto, el libro sólo había sido completado a la mitad, con una gran cantidad de material restante en forma de borrador en diferentes estados de preparación. Se las arregló para comprobar la traducción en inglés de los primeros seis capítulos, pero no había tenido la oportunidad de comprobar el séptimo. Una serie de mitos se han circulado sobre el libro del Stalin, principalmente por el propio Charles Malamud. Malamud inventó la historia de que en el ataque de agosto algunos de los manuscritos del Stalin estaban salpicados de sangre y otros totalmente destruidos. Se repite esto en su prólogo al libro del Stalin: ""Algunos de los manuscritos de la parte inacabada estaban en el estudio de Trotsky, ensartados en enormes y largas tiras con muchas hojas pegadas de extremo a extremo. En el momento del ataque asesino, y en la lucha con el asesino, partes del manuscrito no quedaron sólo salpicadas de sangre, sino totalmente destruidas"".

Fotografía de la Policía del estudio de Trotsky tras su asesinatoNo hay evidencia alguna en los archivos de Trotsky en Harvard que apoyen esta afirmación. Habiendo examinado todas las páginas del material original del Stalin, incluyendo las largas tiras pegadas de extremo a extremo, puedo decir con seguridad que no hay evidencia de manchas de sangre ni de ninguna otra cosa que apoye este cuento de hadas. Ningún daño en absoluto puede ser visto. La fotografía de la policía del estudio de Trotsky tras el asesinato revela algunos periódicos esparcidos por el suelo después de la lucha, pero no hay ninguna señal de ""largas tiras de pruebas de galeras salpicadas de sangre"". Es evidente que Charles Malamud inventó esta historia para dramatizar todo el asunto e impulsar así su propio papel en ""rescatar"" el manuscrito de Trotsky. Este no es el único ejemplo de comportamiento inescrupuloso de su parte. Tras la muerte de Trotsky, los editores norteamericanos, que eran dueños de los derechos del libro, colocaron a Malamud de responsable, no sólo de la traducción, sino de la ""edición"" final del libro. Para ellos, esto era simplemente un cálculo comercial para salvar el libro después de la muerte del autor. Los puntos de vista de Trotsky no entraban en sus cálculos. Las distorsiones de Malamud Tan pronto como Malamud hubo tenido acceso a los manuscritos inacabados de Trotsky, continuó con su traducción. Parece que el método utilizado por Malamud fue traducir verbalmente páginas de texto en ruso a una mecanógrafa en idioma inglés. Esto se puede ver a partir de las numerosas faltas de ortografía de los nombres rusos en los borradores escritos a máquina. Malamud se acercó entonces a estas primeras versiones para pulir la traducción. A partir de este punto, Malamud, ahora traductor y editor del Stalin de Trotsky, decidiría lo que entraría y lo que se quedaría fuera del libro. También era libre de añadir sus propios comentarios como material de relleno. ""La política editorial en lo que se refiere a la parte sin terminar del manuscrito fue publicar el texto de Trotsky en su totalidad, excepto el material repetitivo y totalmente ajeno al tema"", afirma Malamud en su nota de editor. ""Bajo estas circunstancias, eran inevitables extensas interpolaciones del editor"". Además, ocho páginas del texto se componen de ""partes de las notas del autor [pero] resumidas por el editor"".                           Un 30% de incremento en el tamaño                           comparado con la versión originalMalamud utilizó esta posición como editor para introducir sus propios comentarios políticos en partes del libro, utilizando extensas interpolaciones entre paréntesis. Estas adiciones no autorizadas sirven para distorsionar y tergiversar el punto de vista político de Trotsky e iban contra todo el espíritu político del libro. Consideraban el estalinismo como inevitable y consecuencia del bolchevismo –una visión que estaba en contradicción directa con la posición mantenida por Trotsky, que está claramente expresada en su biografía de Stalin. Para ilustrar la magnitud de estas ""interpolaciones"", es suficiente con mirar el Capítulo Once original: ""De la Oscuridad al Triunvirato"". De las aproximadamente 1.200 líneas de este capítulo, el sesenta y dos por ciento son de Malamud, y el treinta y ocho por ciento son de Trotsky. No hay ni una sola palabra de Trotsky hasta después de siete páginas y media de Malamud. Todo esto se hizo pasar en la nota del editor simplemente como ""comentario"" esencial ¡por motivos de ""fluidez y claridad""! Esta intromisión política condujo a intercambios amargos entre Malamud y Natalia Sedova. Después de mostrar las pruebas finales del libro, Natalia y el abogado de Trotsky, Albert Goldman, se opusieron enérgicamente a los contenidos. Hay una sección entera de cartas en el archivo de Trotsky que contiene las objeciones planteadas por Natalia y Albert Goldman. Su indignación se revela en sus comentarios condenatorios, escritos en las páginas de prueba: ""Falso, totalmente falso ... lo escrito y terminado exclusivamente por Trotsky es lo que se debe utilizar. No es real la copia 'editada'"". ""¡Inaceptable Revisión de la historia!"" ""Inaceptable"", ""Falsa revisión de los acontecimientos históricos."" Etc. La viuda de Trotsky se opuso a la ""inaudita violencia cometida por el traductor sobre los derechos de autor"". Ella continuó insistiendo en que ""todo lo escrito por la pluma del señor Malamud debe ser borrado del libro."" ""Como concesión”, escribieron: ""podríamos estar de acuerdo en añadirlos al propio texto de LD –siempre y cuando los originales sean revisados en primer lugar por nosotros."" A continuación, pasaron a tachar páginas de comentarios de Malamud. Pero todo fue en vano, los comentarios no autorizados fueron mantenidos en la versión publicada. [Harvard, carpetas BM3 Russ 13.3 - H12 (1de2)]. Natalia recurrió a acciones legales para impedir la publicación, pero el caso se perdió. Cuando el libro finalmente vio la luz del día, Malamud cínicamente anunció que la publicación se llevaba a cabo ¡""sin censura, ya sea de trotskistas o de estalinistas""! La publicación del Stalin fue planeada originalmente para 1941. Pero mientras que el libro estaba en proceso de ser impreso y distribuido a los mayoristas, el gobierno de Estados Unidos intervino para detener la publicación. Después de la invasión de la Unión Soviética por Hitler, Roosevelt no quería molestar a su nuevo aliado –Iosif Stalin. ""Este [el Stalin de Trotsky] fue impreso por su editor, Harper and Brothers, pero retirado por ellos antes de la venta al público a finales de 1941"", escribe Frank C. Hanighen, escritor de artículos para el Progressive de La Follette en el número del 1º de mayo de 1944. ""Los editores dieron como razón para la retirada 'una preocupación por los efectos adversos en el trabajo de las relaciones internacionales', dice la señora Lombard ..."" La señora Helen Lombard, una periodista del Washington Evening Star, expuso la forma en que se decidió la supresión del libro. ""A uno de los miembros del Congreso se le pidió que no dejara que el libro saliera de sus manos, ni permitiera que fuera examinado por ninguna otra persona ... funcionarios del Departamento de Estado han hecho sugerencias informales de que cualquier cita del libro sería perjudicial para las relaciones soviético-estadounidenses ... "" explicó Frank Hanighen. (Tomado del Socialist Appeal británico, agosto de 1944). Sólo en 1946, después de que Gran Bretaña y Estados Unidos hubieran caído en desgracia con Stalin, pudo finalmente aparecer el libro. Como era de esperar, la publicación del Stalin provocó la indignación de los estalinistas. Habían celebrado la supresión del libro, y esperaban que esto fuera permanente. Pero los tiempos habían cambiado y la indignación de los estalinistas no conocía límites.                       Esta edición suprime los añadidos políticos                                   de Malamud, que suponían                                      más de 10.000 palabrasCinco años después de que hubiera sido retirado para evitar el bochorno de Stalin, fue visto ahora como un palo útil con el que golpearle. Y las inserciones de Malamud proporcionaron los ""ajustes"" necesarios para convertir la obra de Trotsky en un arma en la lucha no sólo contra el estalinismo, sino también contra el bolchevismo. Por su parte, Harpers estaba dispuesto a hacer dinero con su publicación tardía. Todo el episodio está caracterizado por el cinismo más descarado de todas las partes: los editores, Malamud y el gobierno de Estados Unidos conspiraron para el uso y abuso de este libro para sus propios fines. La única voz que fue silenciada fue la del autor, León Trotsky.Las omisiones de Malamud Cuando el ""Stalin"" se publicó finalmente, una gran cantidad del material había sido dejado fuera del libro, a pesar de estar traducido por Malamud, que juzgó que este material era ""superfluo"". Por consiguiente, había claramente una gran cantidad de trabajo por hacer para restaurar en la medida de lo posible el original, aunque sin terminar, del texto de Trotsky. La primera tarea era eliminar las interpolaciones políticas de Malamud. En el archivo, nos fuimos de nuevo al texto con el fin de identificar las deficiencias y omisiones. Afortunadamente, la mayor parte del material que faltaba estaba numerado y podía ser agrupado, con un considerable trabajo de investigación, con el texto original en un grado u otro. En una visita al archivo en 2005, compramos copias del material que faltaba en forma de microfilms. Con la ayuda de Philip Wallace de la Colección de Trotsky de la Universidad de Glasgow Caledonian, hicimos fotocopias de las películas. A continuación, estas copias se tipearon meticulosamente, incluyendo todos los cambios, comentarios y supresiones. Este esmerado trabajo llevó una cantidad considerable de tiempo. Una vez logrado, pudimos luego reconstruir minuciosamente el trabajo original, pese a ser todavía una obra inacabada, y encajarlas en las partes que faltaban en el libro. Los pequeños huecos que echamos en falta inicialmente fueron restaurados gracias a la ayuda de Steve Iverson de Boston, quien hizo visitas a los archivos en nuestro nombre.Desde el momento en que empezamos a conseguir el material necesario hasta el momento en que estábamos listos para publicar la nueva edición han transcurrido más de diez años. Nos hemos beneficiado de un equipo de personas dedicadas que han sacrificado una gran parte de su tiempo y esfuerzo para asegurar el éxito de este importante proyecto, aunque ninguno de ellas pudo trabajar en esta tarea a tiempo completo. La primera tarea consistió en copiar el material faltante de una manera que se pudiera transferir a un ordenador, ya que el original estaba en un estado demasiado pobre como para ser escaneado. Esta tarea onerosa tomó cerca de dos años, y fue llevada a cabo por Hazel Brookshaw, quien hizo un enorme esfuerzo sin ayuda para descifrar y tipear todas las fotocopias en archivos de texto utilizables. La tarea más complicada y que requirió mucho tiempo fue encontrar los lugares más apropiados para insertar el nuevo material. En realidad, esto implicó reelaborar completamente el texto, trabajo que procedió de forma dolorosamente lenta. Esta fue la tarea de Alan Woods, quien, utilizando su criterio político y conocimiento del ruso, logró completar este trabajo importante, pero muy complicado y difícil, en un período de unos tres años. La tarea se complicó aún más por el descubrimiento de nuevos materiales, tanto en inglés como en ruso. Otro material, que no encajaba, tuvo que ser colocado en el lugar y el contexto político más apropiado. También nos gustaría dar las gracias a Philip Wallace del Archivo de la Tradición Trotskista de Glasgow Caledonian por su ayuda en la copia del microfilm. Hay que agradecer a Hazel agradecer a Julian Sharpe, Sion Reynolds, Phil Sharpe y Guy Howie por la corrección de las pruebas. Debemos mencionar especialmente a John Roberts, por su valiosa contribución en la corrección de Hi! My name is Cristian Mihai. I'm a Romanian self-publisher and blogger. I've been writing for over eight years now, but I've only decided to release my stories for a wider audience in April 2012, when I also launched my blog.
So far I have released three novels, four short stories, a novella, and a compilation of essays.

I'm pretty much a one man operation, meaning that I do most of the stuff that needs to be done in order to publish a book, from cover art to interior formatting. Basically anything, except for editing.
I'm a very prolific writer. And I can write pretty much everywhere, as long as it's my living room.
I'm a self-publisher by choice. An independent artist who does all the work himself, and tries his best to make a living out of it.

And, believe it or not, I know how difficult and frustrating the world of self-publishing can be sometimes, especially when books aren't selling very well, despite the overall positive feedback from readers.
That's why the perks are aimed at helping indie artists reach a bigger audience in exchange for a small contribution.

Your contributions will help me make ends meet, keep on writing, and release my future projects. Donations allow me to dedicate all my time to writing, blogging, and doing all the other stuff related to self-publishing.

What I Need & What You Get

For your contributions, you get the chance to reach an audience of over 79,000 people, via the Sponsor perks available.
Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that people sometimes can't afford to be charitable.

But if you don't have any money to contribute you can help out with a tweet or like. It's really simple. You just have to click on a button. And, trust me, that's enough, and it will really help me towards meeting my goal.

Thank you,

Cristian

Our Story

Welcome, and thank you for reading! L'Allure des Mots is an online magazine that features the best provocative work in poetry, short fiction, fashion and beauty photography, and art. Founded by graphic designer and photographer Sam Beasley and model, photographer, and writer Katherine Villari, we wanted to make a platform for other creators who share a love of the beautiful, the provocative, the raw. We have a passion for the arts in all forms–art that stays with you long after you've experienced it–and with your help, we'd love to continue to share the works of talented creators from all over the world through a new venue: the printed page.
<div>
The Impact

Fashion and art in the same magazine is nothing new, but poetry and fashion? Why would we mix one of the historically worst performing types of magazine, the literary magazine, with the fashion magazine, one of the best?

We think with our mix of literature, imagery, and clean design, we've been able to open up new avenues for writers to get their work seen that were previously unavailable to them through a different approach to the literary magazine. In addition, our philosophy regarding fashion and fashion photography as beautiful objects and art forms themselves takes a different stance on the standard fashion magazine. Add in interviews of some great artists, and you get a mix that can change the status quo of both literary AND fashion magazines.

In addition to all this, our plans are for any profits that we end up making after we've paid off our expenses is to donate a portion of that to literacy charities. It may take a while until we're actually able to turn a profit, but that's the longterm goal!
<div>
What We Need & What You Get
Bottom line? We need about $2100 to print 100 copies and to be able to sell in bookstores.

We don't want to take a print-one-and-we're-done approach; we're thinking longterm. This is why we're starting with a very limited run and working our way up. Your donations will mostly be going to the printing of the magazine (about $1750 to print and ship to us). To sell in stores, we need a BIPAD number and UPC, which will cost about $355 ($325 for the BIPAD, and about $30 for the first UPC).

Anything else we get over our goal will go towards two things: the monthly costs of running our website, which adds up to $203.97 per month (some of these costs are paid annually, but we try to save up for when the funds are needed!), plus another $9.99 per month when we set up the online store, and throwing a launched-in-print party to help get the word out.

If we don't reach our funding goal? If we fall just short, we'll harass friends and family to make up the difference, or if we don't come close, we'll move forward but with printing fewer copies. We'll also be seeking out advertisers, but we don't want to fill up half the magazine with advertising.
What do you get in return? Take a look at the perks to the right and find something that tickles your fancy! Images and detailed descriptions of some of the perks are below.
Perk Image Links and Descriptions
(Images are NSFW)
The ""Worth a thousand..."" perk images

""Watching TV"" - by Sam Beasley. Image dimensions are 15"" x 11"". Limited to 50. A print of this appeared in the ARTundressed 2011 erotic art tour and the Tata Gala art show in Sarasota, FL in November, 2010. Comes signed, numbered, and dated.

(untitled) (""Contort"") - by Sam Beasley. Image dimensions are 9"" x 12 3/4"". Limited to 50. This is a scan of a smaller original Polaroid, blown up to the dimensions listed. A print of this appeared in the Nude Nite art show in Orlando, FL in February, 2010. Comes signed, numbered, and dated.

""Button-Up Shirt"" - by Sam Beasley. Image dimensions are 6 3/4"" x 8 3/8"". Limited to 50. This is a scan of a smaller original Polaroid, blown up to the dimensions listed. A print of this appeared in the Tata Gala art show in Sarasota, FL in November, 2010. Comes signed, numbered, and dated.

""Self-Portrait of a Phoenix"" - by Katherine Villari. Image dimensions are 14"" x 11"". Limited to 5. This is a scan of a smaller original Polaroid, blown up to the dimensions listed. A print of this appeared in the Tata Gala art show in Sarasota, FL in November, 2010. Comes signed, numbered, and dated.
The ""Closer..."" perk image
""I Like to Watch"" - by Sam Beasley. Image dimensions are 16 5/8"" x 24"". Limited to 50. Comes signed, numbered, and dated.
The ""Let's just hump already."" perk image

""'Hi.'"" - by Sam Beasley. Image dimensions are 62"" x 40"". Limited to 10. This particular print hung in the Nude Nite art show in Orlando, FL in February, 2010. Shipping would be horrendous on this one, which is why we're limiting it to one lucky South Floridian. Comes signed, numbered, and dated.
The ""Instant gratification"" perk images

See here and here - These are original Polaroids by Sam Beasley. The scans have been checked to be as accurate as possible, but keep in mind that the color may not look exactly the same here as it does in the actual image. These are each one of a kind, with all the imperfections and charm that only instant film has, and once they're gone, they're gone. Please let us know which image you want after you claim the perk. First come, first served.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help monetarily, if you have a taste for words and images that are beautiful, bizarre, raw, thought-provoking, or even mind-bending, and you believe in what we're doing, you can help a great deal by telling everyone you know about this campaign!
Use our social links below to follow, tweet, share, blog, and reblog. If you like to pin, we do that too right here.

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

• Introduce yourself and your background.  Hello, my name is Ken Cherryholmes & I have written a time management-self help motivational book.  The primary target audience is the self help motivational reader, with emphasis on time management & help with study habits/skills, eating/dieting goals, help with exercise motivation, help with daily task/chore/to do lists.  This is my first attempt at writing and publishing a book.  Some of my career work over the years include: nation wide commercial truck driver-CDL Class A License, Journeyman Electrician - Licensed in Texas, previously a self employed contractor-graffiti removal specialist in San Antonio Texas & a lot of manual labor jobs from Kansas to all over Texas.  I attended six universities & colleges before I graduated with a Bachelor of Business Administration Degree-Majored in Management from Texas State University in San Marcos Texas, my current sport of choice-long distance running (today it is more like long distance walking).  The reason I wrote this book was because it solved a problem.  Since approximately the mid 1980s till now I have bought & read or listened to more self help motivational books-cassettes/CDs/audio books than I can remember.  My book helps to solve/control a specific difficult time management problem.  I could not find this specific problem solved as well as my book does it, in the products that I had read from the self help motivational market.  I still buy & will always buy self help motivational products, however my book solves a very specific problem in motivation, self discipline & time management.  It is a very simple, effective, easy to use, pragmatic & useful tool.  It could be a life changer for a lot of people in the target niche market that it is focused at.  This is why the contributor might want to fund this project - to help get this life changing book into the hands of the reader, that the customer could purchase for the regular cost of a paper or hardback book.  I do not want to mislead by promising  the impossible, however this book could have a very positive impact & be a life changer on the target market readers life.  When I state my book in such positive terms, it is because I think it is a great self help motivational book for its target niche market.  This is the opinion of the author, a lot of readers in the target market may find it invaluable.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.  This campaign is important to me because if it is even partially or 100% successful at raising the funds, it will allow me to keep more control of the editing-publishing & marketing of my book.  In case I only have this one good marketable book in me, I want to try to get a higher royalty %.  Getting a higher % is possible if I fund more/all of the project myself as opposed to trying to get a publisher to fund all of its publishing & marketing costs.  If I knew that I had a bunch of great marketable books in me then I would probably try to use a traditional publisher since it would be less work for me,  I would simply have to submit the manuscript to a publisher & they would do the rest.    
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.  Contributors donations/contributions would help me to maintain more control of this dream/goal/project, that I would have way less control of without the funds. Contributors would help fund to get a great book on market shelves.  The book they would be helping has the ability to be a life changer for some individuals-the target niche market.  I do not want to oversell or undersell my book, however for some self help readers after they buy & read my book, I believe they will think that this book is one of the best self help motivational books that they have ever bought & read.  It is simple & easy to use without much effort & with consistent positive results.  My book will help individuals who have too much to do in the day & not enough time to get it done, with helping them find the will power that already exists inside them selves & to make it stronger.  Readers will be surprised with themselves at how some of their life long struggles become easier to manage/control with my book.  Most important, at the risk of sounding like a oversell, when the contributor helps to fund this book project they will be helping to change lives for the better of the readers who buy & read my book.  The contributors donation will help fund a project that will get a life changing book into the readers hands for the price of a paper back or hard back book price.  This book will help the individual who has the worse time management skills & the least amount of time, money & energy to fix the problem.  If you have tried other time management books before with not very good results, this is the book that can show you a new & better way to handle a old problem, & this book may work where other books have failed you.  This book can substantially better the time management skills & decrease the stress of its target niche market readers.  Not a lot of books on the market can improve the readers life after only reading approximately a 100 pages of text (It is currently over 100 pages of text, after editing it will be less than 100).

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get
• Explain how much funding you need and where it's going.  Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.

• There are fixed & flexible fundraiser campaigns.  I am doing a flexible fundraiser campaign which means I can keep all of the funds raised even if I do not obtain the full goal amount.  A fixed fundraiser is a all or nothing campaign, which means if I do not get the full goal funds amount then I get to keep zero dollars of the funds.  I will therefore list the dream budget & the cheapest possible budget, there is no harm in listing the dream budget-even if it flops & no money is raised (as long as funds raised are used responsibly & not wastefully & on the expenses listed in this campaign).

• Self publishing with no editing can be done for under $1000, I have read some claims of people being able to e-publish for almost free, (however that does not include editing or marketing costs).  My minimum goal is 15000 after tax dollars, however I want to have a higher budget.  I say minimum, however all money donations will help & be appreciated, from one dollar & up.

• My preferred higher/better quality & faster goal budget is $42000.00.  My dream budget of $65000 includes $18000 living expenses money for me to take one year off work for this project, (accountant advised estimated tax liability $4282) + 18000 + 42000 = $65000 = dream budget amount.  If the campaign produces more than $65000, I do not want the campaign to go above $95000 & I would want the campaign shut down automatically at the highest amount = $95000 super dream budget.  I know these are unrealistically high amounts, however I list the best case scenario in case the impossible happens.  The extra money above/ beyond the listed expenses to write-publish & market this book, would go to business costs & business start up costs & possible other products research/ production/ marketing, tax accounting counsel & lawyer counsel fees, to create a professional web site to sell products.  I will list the low cost to edit & the high cost to edit, attempting to do a top of the line professional editing/publishing & marketing campaign.

• The main part of the expenses that some may or may not prefer to fund is the biggest cost I had in writing this book.  I listed this cost at the beginning of this campaign as a year off with pay - expense.  If a donor does not want to contribute to this cost then be aware that I may not be able to designate what donation goes to which expense.  I want the donor to be comfortable in donating to this project fundraiser campaign.  The biggest cost I incurred in the writing of this book is I took time off from work since June 2014 till now.  I had just sold my house that was sold due to my divorce, so some of my half of the proceeds of the house sale went to support my self while I wrote this book.  Of course as soon as family members & friends read my campaign & saw that I had been off work since June & that I wanted to be off more months to finish this project faster, they gave me grief for being off work so long.  They also inquired how I had supported my self so long without work, which is why I am including this explanation here.  Had I not taken this time off, my writing would have taken me years to complete on off time & weekends due to other time constraints & commitments I have.  I was afraid I might not ever realistically finish my book in the near future.  I knew I had a great life changing book for the target niche market & possibly for others outside this target market.  I just was not sure how long it would take to go from great life changing book idea to professional marketable product on shelfs & sold on the internet.  Great book is one thing, getting it to profitable product sold in the market place is another.

• The other cost some may question is the amount, critics may say they can get it self published for less then one or several thousand dollars or free with e-books.  My response is, this is  a best case scenario - high professional quality budget.  Yes there are college undergraduate students majoring in writing who might do it cheaper, however I would prefer a budget that could hire experienced professionals as a goal best case scenario budget.  I am also including in this budget, other business expenses & business start up costs & possible other product costs I may add in addition to selling my book, including a professional web page with shopping cart product selling capabilities.  Since this is a flexible funding campaign, I might as well list the best case scenario.  If it flops & gets zero then I flop & get zero, all donations from one dollar up to $95k maximum will be appreciated & helpful.

• I researched a bunch of editing/ self publishing prices, however I listed estimates from from low to high.  My goal is to obtain the high amount, however any amount of donation will be better off than where I am now without the funds, which is why I listed the best case scenario of $65000.  I am not trying to create a wasteful or irresponsible budget, this is a dream wish list larger budget that would allow me to do more marketing & more things better & faster with the book & the business.  I could afford to hire professionals that help to produce a better website to sell other possible products: calandar-other books-other products etc.  The benefit with the higher budget would mean I would have more control of the whole editing - publishing - marketing & business process.  Better editing=better book=more sales of books.

• I researched 10 to 15 companies on price estimations.  The prices varied, however they were in a general low to high range as some studies indicated.  I am going to quote from a online article titled - The Real Costs of Self-Publishing a Book/Mediashift/PBS written on May 15 2013 by the CEO of Biblio Crunch - ""an award winning author services marketplace that matches authors with quality, award winning professionals to get new books and apps to market.""  The price estimates are based on a 70000 word manuscript for a cost analysis, my book is approximately 56000 words & I am still adding notes to it so it will end up being 58k to 60k words before it is edited.  I have padded the bid, as most realistic bids/estimates do.

• With no editing required you can get 250 books self published for about $1000.00 or less, depending on who you use (Thats assuming, all editing work is done, e-printing is even way cheaper-some claim free).
• Developmental Editing Low=$2520 High=$18200
• Copy editing Low=$840 High=$7000
• Cover design Low=$150 High=$3500
• Formatting for print & digital conversion Low=free High=$2500 or more
• Getting an ISBN Low=$125 for one ISBN  High=$250 for 10 ISBNs
• Getting Reviews Pre-publication, Low=$149 Medium=$396 High=$425

• Marketing & PR Low=$100 High=$5000 + minimum extra $5000 PR marketing.  My goal with marketing is to have more $ than required as opposed to not enough or a low quality marketing plan.  Excess/unused funds will go to other business expenses, like filing for a LLC $487 in Texas, creating a professional business webpage with shopping cart abilities to sell my book, other possible books &/or calendars etc, business research tax accounting counsel, business lawyer counsel, copyright filing costs $350.00, additional marketing costs.

Summary

I am a creative writer recently retiring from the financial world to concentrate on the dream of publishing a first novel, following a woman’s journey through relationships, domestic abuse, inspiration and empowerment.
<div>

Though a difficult topic to cover the story is heartwarming and inspiring.
It was written to heal the past. becoming so much more on the path to publishing, finding people are wanting to read it know they are not alone as domestic violence and abuse effects 1 in 4 people worldwide.

A Broken Ring, A Woman's Journey from Abuse to Empowerment was released on the 23rd September 2012, in time for Ocober's Domestic Violence Awareness Month, during this time it has been admitted into the Suffolk County Coalition Against Domestic Violence

This campaign will promote the book, letting people know they are not alone as it is a topic not openly being discussed. To feel afraid, alone, violated and abused is kept quiet. The silence needs to be broken. People need to feel they can regain their dignity, that it's not to feel shameful about. To stand up and and be able to stand up and say ""I was abused, I was violated and I survived!"" is completely empowering!
Through the trilogy of the books people will understand why they feel the way they do or react in certain ways, finding they are not crazy but just a different version of themselves.
I want people to feel empowered from reading A Broken Ring and that's where this campaign comes in... To get the word out there through hiring a publicist.
Testamonials:

""An engaging and riveting journey that impacts both the mind and heart. The reader is immediately captivated from the opening lines and is launched on a journey of discovery and empowerment. I guarantee you will be overcome by your need to read what happens next. This is a powerful story of discovery and hope for anyone who has been impacted (directly or indirectly) by abuse.""
Dennis E. Golden
CEO, IM-SAFE® Keeping Women And Those They Love Safe
www.im-safe.com
“My review of A BROKEN RING…

The victim suffers sexual assault, physical assault, and mental degradation. Like most victims she remains in her situation (s) far too long until one day she empowers herself to start anew…a new life without an abuser.

“Like a serial-killing zombie clown’s suitcase, the Something Wicked anthology is full of deliciously wicked surprises, packing more stellar stories into its pages than anyone has a right to expect. Guaranteed scares, superb illustrations and stunning production values from the doting godparent of South African shocks - don’t read after midnight, and don’t miss out.”
- SL Grey, author of The Mall
<div>

$75 perk now includes a copy o EVERY SINGLE* PRINT ISSUE of Something Wicked.

Since 2006 Something Wicked has been the only South African paying market for writers and readers of Horror and Science Fiction. Now we are aiming to be the first annual South African anthology for horror and science fiction. The anthology will be available as an e-book as well as a traditional paperback. This campaign is intended to help fund our first anthology

Founded in 2006, Something Wicked ran for ten issues in print before moving to an online monthly schedule in May of 2011.

Something Wicked is the only paying short genre-fiction market in South Africa with readers from all over the globe.
<div style=""margin-left: 30px;"">

""Something Wicked is South Africa’s best speculative, science fiction and horror magazine. <div>

Something Wicked Volume One, will be our first print anthology and, to the best of my knowledge, the first science fiction and/or horror anthology ever published in South Africa.
We are hoping to create South Africa's first, annual genre-fiction anthology. We believe Something Wicked is an important brand to keep alive as it is the only one of it's kind in SA. And it's only through your help that we can do that.

The anthology will feature two covers illustrated by internationally acclaimed South African illustrator Vincent Sammy, and 24 stories of dark fantasy, science fiction and horror by authors from South Africa and all over the world.
The book itself is split into the six original issues, each featuring illustrations of the original cover art by Jesca Marisa, Pierre Smit, Hendrik Gericke and Vincent Sammy.
We've also commissioned illustrations for every single story, lovingly illustrated and donated, free of charge, by Pierre Smit.
<center>
""Something Wicked is the leading horror magazine in South Africa... and it is clear that they are able to attract some of the best genre writers in the country."" - Jim Steel, The Fix-Online
</center>
<div>
<ul>

• Around $1000 will go to printing 300 copies of the Limited Edition paperbacks (the white cover above) which will only be on sale in South Africa and offered to campaign supporters.
• Almost a third of it covers the author's license fees for the stories.
• $950 covers the illustrations (including $300 for two of the covers which have not been paid yet).
• Another third of the money raised will go towards back-payment for our story-editor's six months of tireless editing of the 115607 words that make up the anthology.
• And whatever is left takes care of postage for the books and rewards, plus the commission that Indie Go Go takes (4% if we reach our goal, 9% if we don't).

• If we don't manage to raise all the funds, the book will still be published through Amazon's Create Space POD, but we'll only print as many copies of the Limited Edition as needed to honour the campaign backers.
<ul>

• What you get depends on the level of funding you choose, but at the very least you'll get a twitter shout-out and thank you (and a hug if I know you personally), or cool-sexy postcards, personalised to YOU, (yes, even you in the back there with the weird hair).
• We'll list your name in the Acknowledgements section of the anthology.
• You can even get your copy signed by Vianne and Joe, and interior illustrator Pierre Smit.
• How about exclusive campaign contributor mugs, T-Shirts, or our entire back catalogue of printed or online issues* (with over 100 short stories).
• How about one of thirty signed and numbered hardcover copies of Something Wicked Volume One?
• You could have your story professionally edited by our brilliant fiction editor, Vianne Venter and...

• If you're completely insane and want to chuck money at us, fukkit, we'll give you everything, EVERYTHING, YOU HEAR? Including a song in your honour and one of our very own last remaining copies in the world of Issue 1.

available print issues: #'s 2 - 10 (Issue#1 available to top-tier contributions only).

So what is ""As The City Burns""?

As The City Burns is a post-apocalyptic horror tabletop roleplaying game inspired by a game me and my friends are playing in right now. The game is set in and around Boston in a world where civilization collapsed 40 years ago under mysterious circumstances. Now people want answers and the game is about characters going out into a dangerous world and getting the answers they want.
So what makes your game special?

I think it's a bit different from other games with similar themes in that the focus is less on fighting off zombie hordes or posing heroically over dismembered enemies and more about the emotions and the situations that cause them. The players are every day people surviving and living in a world where humans are supreme rules of everything and they know. Heroism comes at a cost, villainy is easy, and a hint of the supernatural touches on everything just enough to make everyone uneasy.

Another important part of the game is the system and how it supports the themes of the setting. Rather than using something complicated and potentially distracting I am working on a system that is quick, simple, and lets the setting shine through it rather than overpowering it. I really would like this game to be something a group of friends can set up quickly for a few hours of fun and then easily pack up again without a bunch of huge books to lug around.
You mentioned that the game is modular, what does that mean?

Rather than packing everything about the setting into one huge book, this first book will be a sort of introduction to the world through the eyes of a small town, their enemies, allies, and goals in this new world. The book will also feature a mission that will take the characters from their small town, through dangers they've avoided for many years, and into Boston the burning city itself. If this first project is successful my intent is to periodically release modules that include more locations, more missions, and more information on the evolving mysteries of the setting. While the players are free to explore and create in the game world as they want, there will definitely be a bit more guidance than in the traditional RPG books and players can add in any of the future modules that interest them or simply create their own adventures.
So what is my money being used for?

About half the funding goal will be used for art for the cover and the various landmarks, NPCs, and locations. I really want quality art for this project and I'm dedicating what I feel are necessary funds for that goal.

The rest of the money will be for printing the product upon completion and shipping it out to the contributors as well as getting it sold locally (in brick and mortar stores) and through online sales. If I am able to I will most likely produce an electronic version for those who prefer e-books.
The result of the project should be a soft-cover book about 80-100 pages in length containing the introduction to the setting and system, the first two locations, and a mission for the players.
What happens if you pass your funding goal?

In the event that I get more funding than I expect I'll be using the extra money to produce the next module for the game. Those who give more help me surpass that funding goal will receive more rewards in the form of exclusive missions, setting details, and special locations.
Sounds great, but why should I give you my money over all other great products and projects out there?

I am a native New Englander, a passionate gamer, and a writer who really would like to showcase where I grew up in a game that combines fun themes, interesting mysteries, along with a focus on the narrative. Taking a risk on a new product can be a bit scary but you can feel good knowing you helped to produce something awesome and unique.
Thank you for taking the time to read through this and I hope you'll consider contributing and making this project a reality.

Luis C. Rosario, Project Creator

Deonte Osayande is a poet, teacher and youth activist in Detroit, Mi. He's passionate about poetry and creative writing and has made it his life's work. He has represented Detroit in Local, Regional, National and International Poetry Slams. The Individual World Poetry Slam is one of the largest poetry slams in the world and since there isn't a current slam venue in Detroit he has been unable to compete in his hometown for a spot. Due to this he has to attempt to go across the country to Spokane, WA to compete there as a storm poet. Detroit hasn't had a National Poetry Slam Team since 2011. He's been either a competitor or coach of Detroit regional teams for the past 3 years, and is one of the two people in charge of bringing the Rustbelt Regional Poetry Slam to Detroit in 2014. He is dedicated, passionate, and hungry to make sure the true story of his city is told and represented on a larger platform.
The last day of registration is August 23rd and in this time period we need to fundraise $1,000 to make it happen.

Any contribution will receive my gratitude and love. A $20 contribution will get both ""When We Are Alone"" and his previous album ""Roses and Revolutions"". A $100 contribution will get you both of the previously mentioned albums and a pdf emailed to you containing his first two chapbooks ""Quills of Fire"" and ""Metamorphosis"" as well as a new one containing all of the poems that have been published to date. A $200 contribution will get you all of the previously mentioned prizes, an advance copy of his next album of music ""Moonlight"" which has yet to be released, and his services as an editor (for text projects) or as a producer (for music and recording projects) on your next project.

If we don't reach the goal I chose the option on this site to fully refund everybody who contributed. It would be a disappointment to not reach our goal, but it wouldn't be right to keep the funds for a project that doesn't go through that can't happen if enough isn't raised.

Deonte is a teacher and youth activist back home in Detroit, Mi. Any experience that he gets on the road he takes back home with him and shares with students, peers, and upcoming artists alike. This opportunity would be more than just a chance for him to compete against some of the best performing poets in the nation/world. Giving him a chance provides an experience that can be used to teach the youth in Detroit, to inspire those coming after him, to help make a change in a city that needs it. He's aiming to go to this poetry tournament to compete, but also to inspire the next generation after him to see that their voices are valid, are worth hearing, and are worthy of being shared outside of the city they call home.

Even if you are unable to contribute, please share this campaign with as many people as possible that hopefully can. Offer support and encouragement. Spread the word, that's the whole reason he's aiming to go in the first place. That's the whole reason poets that perform, perform and compete, to spread the words.

WHO AM I?
My name is GB Banks. I have Type III
Osteogenesis Imperfecta, also known as Brittle Bone Disease, like that dude Mr.
Glass in the movie Unbreakable. I
have had this disease since birth, but it does NOT have me. My dreams are big,
and I am striving to become a bestselling author. Unfortunately, I live on a
fixed income, and I am unable to afford the kind of promotion necessary to give
my novel, Revolution Z, a chance at
success. Due to my condition, it is really hard for me to get around, so I
would like to be able to promote myself and my book, and to be able to share
the many stories I have to tell.
Being disabled has made me a student
of life, and as such, the Horror genre gives me a world where I get to explore
all sides of the human condition. I get to live life to the fullest through my
characters, to explore their loves and hates, their hopes and their fears,
while getting deeper insight into my own as well. And zombies bring out all of
these sides of humanity, as well so much more!
WHAT IS REVOLUTION Z ABOUT?
Revolution Z
is about a revolution spearheaded by the resurrected President George
Washington, who leads a full assault on Washington, D.C. in order to take back
the government from what he feels are corrupt leaders. President Washington is
bent on restoring the US to a nation run by the people, for the people. And a
brutal war ensues.
WHAT IS THE FUNDING FOR?
I’m seeking $5000.00 in funding,
which will go towards advertising and other forms of promotion. Also I am in a
wheelchair and have limited use of my hands, so I need assistance with many
things. I would like to be able to hire a nurse to travel with me to
promotional events such as book conventions and cons, where I can get out of
the confines of my home and network with people, while seeing the world I’ve mostly
only explored in my mind.
WHY SHOULD I SUPPORT YOU?
I have been writing for 17 years now, and I have
written other books and stories that were well received, two stories having
made the quarter- and semi-finals of well-known writing competition. But due to
my limited income and ability to promote myself, I have yet to have the
bestseller that I continue to dream of. Your support will give me the push (no
pun intended) I need to finally achieve that dream.
WHAT DO I GET OUT OF THIS?
Some of the available perks for your donation include:
<ul>
<li>
Acknowledgement
of your support inside the book <i>Revolution
Z
<li>
Free
copies of Revolution Z when it’s
released
<li>
Free copies

column1: www.hypersmash.com","WHO AM I?
My name is GB Banks. I have Type III
Osteogenesis Imperfecta, also known as Brittle Bone Disease, like that dude Mr.
Glass in the movie Unbreakable. I
have had this disease since birth, but it does NOT have me. My dreams are big,
and I am striving to become a bestselling author. Unfortunately, I live on a
fixed income, and I am unable to afford the kind of promotion necessary to give
my novel, Revolution Z, a chance at
success. Due to my condition, it is really hard for me to get around, so I
would like to be able to promote myself and my book, and to be able to share
the many stories I have to tell.
Being disabled has made me a student
of life, and as such, the Horror genre gives me a world where I get to explore
all sides of the human condition. I get to live life to the fullest through my
characters, to explore their loves and hates, their hopes and their fears,
while getting deeper insight into my own as well. And zombies bring out all of
these sides of humanity, as well so much more!
WHAT IS REVOLUTION Z ABOUT?
Revolution Z
is about a revolution spearheaded by the resurrected President George
Washington, who leads a full assault on Washington, D.C. in order to take back
the government from what he feels are corrupt leaders. President Washington is
bent on restoring the US to a nation run by the people, for the people. And a
brutal war ensues.
WHAT IS THE FUNDING FOR?
I’m seeking $5000.00 in funding,
which will go towards advertising and other forms of promotion. Also I am in a
wheelchair and have limited use of my hands, so I need assistance with many
things. I would like to be able to hire a nurse to travel with me to
promotional events such as book conventions and cons, where I can get out of
the confines of my home and network with people, while seeing the world I’ve mostly
only explored in my mind.
WHY SHOULD I SUPPORT YOU?
I have been writing for 17 years now, and I have
written other books and stories that were well received, two stories having
made the quarter- and semi-finals of well-known writing competition. But due to
my limited income and ability to promote myself, I have yet to have the
bestseller that I continue to dream of. Your support will give me the push (no
pun intended) I need to finally achieve that dream.
WHAT DO I GET OUT OF THIS?
Some of the available perks for your donation include:
Acknowledgement
of your support inside the book Revolution
Z
Free
copies of Revolution Z when it’s
released
Free copies
of all of my other books, present and future, for life
A free copy of The GB Banks Collection (see $15 perk for details)
Getting to name a character in the book
Having your own short story or novel idea brought to life by me, with your name listed as the author
HOW ELSE CAN I HELP?
Donating money, of course, is not the only way you can help with the launch of Revolution Z. Please feel free to share this campaign with your
friends and associates via Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, telegraph, telephone,
tell-a-friend. Whatever way that you think will help.
I sincerely appreciate all the help I can get.

BRINGING LOVE BACK

What inspires me to be a Life & Relationship Coach is, knowing that the work I’m doing is helping other people grow in their relationships. What started out as simple Q&A segment on Facebook in 2011 with very few supporters, has spiraled into a brand that now inspires over 60,000 people via online social networks to love again. Based on the awesome feedback I’ve received from the people who have subscribed to “AskCheyB” in the past two years, it’s become evident that the people out there want more outlets that allow them to gain helpful relationship insight that adds value to their lives. After listening to the questions and concerns raised by my audience, I’ve written a book that addresses these very issues, and inspire hope for a much happier, healthier, longer-lasting relationship. My book is self-published and unfortunately doesn’t have the support/funding of a major publishing house, but with your donations, my team and I can organize a book tour in a city near you this spring/summer 2013. The purpose of this tour is to connect with you all face to face, and inspire growth in your relationships with my new book. This will be a fun-filled event with great food, drinks, music, live relationship discussions, and more!
WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET
I’m fully devoted to adding value to the lives of others on a daily basis. “AskCheyB” mission is to help people build happier, healthier, longer-lasting relationships.
Our goal is to reach $20,000 to cover our team’s traveling/hotel expenses, books, promotional materials, food & entertainment for the tour.

We believe that with your help, we can help change the lives of people all over the U.S. and get them excited about loving again. In return for your donations, you will receive some of the amazing perks listed to the right, but more importantly, you will be a part of the movement that helps bring love back into our hearts, back into our homes, and back into our communities.
OTHER WAY YOU CAN HELP
If you are unable to donate, we understand, but please share this link with your friends via email, Twitter, Facebook, word of mouth, or any way you can to help us reach our goal.
TOUR DATES & LOCATIONS!
-Washington D.C. 6/5
-Philadelphia, PA 6/12
-Boston, MA 6/19
-Jersey City, NJ 6/26
-Dallas, TX 7/17
-Houston, TX 7/20
-Miami, FL 7/31
-Chicago, IL 8/22
-Detroit, MI 8/24
-Los Angeles, CA 9/4
-Charlotte, NC 9/18
-Atlanta, GA 9/20
Check back for what date the ""Food, Sex and Peace of Mind' Book Tour will be in your city!
Thank you so much for your support! We hope to see you all soon!

Rodrigo sufrió de un derrame cerebral el cual le ha causado la permanencia en terapia intensiva durante practicamente una semana. Rodrigo va mejorando y esta campaña se está lanzando el día en el que debido a la reducción de sedantes, pudo despertar un poco y reconocer a su hermana que se encontraba con él.

La familia de Rodrigo necesita de todo nuestro apoyo ya sea moral, físico pero también económico. Recurrimos a este formato de financiamiento para que con un poco que todos podamos donar, podamos ayudar a nuestro amigo y a su familia.

Who Am I?

Hi! My name is Scott Roche. I've been an author, podcaster, and small press editor for several years. Most of my fiction tends to be dark and edgy, but a few years ago I decided to write a novel that my then pre-teen daughter could read and enjoy. That's how Ginnie Dare was born. The reception has been awesome and people have been begging for a sequel. I finished the first draft and have it out to beta readers now. I've also commissioned art for the cover (draft pictured above) from the same artist who created the first one. 


What I Need & What You Get
• I need funding to get this book edited and to pay the cover artist. I also want to have a professional editor go over the first book and polish it up.

• I've opted to go with the flexible option so I'll receive all of the money you pledge (after Indiegogo's cut) and every cent will go to the artist, editor, and layout designer. Whether I make my goal or not, the book will go out. The only questions are, how awesome can I make it and when can I get it out? With your help this book will hit shelves sooner and will be as good as any mainstream novel.

• Backers will have the option to receive an e-book of the first novel and its sequel, paperbacks of the sequel, paperbacks of both, or a bundle with all of the above. Backers at a higher level and get it signed and personalized.
The money will go for:
• the cover
• editing the sequel
• editing the original
• audio production for the podcast
• layout/design.
• Indiegogo costs and shipping.
Is $1000 enough? Yes. Though if we bust through that I can pay the talented people helping me even more. I WILL TAKE ZERO DOLLARS OF THIS FOR ME!

Why Should I Trust You?

I successfully crowdfunded the first book, Crimson Sands. It came in on time and on budget. In the spirit of honesty I am behind schedule on the anthology I crowdfunded. That's coming out very soon though, and I've discovered that putting out an anthology is a different animal. As I've said, the book is written and the art is in progress. This will happen.
What Will This Do For The World?
This is what people have said about the first book :
• ""Ginnie Dare, while geared for a younger audience, has plenty to appeal to all ages in both story-telling and characters.""
• ""Reading this with my daughter and we are both hooked. Great book love this author. Great for all ages.""
• ""Do you love adventure? Do you love your family? If you've answered yes to either of these questions, then you're a prime candidate for this tale!""

If you help me by backing this project you'll be responsible for bringing another independently produced, quality book for all ages to enjoy. Your backing will also help me allay the costs of producing an audio version of the first book that will be free for everyone to enjoy!

Don't Have Money?

  • Sharing is caring. Please use the tools that Indiegogo has provided to tell the world about this.

Update
Nadia has
been moved to solitary confinement the day after she announced a hunger strike
in protest of gulag-style prison conditions. Prison authorities said they moved
her for her own safety – not as a punishment – after she complained of death
threats. However, the move is likely a response to the long letter she wrote
detailing conditions of ""slave-like labour"", with prisoners forced to
work 17 hours a day with almost no days off, and punishments including being
forced to stand in the cold or being forbidden to use the toilet.
<h3>Who is
Pussy Riot?
Pussy Riot
is an anonymous Russian feminist performance art group formed in October 2011.
Through a series of peaceful public performances they voice how basic rights
are under threat in Russia today, while expressing the values and principles of
gender quality, democracy and freedom of expression that are contained in the
Russian constitution, the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the CEDAW
Convention.
<h3>What's up
with the jail time for a harmless public performance?
Masha and
Nadia are serving 2 years on charges of ""hooliganism"" for their 1-minute performance on
February 21, 2012 in a priests-only section of Moscow's Cathedral of Christ the
Saviour. The investigator's report claims the performance was an act of
religious hatred. However, the specific intention of the performance was to
draw attention to the special relationship between President Putin and the
leadership of the Russian Orthodox Church, as well a prayer to the Madonna to
drive Putin away.
<h3>This Putin
guy is for real!
Yes.
Russia isn't exactly like many free expression oriented countries around the world.
People are not as free to express their opinion without fear of punishment.
Government is hardly transparent and focuses on helping the ""few""
while barely focusing on the needs of the ""trivial"" many. In fact,
Pussy Riot is just one of many being targeted for their beliefs.
President Vladimir Putin signed a law over the summer, making it illegal to discuss
“non-traditional” sexual relationships in the presence of minors or to suggest
that they are equal to traditional ones. Putin defends his law by saying it
protects children and does not infringe on the rights of gays. While the IOC
has been lily-livered to uphold the values and essences that the Olympics represent, there have been many protests around the world to boycott the upcoming Olympics
in Russia 2014.
<h3>Yes, but
who cares?
Good
question! The leading investigative television show in the USA, 60 Minutes,
covered the trials and tribulations of Pussy Riot as report by Lesley Stahl.
In
addition, the following <a href=""http://freepussyriot.org/about"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><span>organizations
support the
release of Pussy Riot:
<ul>
<li>
<span style=""font-size: 15px; line-height: 1.45em;"">The Voice
Project

you want to know which celebrities and music artists care:

Arcade Fire

The money

Hell no!
Putin and his elite company already have enough money to last them several life
times. 100% of net proceeds (gross - expenses) will be transferred to The Voice Project to allocate accordingly.
There are
critical monthly expenses faced by the women and their families including
monitoring and visitation by local attorneys and family members (crucial for
their safety as unmonitored dissidents have died mysteriously in these camps),
warm clothes, food, medicine and care for their two young children, Phillip and
