Jacob Mass is an undergraduate student at the University of Florida. He is pursuing a degree in Digital Arts and Sciences, as well as a minor in Percussion Performance and a certificate in Graphic Design. He also works with the UF Engineering Innovation Institute.

As a young professional preparing to enter the workforce, Jacob became curious about the human, personal side of the professional world. He didn’t see enough of a focus on it, so he decided to research it himself, speaking with dozens of professionals from different backgrounds. He hopes to share the insights he gained from this journey with others.

Jacob was originally born in Montville, New Jersey and now lives in Parkland, Florida with his family and Lucy the puppy. He enjoys gardening and the occasional Zumba class. He’s slowly learning to cook, and he looks forward to long car rides so he can loudly sing along to his music.
For more information, you can connect with Jacob at jjmass721@gmail.com and on Instagram (@jacobmasscreative), Facebook, and LinkedIn.
Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #MakingYourPath and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

From the Back Cover:

A Primer on Reptiles and Amphibians is an innovative educational resource designed to forge a connection between the reader and the creeping critters of the world. Turtles, frogs, lizards, salamanders, snakes, and crocodiles… these animals evoke fear and fascination. This primer dispels myths and unlocks mysteries surrounding these diverse survivors which have mastered virtually every habitat on Earth. Tragically, these animals now face pressures of unprecedented severity, but there is still time to make a difference if more of us work together. 

Micha Petty is an international award-winning Master Naturalist and wildlife rehabilitator. This critically acclaimed debut volume is a collection of Micha’s interpretive writings, carefully crafted to make learning easy for everyone. These bulletins display his passion for Conservation Through Education while covering topics such as living harmoniously with wildlife, physiology, natural history, observation, and conservation. Flip to any page to be instantly introduced to new facets of reptiles, amphibians, the perils they face, and how you can join the fight to save them.

Even though it is still getting some finishing touches, you can download it right now, either by visiting the landing page, by clicking here for the standard resolution PDF, or here for the low-resolution version for slow connections. The Primer is not some run-of-the-mill free PDF. All you need to do is download it and look at it for a few minutes and you will be glad you did!
I am releasing my work as a Creative Commons project because I want people in less affluent nations and households to have access to this information.

Even so, the people that view the eBook constantly ask me how they can buy a print version. Giving the Primer away makes it a bad fit for traditional publishing routes, and I believe it deserves better than print-on-demand treatment.

Consequently, I have put a great deal of research into printing and bookbinding, and I have a quote to produce a beautiful, Smyth-sewn hardcover full of thick pages and 375 striking full-color illustrations.

I wish I could give it away for free, but I am doing the next best thing. I am donating the publishing rights to my nonprofit reptile rescue and rehabilitation center, and any money these books bring in will always go straight to helping the critters. This is the best win-win I can imagine, but I do need your help.
Better yet- download the Primer, look it over, and decide for yourself!
The book many of you have been anxiously waiting almost a year for! Order it now!

Books of this style typically sell in stores for $40-$50 (and up!). Since this project has never been about making money (though L.E.A.R.N. could sure use it!), I am offering first edition, beautiful hardcopies of A Primer on Reptiles & Amphibians for Only $27!
Each one will come signed by me unless you request otherwise, and the inscription can be personalized, should you wish.
If you just want to show your support and pitch in a few bucks- here's a reward for you!

If you are not stuck on getting a hard copy, $16 gets you the miniature digital version! This 16 GB flash drive comes preloaded with a high-res (300 DPI) PDF so you can print vivid copies of the bulletins and appreciate all the illustrations in crisp detail. Also included is L.E.A.R.N.'s Watch For Wildlife video, educational graphics, and more!

You could make this your ""critter flash drive"" and store all your nature files on it. Domestic shipping is free! Upon individual request, I will also load it with my comprehensive PowerPoint about reptiles and amphibians for wildlife educators to adapt or draw from. 
(Final design may vary from image.)

It's Not Over
Genius or madman? Monster or savior?
HALO mastermind Arthur Wake is missing in action. His fragile grounder alliance shatters under the Coalition’s counterattack.
Desperate to recoup their losses, the Coalition turns to a young combat frame pilot with a grudge against HALO. Brutal false flag attacks soon jeopardize Hainan Island’s hard-won independence.

Sullia Zend uses the fray on Earth as cover for her secret agenda. But can even the Sentinel manage a ruthless lawman, her own estranged sister, and a HALO defector on the eve of a cataclysmic reckoning eons in the making?

What Readers Said about Combat Frame XSeed: Coalition Year 40:

While I raved about the original XSeed (CY 1) and its side story (CY 2), it is refreshing to see CY 40 offer new scenarios and new types of action and intrigue, instead of rehashing the successful CY 1. The underlying 60 million year-old mystery begins to be fleshed out in ways that make speculation even wilder.
-Castalia House Blog

XSeed is a breath of fresh air in the mecha genre. Every character stands apart, the combat sequences are blisteringly hot, and the tension never ends. I thoroughly enjoyed this book from the first page to the final line, and now I can’t wait for the sequel.
-Adam Lane Smith, author of Gideon Ira: Knight of the Blood Cross

Brian once again knocks it out of the park with the second book in the series, Coalition Year 40. Some secrets are answered, more questions are asked, and everything works just right. The characters are as developed as before, the fights as brutal and awesome as before, and no important thread is dropped from one to another.
Even as I want to see the ending of the story, I want to see what happened in between. I want to see more more more! Buy it. It's amazing!
-Benjamin from Superversive SF
The Plan
My awesome backers have successfully funded two thrilling Combat Frame XSeed novels, and I've delivered on every promise I made. That's two campaigns funded & completely fulfilled!
But I'm not resting on my laurels. The plan is to make the third time the biggest and most exciting campaign of all!
But I can't do it alone.
As an independent author, I'm not beholden to a big city editor dictating this month's Very Important Message™. I answer only to my readers, and I give you what you want: fun!
This freedom comes with a cost. I don't have editorial, art, or marketing departments shouldering some of the workload. Nor do I get an advance to keep the lights on while I write.
That's where you come in!

When you back this project, not only will you help me offset book production and marketing costs, you'll get the book before anyone else. And there's a wide selection of other sweet perks to choose from!
Haven't read the first two XSeed books? Not a problem! Each and every perk tier automatically includes all three Combat Frame XSeed eBooks!
Now that you've got no excuse, jump right in, back the project, claim your awesome perks, and help save science fiction!

Thanks for your support!

An Angel Remembers 25

Voices of Christmas
Crowd Funding Drive
I am Carolyn Hoagland. I’m a  author,
blogger, wife and mother. I have been a mime and storyteller professionally in
the past. I am a blogger and am working on several books but none so dear to my
heart as this particular one.
Years ago with my daughter was very young I wrote a poem as
a Christmas Card. The poem is called “The Angel’s Gift.” The poem was so well
received that I decided to write others to go along with it. “The Angel’s Gift
was used as the focal point for a hospitals fund drive the year it was written.
It was also printed in our churches Christmas handout. This poem is the first
in the book.
I made the decision to write a collection of 25 poems that
told the story of the birth of Christ from the viewpoints of different people
who are mentioned in Biblical accounts or those we can assume may have been
there. I wrote these poems as a way to share the Christmas story with my then 2
year old daughter. I wanted a way to bring the story alive for her. I wanted to
start a family tradition of spending time together each day during the holidays remembering the
real reason for the season.
I wanted to give each Biblical and fictional character their
own “voice” to tell their story. I wanted to put information out that made
adults rethink how they look at the Christmas story without “changing” the fundamental
and important parts of the story. I wanted adults to remember the joyous
feelings they had during the holidays as a child. I wanted to put some fanciful
stories in that would catch a child’s imagination and bring it all alive and
make it relatable to them. As Dr J Vernon Mcgee use to say when preaching, “You’ve
got to put the cookies on the bottom shelf for the children to get to. Otherwise
they will not pay attention and will wonder off!”
As time went on I shared my stories with family and friends.
They found it a wonderful way to get their families slow down for 10-15 minutes
a day during the busy holiday season to focus on each other and the
Reason-for-the-Season, Jesus.
The book has been available as an ebook for several years.
As an ebook it is hard to promote. People say they would rather have this type of book as
a print book to hold in their hands and give as a gift. It is my goal to have
this book published as a Print on Demand book available on major bookseller sites, like
Amazon and Barns & Nobel by Christmas 2014.
Goal
The goal is to get “An Angel Remembers” out in print, by November,
2014. I have estimated I need $2,500 to both publish, promote and have copies to sell.
All funds raised will go to the publication, promotion and
distribution of the book no matter how much is raised. If I do not raise all the necessary
funds in this drive I will set the funds aside until I can finish raising the
money at a later date. The book will be published in time for Christmas 2015
instead of this year if I do not raise the required funds. If I do not raise
the funds at this time I will keep a list of those that should receive rewards
and distribute them when I do have the funds.
If I raise more than the $2,000 I will be able to pay for
more support and marketing assistants from the publisher. Either way all money
raised will go toward publishing, promoting and distributing the book.
Rewards for Donations
This is the section you are all wanting to hear about.
No matter how much you donate you have my gratitude. Even $1 is a blessing.

Voices of ChristmasCrowd Funding Drive
I am Carolyn Hoagland. I’m a  author,
blogger, wife and mother. I have been a mime and storyteller professionally in
the past. I am a blogger and am working on several books but none so dear to my
heart as this particular one.
Years ago with my daughter was very young I wrote a poem as
a Christmas Card. The poem is called “The Angel’s Gift.” The poem was so well
received that I decided to write others to go along with it. “The Angel’s Gift
was used as the focal point for a hospitals fund drive the year it was written.
It was also printed in our churches Christmas handout. This poem is the first
in the book.
I made the decision to write a collection of 25 poems that
told the story of the birth of Christ from the viewpoints of different people
who are mentioned in Biblical accounts or those we can assume may have been
there. I wrote these poems as a way to share the Christmas story with my then 2
year old daughter. I wanted a way to bring the story alive for her. I wanted to
start a family tradition of spending time together each day during the holidays remembering the
real reason for the season.
I wanted to give each Biblical and fictional character their
own “voice” to tell their story. I wanted to put information out that made
adults rethink how they look at the Christmas story without “changing” the fundamental
and important parts of the story. I wanted adults to remember the joyous
feelings they had during the holidays as a child. I wanted to put some fanciful
stories in that would catch a child’s imagination and bring it all alive and
make it relatable to them. As Dr J Vernon Mcgee use to say when preaching, “You’ve
got to put the cookies on the bottom shelf for the children to get to. Otherwise
they will not pay attention and will wonder off!”
As time went on I shared my stories with family and friends.
They found it a wonderful way to get their families slow down for 10-15 minutes
a day during the busy holiday season to focus on each other and the
Reason-for-the-Season, Jesus.

PURPOSE FOR WRITING THIS BOOK
There are many international books published on
pitcher plants, however, almost all of them are written by western writers and
about growing pitcher plants in non-tropical climates. The technique of growing
pitcher plants in tropical countries, such as South East Asia, are different
and have not been well explored. This is what I aim to change.
I plan to launch my book during the upcoming Singapore
Garden Festival taking place this year between the 16<sup>th</sup> and 24<sup>th</sup> August
2014. This bi-annual international plant festival is the perfect opportunity
for me to introduce my book to plants enthusiasts across the globe.
Because of this
deadline I am asking for the goodwill of sponsors to help me further facilitate
my research and complete my book in time for the Singapore Garden Festival.
My intention to write a
book really stems from the fact that there really wasn’t much information on
the care and maintenance of Carnivorous plants in the tropics when I first
started growing plants. I had such a hard time sourcing for the right
information.  In fact, much of the knowledge I needed was found only after
a lot of trial-and-error.
Although on-line
forums/websites had pieces of information here and there, it wasn’t enough.
It was also inconvenient and time consuming to browse through so many
forum pages and still not find what I was looking for.  I went to our
public libraries and even to bookshops but there really wasn’t any book
published that had the care information on the cultivation methods of pitcher
plants in my region.
I did come across some
books published on the growth and cultivation of carnivorous plants. However,
the books did not specialise in a specific genus and were not specific enough.
Since I had already
amassed a wealth of knowledge on growing pitcher plants through many hours of
research and trials, I decided to write a book to help beginners so they would
have a centralised reference point on growing tropical pitcher plants.
I hope in time, to see
many young people starting to grow tropical pitcher plants and to grow these
amazing carnivorous plants to their full potential!

Plants Facebook Page:

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) Summary
Note: November 30th and Beyond - Use PayPal!
To give, send a donation via  PayPal to hollister.tracy@gmail.com

Note: Goal Focus on Direct Book-Related Expenses 

Indiegogo does not let you change the goal mid-campaign, but I decided to focus on raising funds for the direct book-related writing, production and promotion expenses. Any additional funds - including those raised following the Indiegogo campaign - will cover travel expenses incurred while doing interviews in 12+ countries for the book.  See #4 for details.
1. What is this book about?
This book features the stories LGBTQ (lesbian, gay,
bisexual, transgender, and queer) people and
marriage equality advocates to help spread a much-needed global understanding
of LGBTQ people and bring about a “tipping point” to hasten the progress of
more countries adopting marriage equality. Readers of all types will gain a deeper
understanding of the diversity and shared humanity of LGBTQ people and gain
skills to become more effective advocates of LGBTQ people -- which can be
easily applied to other misunderstood minority groups.
In every country, LGBTQ people are a minority group with
the same challenge: to win enough understanding and support from non-LGBTQ
people to accept who we are to live more freely and to secure basic legal
protections such as the freedom to marry the person we love. Unfortunately, misunderstandings
are common because of a lack of access to reliable information about who we LGBTQ
people are and why we might want to marry. Yet despite this, since 2000, LGBT
advocates and our allies around the world have found ways to connect with a
critical mass of people, allowing them to “get us” enough to honor and respect
our freedom to marry in a growing number (~20) of countries.
Told through an engaging and experiential
travelogue style, this book is about my own journey of discovery
around the world about what works in reaching people's hearts - including
stories, conversations, and the messages we convey about LGBTQ people in
campaigns. Readers can feel like they are “with me” as I travel from country to
country interviewing people -- including marriage equality advocates, regular
same-gender loving people, and straight people who have had a change of heart
or are still struggling with understanding who we are and why we want to marry.
It will also include my own personal and political stories in over 11 years of

efforts to win support for marriage in the United States. 

Countries

These countries represent a diversity of geographies, ethnicities and religions. I have already collected over 200 stories from the following countries:
<li>
On their way to marriage equality: Australia, Northern Ireland, Germany, Japan
<li>
Recently won the legal freedom to marry: Ireland, United States, Finland
<li>
First or most advanced in their geographic region: Netherlands, Canada, New Zealand, Argentina, Uruguay, South Africa, Taiwan

Going to each country has proved to be important in building relationships, developing trust and rapport, and understanding the all-important context in which people live.

This book is important now (in and after 2015) because there are about 20 countries which now allow same-sex couples to marry -- enough to leverage key lessons. In most countries in the world, we have a long way to go to win these freedoms, and even in places with marriage equality, we still suffer from a lack of understanding among our neighbors, friends and loved ones. We need ways to sustain and solidify cultural support through shared stories and common journeys.

Though the book is not a campaign strategy book, it will include effective practices that can be leveraged in this important, global human rights movement.

Readers of all types will be able to “travel with me on this global journey,” enjoying the travels, cultures, and people I meet along the way. They will invariably see themselves reflected in many of the stories, just as I have related to them and offer “flashbacks” to parts of my own experience as a gay woman and as a marriage equality advocate in the United States.

2) Who is Tracy Hollister and why is she qualified to write this book?

I am a long-time marriage equality advocate with a passion for helping people better understand us LGBTQ people - who we are and why we want to marry. I have witnessed significant and tragic misunderstandings of us over the years, which is typical in a world in which there are few authorities who provide reliable and easily accessible information about LGBTQ people.

My commitment to this issue is strong. After 9 years of blogging, speaking and organizing interfaith projects to raise awareness and support for marriage equality, I resigned from my well-paying, full-time job to volunteer full-time to coordinate 33 phone banks and oppose my state’s (North Carolina) anti-marriage equality amendment in 2012. I then moved to New York City to work for Marriage Equality USA, working on five state marriage campaigns and then educational and story-telling programs. I know what makes a good story and how to inspire people to share their stories.

I have a solid understanding of what research confirms: the more people get to know LGBTQ people, the more they understand us and support our equal treatment in society. One of the most effective ways to bridge the gap in understanding - and appeal to people’s hearts - is to share stories. Stories are the shortest distance between two people.

Throughout my 11 years as an advocate and 18 years as an openly gay woman, I have many stories to tell of my own!  In the form of flashbacks triggered from others’ stories, I will share these experiences - adding an additional personal dimension to the book.  Some of my most interesting stories come from my “close encounters” with religious conservatives, including attending their panel discussions as well as direct interactions with them through confrontations -- and then later transformation conversations, co-authoring articles, and co-hosting living room conversations. As an example, you can read about Mormons and LGBTQ people bonding in Utah living room in the following article: www.tinyurl.com/huffpo-dialogue

Please check out and like my author page:  facebook.com/HeartWonJourneys

I got the chance to tell why and how I got involved in marriage equality between  2004 to 2014  in this podcast: http://tinyurl.com/tracy-advocacy-history

Part of my journey in North Carolina is also included in the documentary on the humanity of people from both sides of  the debate: ""One: A Story of Love and Equality."" See the trailer here: http://www.oneloveequality.com/

To see some pictures of me and other advocates in action, click here: 
http://tinyurl.com/tracy-advocacy-pics
http://tinyurl.com/tracy-advocacy-pics2

3. Have you written a book before?

This will be my first book, but I have extensive research and writing experience. I have written survey and interview-based reports, articles, and presentations for most of my professional life (1996-2012) as a policy, best practice and market researcher.  I have also blogged and written speeches, articles, sermons, and presentations related to marriage equality since 2005.

I have proven my ability to network and “recruit” people to help with this cause - from phone bankers, to presenters, booth workers, interviewees and hosts. It’s no great stretch for me to find qualified editors and promoters to get this book out!

Already I have consulted with an editor who helped me develop this book structure: 

In a personal travelogue style, I take my readers with me on my journey as it happens starting with traveling at home in the U.S., and then other countries.

Each chapter represents a period of time, geographic area and these elements:

●  Facts about each area, including key dates in their journey toward marriage equality, polling data with public support, &

●  Why I went & what each place (e.g., culture, environment) was like, and the personal journey I went through & what I learned along the way;

●  The heart of each chapter: stories of people I interviewed and my own stories told as flashbacks triggered by others’ stories; and

●  Lessons learned and ways to apply those lessons.

Project Needs and What You Get

4. What funds do you need to finish this book?

The original target was $43,230, was admittedly set too high. However, it cannot be cannot be changed in Indiegogo, so I am emphasizing that the first category will be funded first, and if later funds are raised for category B, then those too will be covered.  

A) Direct Book Production and Funding Expenses: $19,029 (45%)

Includes:
$8,500 professional editing fees (book structure and content revisions)
$5,055 three months living expenses for writing chapters and book proposal
$2,875 promotion fees (video, advertising, PR distribution) 
$1,563 Indiegogo perk reward fulfillment and  fees
$1,036 File storage,software, hardware and cell phone fees

Funds raised  will first go toward these expenses above that directly support the production of  the book. Second, they will go toward the in-country collection of stories for the book, in  B) below. 

B) Direct Travel & Living Expenses: $24,201 (55%) 

Includes: meals, ground transportation, required insurance, phone/internet, discount airfare* and hostel lodging

*Due to a generous gift of heavily discounted airfare, I am able to travel at only a fraction of the cost of full airfare, but I do need to pay taxes and airline partner fees in other countries. I also am hosted 85% of the time, and otherwise stay in hostels in shared dormitories.

I have kept receipts categorized by country and will share these for review with a  volunteer Budget Monitor to ensure that 100% of the money raised here will be going strictly towards the direct book-related production expenses and then the direct travel and living expenses. 

Since I began this project full-time in February, I supported myself and the project entirely off my home equity line of credit. Now, I’m asking you to do your part to complete this project and ensure that I am not shouldering too much as we work together to advance our rights like the freedom to marry around the world!

5. What will I get for my contribution?

The main gift you will receive is the satisfaction that comes with being a part of this important ground-breaking project that will have a timely impact on marriage equality (and other human rights movements) around the world.

I am offering some great perks to allow you to experience some of this unique, eye-opening, and heart-warming journey with me. For each pledge level (ranging from $25 to $10,000), you will get a “perk” or reward. Perks include a thank you, postcards, copies of the book, your name in the book, group and custom speaking programs, a one-page feature in the book, and a custom “Gold Sponsor” level.

If the entire amount is not funded, I will still use the funds as planned to ensure that the book gets published. However, it may be delayed significantly (e.g., if I need to get a full-time job rather than spend three months devoted to writing as budgeted), it will feature far fewer and less diverse interviews or cut out the critical research required to fully capture the campaign story in several countries, and I will not have the funds to properly build an audience or edit the book for submission to the publishers of my choice. I may have to resort to self-publishing as a back-up. 

6. Have you found a publisher?

Not yet, but I’m committed to ensuring the book is published. Non-fiction books require a few sample chapters along with a book proposal to submit to publishers. Seasoned professional editors can help me shape my submission to publishers. The publisher will have its own editors who will work with me to finalize the book. If necessary, I will self-publish.

Publishers these days pay attention to the platform -  or network of followers and supporters -- that an author brings to the book, and your support and involvement in funding this campaign and in following my Facebook author page (and soon to be blog) increases the likelihood of the book being accepted by a publisher.

7. Can I just donate to the project without getting a perk or donate  anonymously? 

YES! If you want to ensure that your entire donation goes to fund the project, you can donate without a perk by clicking on the pink “CONTRIBUTE NOW” button under the funding goal. There you can enter in your contribution amount and choose a lesser perk or no perk. Although the campaign owners like me can see the details of your contribution, you can hide your name or give another name on the campaign page to give anonymously.

Other Ways to Help
8. If I can’t make a financial contribution, how else can I support this project?

Lots of ways! I would love the following types of assistance:

1)  Publicity: Everyone can help with this. When I provide you with the public link, please use the Indiegogo social media share tools on the left. Note: the campaign card will show up with the link if you use the share tools. 

For any personal notes to your friends, you may want to use the shortened link [http://www.tinyurl.com/heart-won]. I’ve found that sending the link to individuals with why you thought they would be interested works well.  

For example: “Dear ____, I thought you might be interested in being a part of making this book happen because of all of your work with ___________. I am contributing because ___________. Please check the campaign video and story out at http://www.tinyurl.com/heart-won and let me know if you decide to be a part of it!”

2) If you want a graphic to share as your Facebook profile or for a meme (below: ""I Am A Heart-Won Backer    - Back Me Up"") you can share when you update your Facebook status to say why you gave to this project. You can “save image as” images with text to go with it from Dropbox here:  http://tinyurl.com/heart-won-backer-pack

3)  Specific roles on the Heart-Won team, including technology support, internet research, expense tracking, editing, marketing, graphic design, and administrative help. You can help with specific tasks that may take an hour or become a part of my core team to complete the book! Just email heartwonteam@gmail.com.

Financial backers will get updates of my progress through the Indiegogo page. You can also keep up with my travels and interviews - and sign up for the Heart-Won Club to receive email updates at http://www.tinyurl.com/heart-won-author-page.

The Theft of Saint Raymond's Babies
A book to be published by The New Press in 2016

(en español abajo -  et maintenant en francais!)

Imagine Yankee Stadium packed to the gills.  Now imagine up to five times that many people stolen at birth and sold into adoption, their birth certificates altered to hide the crime. If victims associations are right that's what happened in Spain. And so far the evidence seems to confirm it:  tens of thousands of newborns snatched from their birth parents over a period spanning more than half a century.
The numbers are astounding. What makes the story all the more incredible is that the century we're talking about is the twentieth.
The culprits? Doctors, nurses, nuns, priests, and hospital administrators. The motive? Ideology at first, then cold cash.

It began during Spain's Civil War in the 1930s, when the fascist victors and the Catholic Church deemed leftists mothers unfit for parenthood. The modus operandi at the time was to forcibly take their babies away. Women who protested got jail time or they got shot.

By the 1950s, the ""red scare"" was over, but the baby-stealing continued.  Because perpetrators realized there was money to be made at it if you were clever enough. The thieves, the authority figures running maternity wards, learned to target young, vulnerable women, telling them their newborn babies had died. Distraught mothers were told to go home, rest and make more babies. Those who protested were threatened with a stay in the mental ward. Sometimes the grieving women were shown a fetus kept on ice to quell suspicions.
This went on into the 1990s, more than a decade after Spain had transitioned from dictatorship to democracy.

Today, with the fearsome shadow of Franco all but gone and with the advent of DNA testing, victims are coming forward by the thousands. They're demanding that the government investigate. But Spain, it seems, doesn't want to look too closely. The government's argument: the statute of limitations has expired. Presently more than 3,000 cases are before the courts, many backed by overwhelming evidence of wrong doing, but they're being shot down or shelved, one after the other.

Because there's a deeper fear at play for much of Spanish society. Spain's democracy rests on a ""pact of forgetting,"" an unwritten agreement accepted at Franco's death that crimes under his rule would not be investigated.  No digging up of mass graves, no prosecutions, no truth and reconciliation committees. And no poking into the theft of babies. Spain's transition was peaceful. But the cost has been high.

Activists, lawyers, and victims believe international pressure is the last hope to spur Spanish officials to action. I believe they're right. To date the ""foreign"" press has covered the issue (myself included, for PRI's The World), but no one has written a thoroughly investigated, compelling book on the matter in English, brought out by a publisher with a strong reputation and the marketing power to attract the appropriate attention.

I have the publisher lined up and on board: The New Press, an established and well-respected independent publisher in New York. But I still need help in bringing this story to light, in getting the wheels of justice spinning.  By justice I mean separated children and their parents having the chance to reconnect and the thieves and their accomplices being brought to trial.

This is shaping up to be the largest baby-trafficking scandal of contemporary times. As I investigate and write I'll keep you up to date with detailed posts, including photos and interview excerpts at https://medium.com/@ghadden. If this book helps uncover the truth, you can be proud to have been a part of that. 

The Ask

We are seeking $24,000 dollars. This is for the nuts-and-bolts financing of the travel-related expenses as I investigate for this book.

I need to take around thirty to thirty five trips around Spain (including to the Canary Islands and the North African enclaves). On these trips I'll be doing all the legwork prior to writing: interviewing people in person, digging through archives, following up on and uncovering new leads, persuading those people less-than-willing to talk, corroborating versions of events, and more. To wit, all the stuff you can't do over the phone or online.

To put things in perspective a typical three-day trip from Barcelona, where I live, to Madrid, costs about $700 including train or airfare, hotel (low cost), meals (street food) and local transportation costs. Trips farther afield will cost more.

The New Press has offered modest seed money, and I do have assignments in radio and TV to keep me and my family afloat. But I'm a freelancer; all the time I put into this book is time during which I will not be earning a penny elsewhere.
The Thanks

Since this is a book project, the most heartfelt thanks I can offer you is a dedicated and signed copy of the work prior to publication.  Anyone who chips in $50 or more gets one in the mail. I'll even hug it first.

For those who give $100 or more, I will donate 10% of that contribution to a fund I am creating to help offset the costly DNA tests necessary to join a growing database of searchers. This test can run anywhere from $120 to $600 dollars - a lot of money in crisis-hit Spain these days. Many people don't sign up to search for this very reason.

If we reach our financing goal, 50 cents of every additional dollar pledged will go to the same fund. In this way your contribution directly helps real people uncover their stolen pasts, and you'll be helping a country face up to its past as well.
The Challenge

There is one obvious challenge here, and it's one I face a lot in my work: getting those responsible to talk - in this case whether it be a doctor, a former nurse, a repentant sister from a religious order, a clerk, or a courier.  But that's my job. I've been a reporter for 20 years, mostly in Public Radio (NPR, PRI). I'm fluent in Spanish, having lived and reported in Spain and in Latin America for the last 15 years. I can play softball or hardball with my subjects. Rest assured that this story will come out with or without the perpetrators' help.

If you're not in a position to contribute financially, I'd be very grateful if you could pass this campaign on through your social media connections.  
A million thanks in advance!

La Historia
Imagina el estadio de los Yankees completamente lleno (50,000 personas).
Ahora imagina hasta cinco veces mas personas, todas robadas al nacer y vendidas
en adopción, sus actas de nacimientos falsificadas para cubrir el crimen. Si
las asociaciones de víctimas tienen razón esto es lo que pasó en España. Y
hasta ahora las pruebas parecen confirmarlo: decenas de miles de recién nacidos
arrebatados de sus padres biológicos a lo largo de mas de medio siglo.
Las cifras asombran. Lo que hace la historia
aún mas increible es que el siglo en cuestión es el siglo veinte.
Los culpables? Médicos, enfermeras, monjas,
curas y funcionarios del sistema sanitario. El motivo? Al comienzo, ideologia.
Luego, dinero.
Todo empezó durante la Guerra Civil española
en los años treinta, cuando los fascistas vencedores y la iglesia Católica consideraron que las madres republicanas no eran aptas para el parentezco. El modus operandi
entonces fue quitarles sus bebes a la fuerza. Mujeres que se quejaban fueron
encarceladas o fusiladas.
En los años cinquenta la “Amenaza Roja” terminó, pero
los robos de bebés continuó porque los perpetradores se dieron cuenta que
podian ganar mucho dinero. Los ladrones, figuras de autoridad que gestionaban
las clinicas de maternidad, aprendieron a ir a por las mujeres jovenes y
vulnerables, contandoles que sus recién nacidos habian muerto. Enviaron a las
madres angustiadas a casa, sugeriendo que se recuperaran y quedaran embarazadas de nuevo. A las que protestaban se les amenazaba con el manicomio. A veces
se les enseñaba un feto congelado para disipar sospechas.
Todo esto continuaba hasta los años noventa, mas de
una decada después de que España se transormara de dictadura en democracia.
Hoy, con la temible sombra de Franco
practicamente desaparecida, y con el advenimiento de las pruebas de ADN, miles
y miles de víctimas se están haciendo escuchar. Exigen que el gobierno
investigue. Pero al parecer España no quiere mirarlo demasiado de cerca. El
argumento del gobierno: han pasado demasiados años, los crimenes se han
prescrito.  Actualmente hay mas de tres
mil casos en los tribunales, muchos con pruebas condenantes, pero se archivan
uno tras otro.
Porque en España corre un profundo miedo por
gran parte de la sociedad. La democracia española se basa en el llamado “pacto
del olvido,” un acuerdo no escrito aceptado cuando murió Franco, que estipulaba
que todo crimen bajo la dictadura no fuese investigado jamás.  Nada de desenterrar fosas comunes, ningun
juicio contra nadie, ningun comité de la verdad y reconciliación. Y ni
mencionar el tema de los bebés robados. La transición democrática fue serena y
sin violencia. Pero a un precio alto.
Activistas, abogados y victimas creen que la
atención internacional es la última esperanza para que las autoridades
españolas tomen medidas e investiguen. Yo también lo pienso. Hasta ahora la
prensa “extranjera” ha cubierto el asunto (incluso yo, para The World, de
Public Radio International), pero nadie ha escrito un convincente libro de
profunda investigación periodística, en inglés, publicado por una editorial
literaria de buena reputación y con la capacidad de promoverlo adecuadamente.
Tengo la editorial lista y esperando: The New
Press, una establecida y respetada casa independiente en Nueva York. Pero aún
así necesito ayuda a sacar la historia.
Esta tiene toda la pinta de ser la trama de
tráfico de bebés mas grande de los últimos tiempos. Mientras investigo y escribo
os mantendré al tanto con avisos y escritos detallados, incluyendo fotos y extractos de
entrevistas en https://medium.com/@ghadden.
Si este libro ayuda a revelar la verdad podrais estar orgullosos de haber
echado una mano.
El Pedido
Estamos buscando 24,000 dólares, cantidad
necesaria para cubrir los gastos de viajes mientras estoy investigando para el
libro.
Tendré que hacer entre 30 y 35 viajes por
España, incluso a las Islas Canarias y a Ceuta y Melilla. Durante estos viajes
estaré haciendo todo el trabajo que precede escribir el libro mismo:
entrevistando a gente, investigando en los archivos, buscando y persiguiendo
nuevas pistas, convenciendo a la gente no dispuesta a hablar que hable,
corroborando eventos y testimonios, y mas. En fin, todo lo que un periodista no
puede hacer por teléfono o internet.
The New Press ha ofrecido una modesta capital
inicial, y tengo trabajos puntuales en la radio y la televisión para mantenerme a mi y a
mi familia.  Pero soy freelance, de
cuenta propia, y el tiempo que yo invierta en este libro seria tiempo en que no
estaria ganando nada de los otros trabajos.
Las Gracias
Ya que este es un proyecto de libro, las
gracias mas sentidas y auténticas que os puedo ofrecer son ejemplares del libro mismo, dedicado y firmado, antes de su publicación. Todos que pueden dar $50 o mas
recibirán uno por correo.
Para la gente que da $100 o mas, donaré 10% de
su contribución a un fondo que estoy creando para ayudar a las víctimas a pagar
las costosas pruebas de ADN necesarias para unirse a un banco de datos de gente
buscando a familiares. Las pruebas pueden costar hasta $600 dólares – mucho
dinero en la España de la crisis económica actual. Mucha gente no se apunta
debido al precio.
Si llegamos a la meta de $24,000, la mitad de
cada dolar de mas se destinará para el mismo fondo. De esta manera tu
contribución ayudaria directamente a personas verdaderas buscando sus pasados
robados. Y estarias ayudando a un pais a enfrentarse a su pasado también.
El Desafio
Hay un desafio en este proyecto, uno al que me enfrento a menudo
en mi trabajo: haciendo que los responsables de todo esto hablen – que sea un
médico, una enfermera jubilada, una monja arrepentida, un funcionario. Pero
esto es mi trabajo. Hace 20 años que soy periodista, la mayoria del tiempo en
la radio nacional de EEUU. Hablo español con fluidez después de haber vivido y
trabajado en España y América Latina a lo largo de los últimos 15 años. Esta
historia va a salir a la luz con o sin el consentimiento de los culpables.
Si no podeis contribuir financialmente, yo estaria agradecido si
pudierais compartir esta campaña a traves de sus redes sociales y personales.
Miles
de gracias de antemano!
À LA RECHERCHE DES ENFANTS VOLÉS D'ESPAGNE
Trois générations de disparus, et les parents qui les ont perdus en quête de retrouvailles et de réponses.
L’HISTOIRE

Imaginez le Stade de France plein à craquer (85 000 personnes). Imaginez maintenant jusqu’à trois fois plus de personnes, toutes volées à leur naissance et vendues à l’adoption, leurs actes de naissance falsifiés pour dissimuler le crime. Si l'on donne raison aux associations de victimes, voilà ce qui se sera déroulé en Espagne pendant plus de cinquante ans. Jusqu’à présent, les preuves paraissent accablantes : Des dizaines de milliers de bébés enlevés à leurs parents biologiques au cours d'un demi-siècle.
Les chiffres sont renversants. Mais ce qui rend l'histoire encore plus incroyable, c'est qu'elle a eu lieu au vingtième siècle.
Les coupables? Médecins, infirmières, religieuses, prêtres et fonctionnaires du système de santé. La raison? Dans un premier temps, l'idéologie. Puis, très vite, l'argent.

L'affaire commence pendant la guerre civile espagnole dans les années trente: Le fascisme alors victorieux et l'église catholique jugent les mères républicaines indignes du droit de parenté. Le mode opératoire est dès lors de leur retirer leurs nouveaux nés de force. Les femmes qui se plaignent sont emprisonnées ou tuées.

Dans les années 50, le «Red Scare» pourtant révolu, le vol de bébés continue, tant il était lucratif. Les coupables, les figures d'autorité qui géraient les maternités, s'en prennent aux femmes jeunes et vulnérables, leur annonçant que leurs nouveau-nés ont trouvé la mort. Les mères en détresse sont renvoyées chez elle, on leur suggère de prendre du repos et de retenter l’acte de procréation. Celles qui protestent sont menacées d’enfermement en asile. Si elles insistent trop, la vue d'un fœtus congelé étouffe rapidement leurs méfiances.
Ceci continua jusque dans les années 90, plus d'une décennie après que l'Espagne démocratique soit sortie des mains de la dictature.

Aujourd'hui, l'ombre redoutable de Franco a bien disparue, et l'avènement des tests ADN permet de faire entendre des dizaines de milliers de victimes. Celles-ci exigent que le gouvernement enquête. Mais force est de constater que l'Espagne refuse de regarder cette affaire de trop près. Pour le Gouvernement, trop d'années ont passé, les crimes ont expiré. À l'heure actuelle, il y a plus de trois mille cas dans les tribunaux, la plupart présentant des preuves accablantes.Tous sont classés sans suite, ou restent en attente indéfiniment.

Car il existe en Espagne un mal profond pour une grande partie de la société. La démocratie espagnole est en effet basée sur le ""pacte du silence"", un accord tacite, passé à la mort de Franco, s'assurant que les crimes de la dictature ne seraient pas étudiés. Aucune fosse commune ne fut creusée, aucun jugement n'eut lieu, aucun comité de vérité et de réconciliation ne fut crée. Aucune allusion à la question des enfants volés ne fut permise. La transition démocratique fut pacifique et sans violence. Mais à quel prix ?

Militants, avocats et victimes estiment que l'attention internationale est le dernier espoir pour que les autorités espagnoles prennent des mesures et enquêtent. Je le pense aussi. Jusqu'à présent, la presse «étrangère» a couvert la question (moi-même inclus pour The World, Public Radio International), mais personne n'a écrit un livre convaincant doté d'une profonde investigation journalistique, en anglais, et publié par une maison d'édition digne de confiance ayant la capacité de promouvoir convenablement ce pan de l’histoire.

Cette maison d’édition est prête et n’attend plus que moi : The New Press, une maison indépendante établie et respectée à New York, supporte le projet. Mais j'ai encore besoin d'aide pour publier mon récit et espérer mettre la Justice en marche, afin de réunir les victimes et de juger leurs agresseurs.

Cette affaire s'annonce comme le plus gros trafic d'enfants de notre siècle. Au fil de mes recherches et de mon travail d’écriture, je vous tiendrai informés avec des annonces et des écrits détaillés, y compris des photos et des extraits d'interviews à l’adresse suivante : www.medium.com/@ghadden. Si ce livre venait à permettre de révéler la vérité, nous pourrons tous être fiers d'y avoir participé.
LA DEMANDE
Nous recherchons actuellement 24 000 $ (18750 Euros environ), montant nécessaire pour couvrir les frais de déplacement lors de mes recherches pour le livre.

Je vais devoir faire 30 à 35 voyages en Espagne, y compris dans les îles Canaries, Ceuta et Melilla. Au cours de ces deplacements, je ferai tout le travail qui précède l'écriture du livre lui-même: interviewer les principaux acteurs, dépouiller les archives, rechercher et poursuivre de nouvelles pistes, convaincre les gens qui émettent des réserves a témoigner, corroborer les événements et les témoignages, et plus encore. En bref, tout ce qu'un journaliste ne peut pas faire par téléphone ou internet.

À titre d'exemple, un déplacement à Madrid depuis Barcelone (ou je réside), s'élève généralement autour de $700 (550 euros). Ceci comprend le transport en train ou avion, le logement dans un hotel low-cost, les repas ainsi que les frais de transports une fois sur place (bus, train régionaux...).

The New Press a offert un capital initial modeste, je travaille par ailleurs ponctuellement à la radio et à la télévision pour faire vivre ma famille. Étant indépendant, à mon compte, le temps que j'investirai dans ce livre sera du temps que je ne pourrai pas consacrer à mes autres activités génératrices de revenus.
LES REMERCIEMENTS

S'agissant d'un projet littéraire, les remerciements les plus sincères que je puisse offrir sont des exemplaires du livre lui-même, dédicacés et signés, avant publication. Tout ceux qui peuvent donner 50 $ (40 euros) ou plus en recevront donc un exemplaire par la poste.

Dans le cas des personnes donnant 100 $ (80 euros) ou plus, 10% des contributions iront à un fond que je suis en train de créer pour aider les victimes à payer des tests ADN coûteux et nécessaires pour rejoindre une base de données de personnes à la recherche de leur liens de parenté. Les tests peuvent coûter jusqu'à 600 $ (450 euros), ce qui représente une somme d'argent  certaine dans la conjoncture de crise économique actuelle en Espagne. Beaucoup de gens ne le font pas en raison du prix.

Si nous atteignons l'objectif de 24 000 $, la moitié de chaque dollar en plus sera également reversée au fonds créé. De cette façon, votre contribution aidera directement les personnes en recherche de leur passé volé. Et vous aiderez un pays tout entier à faire face à son Histoire.
LE DÉFI

Il y a un défi dans ce projet, défi que j'affronte souvent dans mon travail : faire parler les responsables -  qu’ils soient médecins, infirmiers à la retraite, religieuses repenties, ou fonctionnaires. Mais c'est mon travail. Cela fait 20 ans que je suis journaliste, j'ai passé la majeure partie de ces années à la radio publique aux États-Unis. Je suis parfaitement bilingue, ayant vécu et travaillé en Espagne et en Amérique Latine au cours des 15 dernières années. Cette histoire sortira, avec ou sans le consentement des coupables.

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, je vous serais vraiment reconnaissant de partager cette campagne à travers vos réseaux sociaux et personnels. Nous avons besoin de toute l'aide disponible.
Un grand merci d'avance !

It began during Spain's Civil War in the 1930s, when the fascist victors and the Catholic Church deemed leftists mothers unfit for parenthood. The modus operandi at the time was to forcibly take their babies away. Women who protested got jail time or they got shot.

By the 1950s, the ""red scare"" was over, but the baby-stealing continued.  Because perpetrators realized there was money to be made at it if you were clever enough. The thieves, the authority figures running maternity wards, learned to target young, vulnerable women, telling them their newborn babies had died. Distraught mothers were told to go home, rest and make more babies. Those who protested were threatened with a stay in the mental ward. Sometimes the grieving women were shown a fetus kept on ice to quell suspicions.
This went on into the 1990s, more than a decade after Spain had transitioned from dictatorship to democracy.

Today, with the fearsome shadow of Franco all but gone and with the advent of DNA testing, victims are coming forward by the thousands. They're demanding that the government investigate. But Spain, it seems, doesn't want to look too closely. The government's argument: the statute of limitations has expired. Presently more than 3,000 cases are before the courts, many backed by overwhelming evidence of wrong doing, but they're being shot down or shelved, one after the other.

Because there's a deeper fear at play for much of Spanish society. Spain's democracy rests on a ""pact of forgetting,"" an unwritten agreement accepted at Franco's death that crimes under his rule would not be investigated.  No digging up of mass graves, no prosecutions, no truth and reconciliation committees. And no poking into the theft of babies. Spain's transition was peaceful. But the cost has been high.

Activists, lawyers, and victims believe international pressure is the last hope to spur Spanish officials to action. I believe they're right. To date the ""foreign"" press has covered the issue (myself included, for PRI's The World), but no one has written a thoroughly investigated, compelling book on the matter in English, brought out by a publisher with a strong reputation and the marketing power to attract the appropriate attention.

I have the publisher lined up and on board: The New Press, an established and well-respected independent publisher in New York. But I still need help in bringing this story to light, in getting the wheels of justice spinning.  By justice I mean separated children and their parents having the chance to reconnect and the thieves and their accomplices being brought to trial.

This is shaping up to be the largest baby-trafficking scandal of contemporary times. As I investigate and write I'll keep you up to date with detailed posts, including photos and interview excerpts at https://medium.com/@ghadden. If this book helps uncover the truth, you can be proud to have been a part of that.    The Ask We are seeking $24,000 dollars. This is for the nuts-and-bolts financing of the travel-related expenses as I investigate for this book.

I need to take around thirty to thirty five trips around Spain (including to the Canary Islands and the North African enclaves). On these trips I'll be doing all the legwork prior to writing: interviewing people in person, digging through archives, following up on and uncovering new leads, persuading those people less-than-willing to talk, corroborating versions of events, and more. To wit, all the stuff you can't do over the phone or online.

To put things in perspective a typical three-day trip from Barcelona, where I live, to Madrid, costs about $700 including train or airfare, hotel (low cost), meals (street food) and local transportation costs. Trips farther afield will cost more.

The New Press has offered modest seed money, and I do have assignments in radio and TV to keep me and my family afloat. But I'm a freelancer; all the time I put into this book is time during which I will not be earning a penny elsewhere.
The Thanks

Since this is a book project, the most heartfelt thanks I can offer you is a dedicated and signed copy of the work prior to publication.  Anyone who chips in $50 or more gets one in the mail. I'll even hug it first.

For those who give $100 or more, I will donate 10% of that contribution to a fund I am creating to help offset the costly DNA tests necessary to join a growing database of searchers. This test can run anywhere from $120 to $600 dollars - a lot of money in crisis-hit Spain these days. Many people don't sign up to search for this very reason.

If we reach our financing goal, 50 cents of every additional dollar pledged will go to the same fund. In this way your contribution directly helps real people uncover their stolen pasts, and you'll be helping a country face up to its past as well.
The Challenge

There is one obvious challenge here, and it's one I face a lot in my work: getting those responsible to talk - in this case whether it be a doctor, a former nurse, a repentant sister from a religious order, a clerk, or a courier.  But that's my job. I've been a reporter for 20 years, mostly in Public Radio (NPR, PRI). I'm fluent in Spanish, having lived and reported in Spain and in Latin America for the last 15 years. I can play softball or hardball with my subjects. Rest assured that this story will come out with or without the perpetrators' help.
If you're not in a position to contribute financially, I'd be very grateful if you could pass this campaign on through your social media connections.  A million thanks in advance!La Historia
Imagina el estadio de los Yankees completamente lleno (50,000 personas).
Ahora imagina hasta cinco veces mas personas, todas robadas al nacer y vendidas
en adopción, sus actas de nacimientos falsificadas para cubrir el crimen. Si
las asociaciones de víctimas tienen razón esto es lo que pasó en España. Y
hasta ahora las pruebas parecen confirmarlo: decenas de miles de recién nacidos
arrebatados de sus padres biológicos a lo largo de mas de medio siglo.
Las cifras asombran. Lo que hace la historia
aún mas increible es que el siglo en cuestión es el siglo veinte.
Los culpables? Médicos, enfermeras, monjas,
curas y funcionarios del sistema sanitario. El motivo? Al comienzo, ideologia.
Luego, dinero.
Todo empezó durante la Guerra Civil española
en los años treinta, cuando los fascistas vencedores y la iglesia Católica consideraron que las madres republicanas no eran aptas para el parentezco. El modus operandi
entonces fue quitarles sus bebes a la fuerza. Mujeres que se quejaban fueron
encarceladas o fusiladas.
En los años cinquenta la “Amenaza Roja” terminó, pero
los robos de bebés continuó porque los perpetradores se dieron cuenta que
podian ganar mucho dinero. Los ladrones, figuras de autoridad que gestionaban
las clinicas de maternidad, aprendieron a ir a por las mujeres jovenes y
vulnerables, contandoles que sus recién nacidos habian muerto. Enviaron a las
madres angustiadas a casa, sugeriendo que se recuperaran y quedaran embarazadas de nuevo. A las que protestaban se les amenazaba con el manicomio. A veces
se les enseñaba un feto congelado para disipar sospechas.
Todo esto continuaba hasta los años noventa, mas de
una decada después de que España se transormara de dictadura en democracia.
Hoy, con la temible sombra de Franco
practicamente desaparecida, y con el advenimiento de las pruebas de ADN, miles
y miles de víctimas se están haciendo escuchar. Exigen que el gobierno
investigue. Pero al parecer España no quiere mirarlo demasiado de cerca. El
argumento del gobierno: han pasado demasiados años, los crimenes se han
prescrito.  Actualmente hay mas de tres
mil casos en los tribunales, muchos con pruebas condenantes, pero se archivan
uno tras otro.
Porque en España corre un profundo miedo por
gran parte de la sociedad. La democracia española se basa en el llamado “pacto
del olvido,” un acuerdo no escrito aceptado cuando murió Franco, que estipulaba
que todo crimen bajo la dictadura no fuese investigado jamás.  Nada de desenterrar fosas comunes, ningun
juicio contra nadie, ningun comité de la verdad y reconciliación. Y ni
mencionar el tema de los bebés robados. La transición democrática fue serena y
sin violencia. Pero a un precio alto.
Activistas, abogados y victimas creen que la
atención internacional es la última esperanza para que las autoridades
españolas tomen medidas e investiguen. Yo también lo pienso. Hasta ahora la
prensa “extranjera” ha cubierto el asunto (incluso yo, para The World, de
Public Radio International), pero nadie ha escrito un convincente libro de
profunda investigación periodística, en inglés, publicado por una editorial
literaria de buena reputación y con la capacidad de promoverlo adecuadamente.
Tengo la editorial lista y esperando: The New
Press, una establecida y respetada casa independiente en Nueva York. Pero aún
así necesito ayuda a sacar la historia.
Esta tiene toda la pinta de ser la trama de
tráfico de bebés mas grande de los últimos tiempos. Mientras investigo y escribo
os mantendré al tanto con avisos y escritos detallados, incluyendo fotos y extractos de
entrevistas en https://medium.com/@ghadden.
Si este libro ayuda a revelar la verdad podrais estar orgullosos de haber
echado una mano.
El Pedido
Estamos buscando 24,000 dólares, cantidad
necesaria para cubrir los gastos de viajes mientras estoy investigando para el
libro.
Tendré que hacer entre 30 y 35 viajes por
España, incluso a las Islas Canarias y a Ceuta y Melilla. Durante estos viajes
estaré haciendo todo el trabajo que precede escribir el libro mismo:
entrevistando a gente, investigando en los archivos, buscando y persiguiendo
nuevas pistas, convenciendo a la gente no dispuesta a hablar que hable,
corroborando eventos y testimonios, y mas. En fin, todo lo que un periodista no
puede hacer por teléfono o internet.
The New Press ha ofrecido una modesta capital
inicial, y tengo trabajos puntuales en la radio y la televisión para mantenerme a mi y a
mi familia.  Pero soy freelance, de
cuenta propia, y el tiempo que yo invierta en este libro seria tiempo en que no
estaria ganando nada de los otros trabajos.
Las Gracias
Ya que este es un proyecto de libro, las
gracias mas sentidas y auténticas que os puedo ofrecer son ejemplares del libro mismo, dedicado y firmado, antes de su publicación. Todos que pueden dar $50 o mas
recibirán uno por correo.
Para la gente que da $100 o mas, donaré 10% de
su contribución a un fondo que estoy creando para ayudar a las víctimas a pagar
las costosas pruebas de ADN necesarias para unirse a un banco de datos de gente
buscando a familiares. Las pruebas pueden costar hasta $600 dólares – mucho
dinero en la España de la crisis económica actual. Mucha gente no se apunta
debido al precio.
Si llegamos a la meta de $24,000, la mitad de
cada dolar de mas se destinará para el mismo fondo. De esta manera tu
contribución ayudaria directamente a personas verdaderas buscando sus pasados
robados. Y estarias ayudando a un pais a enfrentarse a su pasado también.
El Desafio
Hay un desafio en este proyecto, uno al que me enfrento a menudo
en mi trabajo: haciendo que los responsables de todo esto hablen – que sea un
médico, una enfermera jubilada, una monja arrepentida, un funcionario. Pero
esto es mi trabajo. Hace 20 años que soy periodista, la mayoria del tiempo en
la radio nacional de EEUU. Hablo español con fluidez después de haber vivido y
trabajado en España y América Latina a lo largo de los últimos 15 años. Esta
historia va a salir a la luz con o sin el consentimiento de los culpables.
Si no podeis contribuir financialmente, yo estaria agradecido si
pudierais compartir esta campaña a traves de sus redes sociales y personales.
Miles
de gracias de antemano!
À LA RECHERCHE DES ENFANTS VOLÉS D'ESPAGNE
Trois générations de disparus, et les parents qui les ont perdus en quête de retrouvailles et de réponses.
L’HISTOIRE

Imaginez le Stade de France plein à craquer (85 000 personnes). Imaginez maintenant jusqu’à trois fois plus de personnes, toutes volées à leur naissance et vendues à l’adoption, leurs actes de naissance falsifiés pour dissimuler le crime. Si l'on donne raison aux associations de victimes, voilà ce qui se sera déroulé en Espagne pendant plus de cinquante ans. Jusqu’à présent, les preuves paraissent accablantes : Des dizaines de milliers de bébés enlevés à leurs parents biologiques au cours d'un demi-siècle.
Les chiffres sont renversants. Mais ce qui rend l'histoire encore plus incroyable, c'est qu'elle a eu lieu au vingtième siècle.
Les coupables? Médecins, infirmières, religieuses, prêtres et fonctionnaires du système de santé. La raison? Dans un premier temps, l'idéologie. Puis, très vite, l'argent.

L'affaire commence pendant la guerre civile espagnole dans les années trente: Le fascisme alors victorieux et l'église catholique jugent les mères républicaines indignes du droit de parenté. Le mode opératoire est dès lors de leur retirer leurs nouveaux nés de force. Les femmes qui se plaignent sont emprisonnées ou tuées.

Dans les années 50, le «Red Scare» pourtant révolu, le vol de bébés continue, tant il était lucratif. Les coupables, les figures d'autorité qui géraient les maternités, s'en prennent aux femmes jeunes et vulnérables, leur annonçant que leurs nouveau-nés ont trouvé la mort. Les mères en détresse sont renvoyées chez elle, on leur suggère de prendre du repos et de retenter l’acte de procréation. Celles qui protestent sont menacées d’enfermement en asile. Si elles insistent trop, la vue d'un fœtus congelé étouffe rapidement leurs méfiances.
Ceci continua jusque dans les années 90, plus d'une décennie après que l'Espagne démocratique soit sortie des mains de la dictature.

Aujourd'hui, l'ombre redoutable de Franco a bien disparue, et l'avènement des tests ADN permet de faire entendre des dizaines de milliers de victimes. Celles-ci exigent que le gouvernement enquête. Mais force est de constater que l'Espagne refuse de regarder cette affaire de trop près. Pour le Gouvernement, trop d'années ont passé, les crimes ont expiré. À l'heure actuelle, il y a plus de trois mille cas dans les tribunaux, la plupart présentant des preuves accablantes.Tous sont classés sans suite, ou restent en attente indéfiniment.

Car il existe en Espagne un mal profond pour une grande partie de la société. La démocratie espagnole est en effet basée sur le ""pacte du silence"", un accord tacite, passé à la mort de Franco, s'assurant que les crimes de la dictature ne seraient pas étudiés. Aucune fosse commune ne fut creusée, aucun jugement n'eut lieu, aucun comité de vérité et de réconciliation ne fut crée. Aucune allusion à la question des enfants volés ne fut permise. La transition démocratique fut pacifique et sans violence. Mais à quel prix ?

Militants, avocats et victimes estiment que l'attention internationale est le dernier espoir pour que les autorités espagnoles prennent des mesures et enquêtent. Je le pense aussi. Jusqu'à présent, la presse «étrangère» a couvert la question (moi-même inclus pour The World, Public Radio International), mais personne n'a écrit un livre convaincant doté d'une profonde investigation journalistique, en anglais, et publié par une maison d'édition digne de confiance ayant la capacité de promouvoir convenablement ce pan de l’histoire.

Cette maison d’édition est prête et n’attend plus que moi : The New Press, une maison indépendante établie et respectée à New York, supporte le projet. Mais j'ai encore besoin d'aide pour publier mon récit et espérer mettre la Justice en marche, afin de réunir les victimes et de juger leurs agresseurs.

Cette affaire s'annonce comme le plus gros trafic d'enfants de notre siècle. Au fil de mes recherches et de mon travail d’écriture, je vous tiendrai informés avec des annonces et des écrits détaillés, y compris des photos et des extraits d'interviews à l’adresse suivante : www.medium.com/@ghadden. Si ce livre venait à permettre de révéler la vérité, nous pourrons tous être fiers d'y avoir participé.
LA DEMANDE
Nous recherchons actuellement 24 000 $ (18750 Euros environ), montant nécessaire pour couvrir les frais de déplacement lors de mes recherches pour le livre.

Je vais devoir faire 30 à 35 voyages en Espagne, y compris dans les îles Canaries, Ceuta et Melilla. Au cours de ces deplacements, je ferai tout le travail qui précède l'écriture du livre lui-même: interviewer les principaux acteurs, dépouiller les archives, rechercher et poursuivre de nouvelles pistes, convaincre les gens qui émettent des réserves a témoigner, corroborer les événements et les témoignages, et plus encore. En bref, tout ce qu'un journaliste ne peut pas faire par téléphone ou internet.

À titre d'exemple, un déplacement à Madrid depuis Barcelone (ou je réside), s'élève généralement autour de $700 (550 euros). Ceci comprend le transport en train ou avion, le logement dans un hotel low-cost, les repas ainsi que les frais de transports une fois sur place (bus, train régionaux...).

The New Press a offert un capital initial modeste, je travaille par ailleurs ponctuellement à la radio et à la télévision pour faire vivre ma famille. Étant indépendant, à mon compte, le temps que j'investirai dans ce livre sera du temps que je ne pourrai pas consacrer à mes autres activités génératrices de revenus.
LES REMERCIEMENTS

S'agissant d'un projet littéraire, les remerciements les plus sincères que je puisse offrir sont des exemplaires du livre lui-même, dédicacés et signés, avant publication. Tout ceux qui peuvent donner 50 $ (40 euros) ou plus en recevront donc un exemplaire par la poste.

Dans le cas des personnes donnant 100 $ (80 euros) ou plus, 10% des contributions iront à un fond que je suis en train de créer pour aider les victimes à payer des tests ADN coûteux et nécessaires pour rejoindre une base de données de personnes à la recherche de leur liens de parenté. Les tests peuvent coûter jusqu'à 600 $ (450 euros), ce qui représente une somme d'argent  certaine dans la conjoncture de crise économique actuelle en Espagne. Beaucoup de gens ne le font pas en raison du prix.

Si nous atteignons l'objectif de 24 000 $, la moitié de chaque dollar en plus sera également reversée au fonds créé. De cette façon, votre contribution aidera directement les personnes en recherche de leur passé volé. Et vous aiderez un pays tout entier à faire face à son Histoire.
LE DÉFI

Il y a un défi dans ce projet, défi que j'affronte souvent dans mon travail : faire parler les responsables -  qu’ils soient médecins, infirmiers à la retraite, religieuses repenties, ou fonctionnaires. Mais c'est mon travail. Cela fait 20 ans que je suis journaliste, j'ai passé la majeure partie de ces années à la radio publique aux États-Unis. Je suis parfaitement bilingue, ayant vécu et travaillé en Espagne et en Amérique Latine au cours des 15 dernières années. Cette histoire sortira, avec ou sans le consentement des coupables.

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, je vous serais vraiment reconnaissant de partager cette campagne à travers vos réseaux sociaux et personnels. Nous avons besoin de toute l'aide disponible.

namaste friends,

i am traveling in southeast asia, jumping from ashrams to temples, in hopes of opening, exercising, and freeing a neglected body and recently traumatized mind.

most people viewing this know how i got here: a seizure in an emergency room, weeks of unconsciousness in a hospital, months of minimal brain cognition and maximum nausea, etc. 

i am very blessed to have raced to the hospital when i did, so my seizure happened on the floor of the emergency room instead of the floor of my hotel room in LA by myself. the neurologists made it very clear the grave consequence that would've occurred had it played out the other way.

here's a fun fact that most people don't know... that i left my extensive hospital stay on a Thursday in LA and was at my office Monday morning in NYC. there was some drooling, and some absence of memory and speech, but there was a far stronger will to just pretend that everything was fine. No biggy.

but it twas... it twas a biggy. and while my neurologist had begged me to take 6-8 weeks off of work to offer the brain some time to heal, i was certain if i could just get back on schedule, everything would go back to normal. 

aaaaaand it didnt. there were further ER visits, further inpatient hospitalizations, and just endless discouragement.

so the stars aligned, the moment came, and i decided to take recovery more seriously. and without any old school KOB obsessive and ongoing research of what to do, a solution came to me much more organically.

as in, it literally just sort of came to me: to learn yoga. 

again, with a cluttered and confused mind, with an underweight and unenthused body, it came out of nowhere but felt instantly affirming.

so i took my savings, and some money i made from selling 75% of my wardrobe on ebay.... and booked a one way ticket to southeast asia, in contact with a number of spiritual yoga centers to start a much more honest and heartfelt attempt at healing. 

that choice, and this journey, have done absolute wonders for my mind and body thus far. outside of the obvious physical improvements, i.e. the fact that i cant touch my goddamn toes for the first time in 15 years, the actual power and healing of the mind that has accompanied that is hard to even describe, and continues to humble me greatly. 

i promise not to get all hippy dippy, but the time i spent at one yoga temple in Sihanoukville, Cambodia this past month offers an incredible, unconditional example of this healing. in a yoga practice one evening centered around a chakra of the mind, while holding in a position for about 2 minutes, OUT OF NOWHERE, i literally burst into tears!

i stood up and tried to secretly make my way to the door but the instructor had caught the whole thing and chased after me to advise me to stay and just rest in Sivasana (laying on mat) for a bit. that this was a common occurrence, and wonderful indication that some healing had just taken place. and something had just departed from my mind. 

wooooo. makes me misty just talking about it. 

and so my faith in this trip, this practice, this learning, is incredible; i said it before and ill say it again, i am humbled.

even in check-in emails with family and friends, it is visible and inarguable to me that vocabulary, and identity, are slowly returning. so i am excited to keep going. healing. learning. mending. crying (if i must).

however this journey took a vicious punch in the face 2 weeks ago when i received a $2800 bill in the mail for my emergency hospitalization. i will save everyone from the novella of logistics i could write about in my attempt to seek out these potential costs and payments prior to my departure, only to consistently be informed that there was ""nothing on file"".

i took this information hard. was very troubled that what was feeling like the onset of an incredible education towards a healing process would come to a screeching halt. but i was in a temple and surrounded by love, support, and spirit, and found peace, found gratitude for the absolutely life changing experiences i have been afforded thus far. 

and the few that i had disclosed this turn of events to had all encouraged me to take this road, to open my mouth, ask for support. and this obsessively self sufficient, self sustaining, irish catholic O'Brien is gonna go with the flow on this one, gonna honor the humility that has been overwhelming me. 

im seeking to continue this journey. 

to keep bending and healing, growing and recovering.

and so this crowdfunding idea was born. 

to hopefully restore the ability (e.g. $2800) to continue participating in basic temples and ashrams as planned; to travel cheaply, and heal deeply, for as long as possible. to continue learning this physical and spiritual practice that has already brought such incredible love and light to this healing process. 


i have spent a lot of time thinking about replacing myself in this situation with a friend, and trying to think of how i would react upon word of this type of idea.  and i can say with whole hearted honesty that it could go either way. with means, i would drop a hunj or more no probs on someone in a similar position. and without means, i would respect someones intentions and attempt, but honor my own financial needs all the same.  

i beg of everyone to do the same. 

meaning participate if you can, and DON'T if you cant't

i have faith in the bigger picture, and i will be ok. regardless. 

promise.

all my love and light.

Hi,

I am David Ha'ivri. Over the past several years, I have been writing OpEds and commentary on current events from my home in Shomron (AKA ""the West Bank"") in Israel. My objective is to help people understand the issues and get a bit of perspective from a person like myself, who lives in the heart of a hotly debated region.

Many people around the world follow my posts on Facebook and Twitter, and have seen some of my articles and either responded in talkbacks or shared with their friends.

 I am currently launching a new project, the aim of which is to compile many of the articles that I have written over the past few years into a book. With the perspective of time passed, I might edit a bit and will add notes to explain the context of events addressed at the time.

 If you have been following my work, I think that you might enjoy having a copy of this book for a quick reference, and it should be helpful to others to get an inside view of what I have seen from here.

I am looking to raise $6500 for the self-publishing of this book. That amount should cover editing, typesetting, graphics for cover work, pre-production marketing, costs of sending out free copies to journalists and others who might help with publicity by providing positive feedback and write-ups.

In return for your pre-funding this production, you will be first to get a copy of the book when it is ready, and additional benefits, depending on the level of your support.

My hope is that you are as enthusiastic about this project as I am. I would appreciate your backing for this crowd funding project. Please share it with your friends on social media and encourage them to do the same.

Thank you for your support. I will keep you posted on the progress,

David Ha'ivri

all dread it. Many tell jokes about it. Politicians ignore it.
Businesses reap huge profits from it. Our seasoned citizen friends
face life changing decisions. We will all be there someday. “Voices
From My Heart” gives voice to their anxieties while providing a
gleam of hope. Real stories about common situations faced daily by
seasoned citizens give the voice. Suggestions and shared discussion
provides the gleam of hope. Expanding the reach of “Voices From My
Heart” through publication and a broadened distribution will carry
this gleam of hope to an ever widening group of people.
