#OpenSciLogs Story Project #1:

Popular Science is Always Changing

Many of us today have the burning question in our heads: where is science journalism going? What will the future of science publishing and popular reporting look like? 

But how can we understand the rapidly evolving field of popular science unless we understand the forces that have shaped its history?

In the early 19th century, science and religion were inextricably linked in the minds of the majority. Gradually though, throughout that century, secular science emerged as a major force. This was at first the reserve of the priviliged elite. 

Gradually, however, with the likes of Darwin, and later Einstein, the general public's perception began to be shaped by science as an independent entity - a means to understand the world. This was a fundamental shift in the popular consciousness.

This open science reporting project, lead by SciLogs.com blogger Robin Wylie (@rwylie9 on Twitter), will trace the changing perception of science in the general public in the USA and Europe. Together with you, the reader, we will look at the popular publications of the time - newspapers, magazines such as ""popular science"" - to try to understand how the modern form of science reporting evolved!

#OpenSciLogs Depends on You

Robin invites you to join him as he researches the history of published popular science publications and interviews popular science writers, editors and scholars. How has the approach to popular science journalism that we recognize today evolved, and how is still evolving?

Robin's investigation into the evolution of science journalism is the 1st installment of #OpenSciLogs, a new project at SciLogs.com designed to introduce crowd-funded, open, participatory science reporting to the science blogosphere and beyond.

This #OpenSciLogs story project depends upon YOUR participation, and the participation of other science writers and readers. This story will feature regular blog updates at Robin's SciLogs.com blog, Super Terrestrial, social media conversations (follow the hashtag #OpenSciLogs), and most importantly a public and editable Google Doc.

Robin plans to help you participate in this story by providing you with all of his raw materials: copies of old science publications, transcripts of his interviews with science writers and editors, and all of his raw notes. You can also make changes to the ongoing story in real time on this Google Doc. Robin also encourages you to provide comments on the story through the Google Doc and his blog post updates. And that's not all: all #OpenSciLogs content is published under a Creative Commons license, meaning you take and continue the story wherever you would like!

What We Need & What You Get

But in order to do all these great things, and make this story open and participatory, we need your help in funding the project! We need at least $750 to get this story rolling. If you donate, here is what you will be helping us do:
• Interview experts in popular science reporting, including writers, editors and scholars
• Travel (in the UK) to interviews
• Reward interviewees for their time
• Purchase old editions of popular science publications
• Produce multimedia (original illustrations, videos. etc.) for the story

If we surpass our goal, that would be GREAT, because any funds beyond the goal for this story project will help fund future story projects lead by other SciLogs bloggers.

And you get perks too! By funding this story, you can get:

The Impact of #OpenSciLogs

Science blogs and other new digital and social media platforms for science writing are exploding while in-depth traditional media coverage of science, especially investigative science journalism, suffers. Unfortunately, many science bloggers and science writers for new digital media outlets go unpaid or underpaid. How can we help fund high quality science reporting “from the ground up,” in a way that prompts scientists and science writers in digital and social media environments - including the science blogosphere - to participate collectively in creating more in-depth science journalism across the web?

This is where OpenSciLogs hopes to come in. The idea of OpenSciLogs is to combine crowd-funding with an “open notebook” and participatory approach to science writing, to produce in-depth science reporting from the ground up. By the ground up, we mean an ongoing science journalism process that starts in the science blogosphere, at SciLogs.com for now, and continues on to produce in-depth science storytelling in other nontraditional and traditional science media outlets across the web.

In an effort to encourage open participation in a science storytelling process that transcends the individual science writer and the individual science blog, this project also embodies an “open notebook” approach to in-depth science reporting. The “open notebook” approach involves full disclosure and public publishing of raw story materials, a focus on science research published in open access mediums, and encouraging scientific story sources to provide their contact information for follow-up coverage of the story. In other words, each blogger leading an OpenSciLogs story project will both be joined by other science writers and readers in the investigation and writing of the story, and supply everything another science blogger, journalist or media outlet would need to fact-check and continue the story. 

The conversation around each OpenSciLogs story project is meant to be open, and other journalists and bloggers should feel free to take the story to their own blogs, news sites, etc. By engaging readers and encouraging other science readers and writers to take the story in directions that interest them, OpenSciLogs’ bloggers will hopefully motivate others to participate actively in the story.

Each #OpenSciLogs story project will be a living, breathing investigation into an important topic in science or science communication, published under a Creative Commons license. It’s in-depth science reporting by SciLogs.com, but more importantly, it’s in-depth science reporting by You.

Robin's ""The Evolution of Popular Science"" is the very first #OpenSciLogs story project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can’t contribute financially doesn’t mean you can’t help!

We encourage all readers and writers interested in science to visit this Google Doc as Robin's story gets underway, to leave comments or even help write the story yourself!

Also, PLEASE spread the word about this campaign! Also follow us on Twitter @SciLogscom, and check out our hashtag #OpenSciLogs.

¿Qué?

Los poemas de Nicanor son unos versos sangrantes, brutalmente sinceros, que sirven de punto de partida a un Ezio Aydillo, convertido por decisión propia en un detective rural muy sui generis, para desenmarañar una trama de corrupción policial.

Con Los poemas de Nicanor, Ezio Aydillo se verá arrastrado a emprender la tarea quijotesca de desenterrar una verdad oculta e injusta. Para ello, luchará contra vientos y mareas, usando armas que rayan, a veces, entre lo más inverosímil y absurdo, entre lo más ingenuo y perverso, entre lo más real e irreal, con el único objetivo de llegar a un saneado y justo final.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Sergio Marín.

Caído en las garras de la vida en Barcelona, residió con su familia en Sant Sadurní D’anoia. Pronto, regresarían a La Rioja donde, desde su más tierna infancia, comenzaría a nutrirse con poemas y canciones de Bob Dylan, Javier Krahe o Paco Ibáñez. Tras pasar por la Banda Municipal de Ezcaray tocando la trompeta, en la adolescencia consiguió una guitarra y comenzó a escribir canciones para luego tocarlas en grupos de amigos a modo de diversión, dando también pequeños conciertos de manera aficionada.

Obrero en la industria del metal, a los veintiocho años canalizó sus inquietudes literarias escribiendo la novela corta Si la Luna no estuviera. Acto seguido se puso manos a la obra con Los poemas de Nicanor, habiéndose dado cuenta de que necesitaba escribir… y de que seguirá escribiendo.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Disfrutándose en cada paso, asciende los escalones de la vivienda planchándose la chaqueta con la mano que tiene libre. En la otra, un enrollado diario La Rioja se balancea al son de su extremidad. Al entrar en la vivienda, lo abre sobre la mesa para indicar con su dedo índice, valga la redundancia, una noticia escondida en el ángulo inferior derecho de una página par y que reza: ""Un empresario de Ezcaray se suicida en el refugio de Bonicaparra"". Y continúa sin demasiadas explicaciones: ""Varios montañeros encontraron el cuerpo ahorcado y no tardaron en avisar a las autoridades"".
          —Esto es falso —asegura Marañón.
          —¿No me diga? —ironiza Aydillo.
          —Se trata de una manipulación. Una noticia falsa. Una cortina de humo. Llámelo como quiera».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.
• Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
• Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
• Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Sergio Marín vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

Hi! My name is Freda Ponce and I have been passionate about vegan cooking for over 10 years. Over the years I have experienced cooking for people with multiple food allergies, allowing me to cater my recipes to unique dietary needs.   All of the recipes in my book are gluten-free, vegan, nightshade-free, and allium-free (onion-free).  And they taste great too!  Because of this I feel that it is important to get my  recipes out into the public domain.  My recipes could help numerous people understand food nutrition and histamine levels in the body. I have recreated many classic recipes as well as some unique raw vegan recipes.  The recipes also feature superfoods and tonic herbs which support health and longevity.  My tonic recipes have become a staple in my daily life.  This book also includes many dessert recipes that are decadent while being healthy at the same time. 

Over the years friends and family have urged me to complete my cookbook so they can get their hands on my recipes.  I have worked long and hard to get the recipes tested and to create pictures for the cookbook.  It has taken several years and now I need your help to get this project finished.  I need to raise money to pay a graphic designer to complete the cookbook.  Also, since I am self-publishing I will need capitol to get the books printed.   

Your contributions will go directly towards graphic design work as well as printing costs.  By supporting my cause you will basically be pre-ordering your cookbook while helping me bring my dreams to fruition.

GO TO RADICALANIMAL.NET FOR LATEST RESEARCH

WHAT IS 'RADICAL ANIMAL'?

(read my Guardian lead opinion piece launching project). 

RADICAL ANIMAL is a ""book-net"" - a full-length book-text combined with a social network - which explores how play and innovation can help us address the most urgent environmental challenges of our time. 

My name is Pat Kane, I'm a Glasgow-and-London-based writer, musician, activist and consultant. In 2004 I brought out a book called The Play Ethic, which celebrated the power and potential of play to transform both individuals and societies. 

But I realised about a year ago that the book had a serious omission. There was almost no consideration of climate change - and particularly how a low-carbon future challenged the creative, interactive lifestyles it described and prescribed.

RADICAL ANIMAL began as an attempt to rectify that omission. I've been talking widely and reading deeply in the areas of neuroscience, evolutionary theory, networks, eco-economics, sustainability and many other areas, trying to answer some basic questions:
<li>
How much does hyper-consumerism exploit that playful side of our human nature that loves novelty, pleasure and innovation? And:
• Can we reconnect our creative selves to a new kind of lifestyle - one that pursues the active joys of making, sharing, crafting and collaborating?

In terms of getting this message out, I started going down the route I travelled before (long book, sharp agent, big publisher...) But I soon realised I'd have to do things differently, in the era of social media, print-on-demand and the power of community involvement - not to mention the consideration of treading lightly upon the planet's resources.

So I've come up with the idea of a ""book-net"" as a way both to get RADICAL ANIMAL written, and involve a community of stakeholders in its creation, development and future. 



WHAT IMPACT WILL ""RADICAL ANIMAL"" HAVE ON THE WIDER WORLD?

Firstly I want RADICAL ANIMAL to shift some of the basic discussions that we're having about our response to climate change. I think that green activism is great at showing how our developed-world lifestyles will have to radically change as climate change begins to worsen (as it will now inevitably do). But they haven't done a great job in breaking through the complacency of all those currently locked into high-consumption living. Asking people to wear a hair-shirt won't do it - but showing how much hedonism and lasting satisfaction lies on the other side of the work-to-earn-to-consume civilisation might do.

I think that talking about play is key in this: it's both an instantly familiar aspect of our own experience, but one that we also share with other natural creatures. Making a strong case for the enabling conditions of play - the combination of support and risk, of caring and freedom it involves - will bring us new insights into how we reshape our societies and economies, so we can support the kind of low-impact joy and conviviality that playful activities bring to our lives.

Secondly, I want RADICAL ANIMAL to be a network that gathers together best practice in creative, innovative and playful responses to the challenges of sustainability. I've built the basic site on the Ning platform because I want to support whatever active community springs up around the ideas in the book, and takes them forward into their own lives, organisations and localities. 

  • And thirdly - and most conventionally - I'd like RADICAL ANIMAL to be a really good book! But not one produced and consumed in the usual ways... I intend to use print-on-demand services like Lulu and Blurb to get the book out to people, if they want it in a traditional format. But I want to embrace the new e-book platforms like Amazon Kindle and iBooks, as well as other means of digital distribution. And if you feel interested enough to get involved at this early stage of the process, I want to try out a different, closer relationship between writer and reader. For more on which, see below... .


WHAT WE NEED - & WHAT YOU GET
WHAT WE NEED
$10,000 is my target amount (£6062.00 at a $ rate to UK sterling of $1.6496) - twice the number initially suggested by IndieGoGo when you initially sign on.

The bulk of this money ($2000 per month, covering May-August 2011) is to buy me some time to write the initial RADICAL ANIMAL manuscript. Most of the research is done - it just requires being chained to a keyboard for regular, concentrated periods until August. I'll obviously be expending my own resources, until your good generosity and interest provides... :-)

The remaining $2000 will cover some of the costs of setting up the ""book-net"" - the yearly cost of a Ning Pro network ($659.77/£399.95),  costs to engage with Blurb, Lulu, Amazon Kindle, iBooks and other platforms, some kind of layout, design and coding for the book text itself.
WHAT YOU GET
Please look at the list of perks at the right hand side of this page. The general principle is that the more you can give, the more of my time, customised input and personal commitment you can buy.

On all the perks up until the August deadline, I'm going to provide a free PDF copy of the book with no DRM constraints, as a special gift to early contributors (I'm following Douglas Rushkoff's model with Program or Be Programmed). But after that, Radical Animal will only be available digitally in a DRM format, and through the emerging platforms - Kindle, iBook, Nook, etc.

I've priced the ""Real-World"" consults (ones that involve me moving around in space and time, across the UK, US and EU, burning up carbon) quite expensively. And the Skype-chat/webinar option quite cheaply (presuming it's a much less resource intensive exercise).

My usual consulting business has a whole different rate structure (talk to me!) - but this is all a grand experiment, specifically aimed at making the book-net viable and possible. I have limited the amounts of these perks numerically, on a reasonable assessment of how much time I'll be able to spend on them over the next 12 months.
HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP US?

If you want to help RADICAL ANIMAL get off the ground, and you think friends and colleagues might be interested in supporting it, please use all the ""Share Tools"" at the top of this page - including links to Facebook and Twitter. You'll find them underneath the graphic at the top.

I'd also love to see you on the RADICAL ANIMAL site on Ning - there's lots of opportunities there to connect with others interested in the book-net, and upload videos, pictures and blogs. The site already has regular feeds from my research and presentations on this topic, and I'll be keeping people updated on how the book is going with videos, podcasts, and other media.
THANKS FOR YOUR ATTENTION!
This is a bit of a cra-zee experiment- let's see if it works! If you want to contact me directly, please visit my biography site
Very best, PK

Short Summary

This
book by ghost whisperer Laura Powers tells true stories about her work and life
with ghost, spirits, and paranormal communication.  She shares wild stories about ghosts and gives
tips on how to manage spirits and what to do when you encounter things that go
bump in the night! You’ll also get a behind the scenes look at what it is like
to live life while sensing things that are invisible to most other people.
You can find more information about Laura and
her work in this field at www.healingpowers.net.  You can even find a video of her doing this
work on the video page.

Who is Laura Powers?

Laura is a medium, clairvoyant, and angel communicator who saw and sensed
ghosts and spirits since she was little.
In her journey to learn how to understand what was happening, to protect
herself, and work with spirits safely (the topic of her first book Life and the After-Life), she started
working with angels (the topic of her second book, <i>Angels:  How to Understand,
Recognize and Receive Their Guidance).
Once she mastered the ability to work safely with this realm, she
started her working clear spaces that were haunted.
What the Book is About
This
book is about ghost, demons, dark entities, and paranormal communication.  Laura gives her perspective on this work and
debunks common misconceptions and helps illuminate this often misunderstood
topic.  She shares stories about friendly
ghosts, aggressive ghosts, and some that are simply lost and looking for help.  Also included are tips for what to do if you
encounter one of these beings on your own!
How the Funds Will be Used
Professional
editing of the manuscript, cover photo and design by Penny O photography, printing
by the Tattered Cover Press, and formatting of the book in ebook formats for
the kindle and other ereaders (mobi and epub format).  This budget covers getting the book
print-ready, printing, and epublishing only.
Every dollar we raise above the $1,000 budget will be used for marketing
and traveling to promote the book.

Story of My Book
Silicon Valley Stories: True stories about startup life

My name is Adam Beguelin. I am a serial entrepreneur who has worked at and founded multiple successful Silicon Valley startups. Along the way I’ve managed to collect quite a few stories that, when I tell my friends and colleagues, I often hear: “You should write a book!” Silicon Valley Stories is that book:  a collection of  crazy, instructional, and hopefully entertaining stories from my time in Silicon Valley.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what really happens inside Silicon Valley startups, and it will instill in you the same passion and excitement that I have for doing startups. Ultimately, this book can be used as a tool to help you navigate the startup world, or perhaps just reflect on the nature of work.

I've worked at seven Silicon Valley tech startups and co-founded four. I've had two exits, one IPO and one acquisition. That's almost a 30% hit rate, so not bad by Silicon Valley standards where conventional wisdom tells us that 9 out of 10 startups fail. People think that joining a startup is a surefire way to get rich. The odds are against you, but it does happen.
In this book you'll learn about what it's like to work at or found a tech startup and how that experience can change your life.  You'll see:
<ul>
• What’s it like to take risks and see them pay off
• What it’s like to have a failed or zombie startup
• What people do if they win the startup lottery
You will love this book if you're interested in the startup world or wonder what happens to those who are part of it.

Silicon Valley Stories is a non-fiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs and potential founders who are looking at starting a company or are just curious about the world of work and leisure in Silicon Valley.
The Book - Silicon Valley Stories
The book is written in 4 Parts.

Part 1: Pre Silicon Valley covers my life as a computer geek in the 80s as I navigated the upper echelons of the academic technology world. You’ll see how a certain willingness to take risks and keep an open mind lead me back and forth across the USA and even to Europe. In fact a chance meeting in Lisbon changed my life and landed me a job at Carnegie Mellon University.

Part 2: Inktomi Days is about my time working at Inktomi, a Wall Street darling of the dotcom bubble in the late 1990s. You’ll see what it’s like to interview at a startup and get an inside glimpse of what happens when a company goes through an IPO. What it’s like to ride a rocket ship startup as it takes off and then when it craters.

Part 3: Truveo Days covers my second successful startup. Truveo was a perfect storm of tech, talent, and timing. You’ll see how things work when the planets align and a startup can execute in sync with what’s happening in the tech world and the market. You’ll also see an example of what happens to a promising young technology company after it’s absorbed into a large corporation.

Part 4: Post Economic Life is about what happens when you no longer have to work for a living. I tried my hand at a few more startups, none of which made any money, but I learned some valuable lessons along the way. You’ll meet Silicon Valley entrepreneurs who can’t stop working and keep turning the startup crank. You’ll see how others were able to alter their focus and enjoy a more leisurely lifestyle, even though true success in retirement doesn't mean actually retiring.

About the Author

Dr. Beguelin is a Puerto Rico-based entrepreneur and investor. He began his career as a research professor at Carnegie Mellon University in 1992. In 1996, he joined Inktomi, an early pioneer in search and internet software, as Senior Scientist. Inktomi went public in 1998 and was later acquired by Yahoo in 2003. In 2004 Dr. Beguelin co-founded Truveo, where he was CTO. Truveo was one of the first a video search engines when video was just becoming prevalent on the internet. AOL acquired Truveo in 2006. Following the acquisition, he joined AOL as a Vice President of AOL Video. Since 2007, Dr. Beguelin has been a serial entrepreneur and angel investor.

Dr. Beguelin holds a Bachelors in Science from Emory University where he graduated summa cum laude. He received his Doctorate in Computer Science from the University of Colorado at Boulder. He is a founder of CMU Silicon Valley and holds 10 patents.

I’ve always been somewhat baffled by the purpose of life. I started off on the standard college path and rode that series of academic escalators all the way to a faculty position, without really thinking too much about it. Silicon Valley Stories: True stories about startup life

My name is Adam Beguelin. I am a serial entrepreneur who has worked at and founded multiple successful Silicon Valley startups. Along the way I’ve managed to collect quite a few stories that, when I tell my friends and colleagues, I often hear: “You should write a book!” Silicon Valley Stories is that book:  a collection of  crazy, instructional, and hopefully entertaining stories from my time in Silicon Valley.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what really happens inside Silicon Valley startups, and it will instill in you the same passion and excitement that I have for doing startups. Ultimately, this book can be used as a tool to help you navigate the startup world, or perhaps just reflect on the nature of work.

I've worked at seven Silicon Valley tech startups and co-founded four. I've had two exits, one IPO and one acquisition. That's almost a 30% hit rate, so not bad by Silicon Valley standards where conventional wisdom tells us that 9 out of 10 startups fail. People think that joining a startup is a surefire way to get rich. The odds are against you, but it does happen.
In this book you'll learn about what it's like to work at or found a tech startup and how that experience can change your life.  You'll see:

Short Summary

My name is Nina Raman and I am the author of Everything You Wanted. I wrote this book because I wanted to share a story about growing up with a battle of perfection, but with a dark twist.

My hope is that in reading this book, you will discover that your desires are not wrong. They might turn out to be everything you wanted, or they might turn your life completely upside down. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to discover yourself and learn how your decisions have a massive effect on your life. I want this book to be a way for you to escape a world of your own and live through a group of teens who enter a whole new world of fear, mystery, and the unknown.

Wren Clements has spent her whole life trying to be perfect. As her high school career is about to come to an end, she realizes that what she wants more than her amazing grades, her numerous extracurriculars, and even more than her spot at UPenn, is to live like a normal teenager for one crazy, lawless night. She embarks on an evening filled with things she would never do... including a murder? Could this star student be the perfect suspect, or could this be the perfect crime?

You will love this book if you love relatable and diverse characters, juicy love stories, and a perfectly gruesome crime. Everything You Wanted speaks to teenagers and adults who want to grapple with perfection and desire vs. regret in a new way.
Ultimately, I hope that Everything You Wanted inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
<ul>
• Do you have any regrets in life?
• Are you willing to risk everything to fulfill a desire?
• Are you happy with yourself, or want something someone else has?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing what truly matters to you, the battle of perfection, and personal growth will change us all for the better.
What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
<ul>
• The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
• The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
• The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
• The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
• The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
• You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
• Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
• You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
• You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
• You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
• And much more!
About the Author

Nina Raman is a junior Management Information Systems major at Temple University in Philadelphia, PA. Although her major is technical and she spends most of her time running clubs and meeting new people, she always makes time for her true love: writing.

Her dream since she was in 3rd grade was to always be an author. She’s been obsessed with storytelling for as long as she can remember, so it’s no question why she decided to write a book. Nina’s goal has always been to help people feel something like a connection, even if they don’t have one in real life. Characters are our friends, family, teachers, enemies, and lovers. She hopes that you will feel connected to a character or two, learn from their mistakes, and even make a few of your own. She wants you to not just read her story, but live in it.

When Nina doesn’t have her nose in a book or is vigorously typing out the lines of her novel on her laptop, she loves meeting new people, exploring new places, trying new food, and hanging out with friends. And if she’s ever late (which she almost always is,) she most likely stopped to pet a dog. 

For more information, you can connect with Nina Raman at ninaraman00@gmail.com and at Instagram: @ninaramanwrites TikTok: @nina_raman Twitter: @nina_noodles1 LinkedIn: Nina Raman .
Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, and TikTok with your friends, family, and network. Please use #EverythingYouWanted and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nina Raman

Why 1 Color Kaleidoscope?

I'm a person first and foremost. I feel that we as individuals lose sight of our humanity as we deal with the difficulties in life. It's hard to see someone else's struggle while blinded by your own. My goal in this book is to illustrate the struggles and beauty in our lives by being an example. I've done my best to be honest and speak on a breadth of my experiences. I pray you are ready to accept.
<ul><li>Five Chapters<ul>
• Color Me Artist
• Color Me Lonely
• Color Me In Love
• Color Me Upset
• Color Me Human
Where Does The Money Go?
I'm Glad You Asked:
<ul>
• I'm seeking $1,500 to be able to print the book, pay my editors, get an ISBN number, handle copyrights, pay a cover designer, etc...
• I've put together a fun set of donor perks including online shoutouts, personalized haiku, and crocheted goods (that I'm making myself!)

A distancia do espectador é unha primeira aproximación á narrativa. Como tal, sendo consciente dos tropezos habituais, e comprensibles, do principiante; estes asúmense na personalidade do protagonista, envolvéndoo nun xogo que remite a escenas familiares en compaña de personaxes que poden encaixar en certos arquetipos. Formando así a sensación do protagonista de caída no tópico, na parodia na que en ocasións semella verse.

Nin intre intrascendentem, Mat, un rapaz aínda nese medio do camiño entre a adolescencia e o adulto ao que lle custa chegar e o desconcerta, decide deixarse de aprazamentos e atreverse a marchar da casa e do pobo que o viu medrar sen sorpresa. Á procura de algo que o motive, que o esperte do monótono.

Ao longo da novela coñeceremos os personaxes e os lugares cos que se atopa o protagonista. O Lagon, un bar oculto e esquecido, onde son habituais Roman, o mariñeiro afastado do mar, e o pintor Erwan Joubert. Tamén ela estará alí. Na libraría Moustache encontrará as voces dos libros que agardan ser rescatados. Todos eles, cada un a seu xeito, marcarán a Mat e influirán no relato. Sempre a través das súas impresións, teremos unha idea dos seus pensamentos e da súa mirada. Por momentos fantasiosa e idealizadora, ás veces escéptica e desencantada.
Quen?

Do Peirao é unha editorial con vontade de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionais pero de incuestionable calidade, con novas e refrescantes ideas como é o empregar unha campaña preventa para valorar a aceptación e viabilidade de cada título.

Deste xeito es ti, agora que te estás expondo como colaborar, o que decide se a obra que che presentamos verá a luz pasando a formar parte do noso catálogo... porque consideramos ao lector parte fundamental do proceso.
Hoxe presentámosvos a Javier Pereiro.

Nado en 1990 en Lalín, logo de criarse en Agolada volve á súa vila natal, onde reside actualmente. Nos libros encontrou un lugar onde espertaban o interese e a paixón. Co paso das lecturas, cando xurdiu a necesidade de crear e expresarse, levárono á escrita como medio máis axeitado e que máis o motivaba. Dende o 2018 leva a libraría Vagalume de Lalín. Busca a voz na poesía e na narrativa co fin de encontrar algo que contar. Faino polo baixo, gardando no caixón que agora entreabre con A distancia do espectador.
Por que?
Por aquí un fragmento do texto como mostra:

«A agulla foi descendendo, non tardaría en chegar á reserva e comezaba a sentirme canso. Quixen emular aos fuxitivos. Cando o fulgor duns faros asomaba polo retrovisor, erseguíndome, apertaba o volante e pisaba a fondo ata perdelos de vista e deixalos atrás, desaparecendo nunha curva. Se me alcanzaban, a persecución tornábase nunha carreira na que a seguinte sinal determinaba o vencedor cando un dos dous chegase a ela en cabeza. Perdín algunha, e era eu quen se quedaba vendo ir ao campión, afastándose na recta despexada e esvaecéndose diante dos meus ollos. Aqueles que conseguían adiantarme, sen entender e algo irados, pasaban a meu carón e miraban preguntando a que demo xogaba. Nunha desas albisquei o letreiro que indicaba a próxima saída e a estación de servizo.
          Deteríame alí, era a metade do camiño e todo ía segundo o previsto. Eran finais de setembro, amencera sobre as oito e o sol ascendía e prometía o pulso dun verán que se resistía a marchar».
Como?
Para arrincar o proxecto fixámonos como obxectivo 880€; esta é a cantidade que recadariamos se ao redor de cincuenta mecenas se fixesen, cada cal, cun exemplar desta primeira edición.
<ul>
• Tendo acceso ás galeradas de edición.
• Recibindo un exemplar semanas antes da saída ao mercado da obra.
• Aínda que, tamén poderías ver o teu nome nos agradecementos achegando un pouco máis.

Aviso para navegantes: A opción BACK IT é únicamente para realizar doazóns á edición, polo que non haberá comunicacións posteriores na procura de datos de envío... calquera das opcións válidas de reserva esixe cumplimentar formulario para poder servir o pedido.
Ademais...

Sabemos que son tempos difíciles, tamén nós os sufrimos, e é posible que non esteas en disposición de apoiarnos co teu mecenado nestes momentos... pero agardamos que se isto te chegou á alma, mesmo se talvez coñeces en persoa ao autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-orella... ) para que academos a nosa meta e Javier Pereiro vexa publicada a súa obra.
Grazas polo voso tempo.
Política de privacidade

Hi! My name is Kate Hurley. I am a blogger, writer, musician, and worship leader.

This campaign is to raise funds for my upcoming book called Getting Naked Later: A Guide For the Fully Clothed. This is a humorous and touching book about my journey as a thirty something Christian single. It is in written in the style of Donald Miller and Lauren Winner- part memoir, part advice. You can read some of my writing ahead of time on my blog; thesexycelibate.com.

20% of the profits from this book after it is published will go to two organizations that I love, AIDchild.org, an orphanage that takes care of orphans with AIDS in Uganda, and iempathize.org, an organization that fights sex trafficking. I will not be able to publish this book without your help!

I have LOTS of fun incentives including copies of the book when it comes out, my music, my brand new CD which contains all songs from God's perspective when it comes out, my coming to your community to do concerts and workshops, and maybe the most fun one, me writing a song and recording it for someone you love (for Christmas or other occasions!) Dear Potential investor,
I started writing as a teenager, over the past 20 years I worked on a wide range of stories - ranging from children's books to romance, to action books.
When i started writing, it was more a hobby, the thought of publishing impossible - at the time the digital age/web as we know it was non-existent.

My passion for writing went beyond scribbling on pages, since the age of 11 I had wanted to rescue animals in need (while living in the Caribbean I saw animal abused first hand and we rescued 18 stray dogs and 23 cats).  In my 20's while living on the northern shores of the Outer Banks, NC amongst the wild horses, I knew my true calling, to try and adopt those we could.  My husband and I adopted six wild horses.  These horses were removed for population control purposes.  It broke my heart that they would have to leave but more so that they were being torn from their herds and their home.  In addition to writing on other subjects, I started writing about my experience with adopting the horses, the challenges and sacrifices we had to make, the extensive research it took to make sure they ate similar to their natural habit (while keeping their immune system in optimum shape) and the search and journey we began to try and find a new home where they could live out their lives free.  I battled local politicians and even ran for office to try and save their lands and put a stop to them being torn from their homes but it wasn't enough.

One of my children's books is about a mischievous boy who teaches adults a few lessons in life.  The setting takes place in a castle with magic and wonderful adventures.  Another children's book is based on crabs - an animated book of sorts based on their beach adventures and encounters with humans and sea adventures with sea life, these teens get into trouble and help each other out- it has a lot of humor for adults and children.  I could see both being movies.  I shared quite a bit with friends and family, even reading some and they have pushed me to finish.

Financially my husband and I have used every bit of money to find a small bit of land for the horses, we built them a a small barn and installed fencing.  We live in a mobile home that is in disrepair.  Work has become more scarce for me - I do freelance/consulting work as a technical writer.  I have my truck for sale but doubtful I will get a buyer.  We are behind in bills and I have been worried here.  I realized I need to finish my books, it's the one chance I have that could make all the difference in the world.

You can read more about the horses and see a few pictures on this news article:http://www.thevanguard.ca/Living/2010-12-16/article-2048008/Mustangs-settling-into-new-home/1 Please keep in mind we moved from that location to a property with a little less than 10 acres.

Funding for my book writing will allow me to finish several.  The first two I want to focus on are the children's books.  I would need to hire someone to create some of the animated scenes.  Publishing children's books is costly but I hope to approach Disney and other production companies when the books are published - for potential purchase or shared royalties.
I will provide signed copies of my books to those who help with funding.

I am worried about sharing too much of my books here because the ideas could be stolen - until I get them copyright protected.  I would be happy to share more with anyone seeking to invest a larger sum and could discuss sharing a royalty percentage.

I was reminded by a friend on just how the writer of the Harry Potter series got started - she found a publishing company that believed in her when most other companies turned her away.  My friend knows and I know that some of the stories I have been writing are big - they will eventually turn into movies, the story lines, the humor and the lessons learned are all eloquently pieced together to keep the reader on the edge of their seats - laughing, learning and being entertained.

After I get the first two children's books published, I have another book about a Naval Academy graduate who struggles to handle a long distance relationship - it's filled with suspense, trials and errors, romance, brotherhood and life on the go.

When I complete the book on my experience with the wild horses titled ""The last 11 miles and 1173 to go"" it will be more of a documentary/biography with photo images and a whirlwind of a story that will take the readers on our journey from having to move out west, to back east, to the north.  We covered thousands of miles, worked in freezing rains to fix fencing and build them shelter, we sacrificed the home we built, and our savings.

Please give me a chance to prove I can do this, to know that your contribution will make a huge difference by allowing me to publish which in turn will continue to help care for the wild horses under our wing.
Thank you, please let me know if you have any questions or need anything further.
Sincerely,
Rachael Grout

I am worried about sharing too much of my books here because the ideas could be stolen - until I get them copyright protected.  I would be happy to share more with anyone seeking to invest a larger sum and could discuss sharing a royalty percentage.

I was reminded by a friend on just how the writer of the Harry Potter series got started - she found a publishing company that believed in her when most other companies turned her away.  My friend knows and I know that some of the stories I have been writing are big - they will eventually turn into movies, the story lines, the humor and the lessons learned are all eloquently pieced together to keep the reader on the edge of their seats - laughing, learning and being entertained.

After I get the first two children's books published, I have another book about a Naval Academy graduate who struggles to handle a long distance relationship - it's filled with suspense, trials and errors, romance, brotherhood and life on the go.

When I complete the book on my experience with the wild horses titled ""The last 11 miles and 1173 to go"" it will be more of a documentary/biography with photo images and a whirlwind of a story that will take the readers on our journey from having to move out west, to back east, to the north.  We covered thousands of miles, worked in freezing rains to fix fencing and build them shelter, we sacrificed the home we built, and our savings.

Please give me a chance to prove I can do this, to know that your contribution will make a huge difference by allowing me to publish which in turn will continue to help care for the wild horses under our wing.
Thank you, please let me know if you have any questions or need anything further.
Sincerely,
Rachael Grout",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Our Story
In November 2006, I created a website about the novel The Master and Margarita by Mikhail Bulgakov. I started it as an amateur - in the true sense of the word: a lover of the novel.
You can watch it by clicking here.
<div>
The Impact

Originally it was a very modest project, only in Dutch, but thanks to the enthusiastic reaction of many visitors it has grown into a four-language website of 3,000 pages. It explains the social, cultural and economical context of the novel, with comprehensive annotations per chapter. It explains Bulgakov's satirical hints to characters and locations. It contains hundreds of essays written about the novel, and it presents hundreds of adaptations by various artists: films, theatre plays, illustrations, comic strips and much more. It could already welcome more than 1.6 million visitors. 78% of them return regularly. The website is updated daily. Every day, visitors send more content, scholars ask for additional information, and artists ask to promote their Master and Margarita adaptations.
<div>
What We Need & What You Get

A work of such size, however, calls for financial resources beyond the potential of an amateur like me. I’m facing growth issues at the level of the content maintenance workload, the financing and the technical aspects. I could consider to accept commercial messages on the website, but I dislike banners and annoying and disturbing pop-ups. Therefore I'm doing this fund raising. The proceeds of it will be used entirely to maintain and develop the website.

I don't want nothing for nothing. On demand of many visitors of the website, I made subtitles - in English, Spanish, French and Dutch - of some movie adaptations of The Master and Margarita. And the Bulgarian artist Arina Georghita made an exclusive set of 5 illustrations of the novel. Both the DVD's and the illustrations are offered as Perks for donations.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
You can help by making a contribution, of course. But also by spreading the word and linking this page to your social networks. Thanks in advance.

The Write Treatment Anthology 2016

In 2011, after having completed treatment for breast cancer I began running creative writing workshops at Mt. Sinai Beth Israel Hospital in NYC.   During  treatment I put my writing practice aside to deal with the rigors  of surgery,
chemotherapy and radiation. Once the cancer was in remission,  I resumed my writing practice, and soon after I was thrilled to be notified that  my novel, <u>Stalina,</u>
was a pick from the Amazon Debut Novel Award Contest and was published by Mariner Books.

With my writing life back on track, I wanted to give back to the community of doctors, nurses, social workers and patients who helped me through my cancer journey.  I wanted the workshops to provide time for the participants to take a break from the rigors of cancer; to think and write. The workshops were given a “green light” by the hospital and I received funding from Poets and Writers Readings and Workshop Programs and the Lower Manhattan Cultural Council.   In 2013 I took over a similar program at Mt. Sinai West Hospital (formerly Roosevelt) from Susan Ribner, a friend and colleague.   We both knew first hand how important the workshops are to the cancer community. While Susan was in hospice she asked if I would continue her work.  I humbly agreed, and when Susan sadly passed away,  I have continued the workshops as well as a journaling workshop at Mt. Sinai Beth Israel.

The writing in the workshops is nothing less than inspiring, and my dream of publishing an anthology is on its way to becoming a reality with your support. I personally have experienced the thrill of being published, and want the  dedicated and talented writers in the workshops to see their work in book form.  I  have received a matching grant from the Heidi Paoli Fund, a donor advised fund of the New York Community Trust, which has been a past supporter of the workshops, and this year has also seen the importance of the anthology by offering to support the design, editing and publication of the anthology. In order to fulfill the matching grant from the Paoli Fund we need to raise $5000.
The WRITE
TREATMENT Anthology 2016 will be approximately 200 pages in length and will include the

writings of 20 participants.  The writing from the  workshops is honest, heartfelt and moving.  The stories, memoirs and poems are  wildly imaginative,  funny and sometimes even a bit risqué.  Fierce, funny, and artful. I will also take this opportunity through the anthology to memorialize those writers we have lost.  In addition to Susan Ribner, there are several others whose spirited  commitment to the workshops is evident in their writing.   It will be an honor to publish this work as well as that of the people who come every week to write and share in this growing community of writers.

By supporting the Write Treatment Anthology 2016 at any level you are also insuring the continuation of the workshops. The published anthology will be distributed throughout Mt. SInai's Cancer Centers for free, and will be sold as an eBook in support of the workshops.
I will close with words from Dennis Paoli of the Heidi Paoli Fund, whose wife the  fund honors.

""The benefits of writing--therapeutic for the patient and survivor, transformative for the medical culture and larger community--are obvious and well-documented, but equally as important, writing records the moral courage of all those who struggle with cancer, and in the shadow of loss, creates something lasting.""
Thank you for considering this request.
All the best,
Emily Rubin, Author/Instructor

What is Pants on Fire?

Four years ago on Valentine's Day my life turned upside down when I found out that the man I was planning to marry was a completely different person...down to the fake accent he used. (Yes, really.) To find out more about that, check out the video posted on this campaign or my blog www.pantsonfiretour.com.

Four years later, I am sitting in New Zealand, at the very start of this journey in which I am following the path of this story around the world. Pants on Fire is the name of the blog I am keeping along the way & the working title of the book I am writing.
Only half of this story has happened. You are watching details of the rest of the story unfold on the blog, and supporting the writing process of the book manuscript.
Who am I?

My name is Jennifer Casale. I have an MFA in Creative Writing from the University of Arizona. I am an optimist. I am a poet. I am an entrepreneur and an environmentalist. I am a hard worker & for the next seven and a half months, writing this story is my job.
What will you be using this money for?
<div>

I have been working two and three full time jobs for most of the past year. I have purchased the plane tickets, visas and immunizations. It was important to me to get this far before asking for any help. I knew the odds of me being able to pull this off were not great. But here I am. Day 3 into this journey. I woke up in a tent on a sheep farm in New Zealand this morning. One backpack filled with everything I will need for almost 8 months. I have already written more in the past two days than I have in the past three years. Now I just need to buy time. I need to be able to get a cup of coffee and sit and write all day. I need to buy bus and train tickets in each city. I need to sleep in safe hostels. This is a low budget project.
Best and Worst Case Scenarios:
If I don't meet the goal, I will still figure out some way to survive. I will work odd jobs. I will find a way. I am determined to write this book and send this story out into the world.
If I meet the goal, I will be able to focus on my job....and I will happy cry. A lot.

If I exceed the goal, I will first pass out, and then upon waking, make sure any money I don't absolutely need goes towards doing things along the way to make people smile....and those stories will end up on the blog and some of them will surely end up in the book....and you will have been responsible for making all of that happen. I believe we each have a tremendous power to influence and change each other's lives with the smallest gestures. It could be buying toys for an orphanage, paying for a child's schooling, buying groceries for someone, buying medicine, returning a small kindness to someone who showed me kindness without ever expecting a thing in return...whatever is needed, and whatever will make someone smile and feel hope.
<div>
The Impact

I believe it is my job to tell this story and write this book. Even though the details of what happened and why I am here are unique and strange, I believe there is a universal message of love, hope, survival and truth that can be understood and felt by everyone.

If Harper Collins emailed me tomorrow and offered me a book deal, that would be great, but the chances of that happening are about as good as me winning the Tennessee Jackpot all the way from the other side of the world. It is so difficult for new musicians and writers to get deals. In a way, that is sad, but the most determined artists still find a way to produce their work. I love sites like Indie Gogo that allow art to be nurtured and supported by individuals who believe in the project during the creation stage. I believe there is something so much more authentic about that beginning.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone reading this has money to contribute. I understand. Totally. You can still support this project by sharing this page and the blog (www.pantsonfiretour.com) with friends and family members. Thank you!

About the book...

 

Are you a Blue Jays fan, a fan of baseball or sports in general? Have you ever wondered how your favorite players made it to the big leagues? Are you interested in the prospects that will some day be the core of the Blue Jays teams? Do you love a story of going against the odds and achieving a dream?

I have loved following the Jays since I was a kid. I loved the sport, the players, the stats, the drama, the race for the playoffs. I have been writing books and articles for business, sports and music newspapers and magazines for over twenty years and always set my sights on writing a book about how a player makes it to the big leagues.

The typical ball player coming out of high school or college joins a pool of hundreds of players trying to make it to the top, with many more being drafted year after year behind them. They battle it out through years in the minor league system and only the best of the best get the call that they are headed to the show. This is their story.

I have followed the Vancouver Canadians, the Blue Jays' Short-Season A affiliate, and first stop for many new draft picks, through the 2014 season. I will then follow these 30+ players for the next few years as they tackle each level of the minors and work their way up to the big club. Most will never make it as far as AAA, but some will, and eventually crack the Jays line-up like recent Jays and former Canadians players Marcus Stroman and Aaron Sanchez did.

The book follows every aspect of the players lives - wins, struggles and progress. It goes behind the scenes at the ballpark, into each minor league club and their cities and fans. I also speak to scouts, coaches, executives, former Jays players and other key figures who select the players and guide them to greatness.
You will get a rare look at baseball's minor league system and it will have you rooting for your favorite prospects. It will be a must-read for all Jays fans!

What is the funding for?

 

Your help will allow me to travel to each minor league city (Lansing, Dunedin, New Hampshire, Buffalo) as well as trips to Spring Training and the Dominican facilities where many of the players were discovered that are being followed in the book.
Perks are copies of the book, signed copies and thank yous...without your great support this amazing project could not happen, so thank you all in advance for being a part of this incredible journey!

Sitting in a beginner’s knitting class, I was baffled when a clear, strong voice within me piped up and said, “I want to write about Ann.” Ann Sokolowski, our knitting instructor, was wise-cracking, opinionated and brimming over with a vast array of knitting tips. Granted, I enjoyed her immensely, but ... write about her? Not only was I not an expert knitter, I did not even consider myself a writer!

Yet the notion persisted, and a few months later, when I asked permission to write about her, she agreed. Now I was in deep water! I started taking notes, imagining a collection of notes and colorful quotes (“Etch this on your eyelids: never, ever, ever, ever knot your yarn!”) Maybe I could Xerox some copies and give them to my classmates. Perhaps I could sell a few at a local knitting store.

All that changed when Ann passed away nine months into our class. Shortly after, my father passed away, and a year later, my mother. As I explored the possible reasons for that inner voice – “I want to write about Ann” – I started to see the mysterious ways our lives intertwined. I began to perceive the gems of wisdom hidden beneath the surface of Ann’s gruff exterior and I recognized Ann’s presence in my life as a gift of healing from trauma I had experienced as a child, trauma I had carried deep within me my whole adult life. Ann authorized me to speak on her behalf. In doing so, for the first time in my life, I felt free to speak on my own behalf as well.

Ann had a rare gift to touch people’s lives. In “Follow the Yarn” my personal story of healing shares the pages with Ann’s copious and sensible knitting tips, and with the wit and wisdom in her approach to teaching and creating knit wear. Throughout, Follow the Yarn is a tribute to Ann Sokolowski, a New York original, and a quietly extraordinary individual.
And that's where you come in - as many knitters know, starting a project is tons of fun – it’s the finishing up – oh those pesky seams – that can be a chore.

I need your help to bring ""Follow The Yarn"" to completion. The money rasied will go toward editing, layout and cover design. Any amount is welcome. And if you can't contribute won't you please like our Facebook page, share our Vimeo video or tell your friends about us?
""Follow the Yarn"" is not only a story about knitting but also a story about healing and a tribute to a quietly extraordinary individual.
Thanks so much for sharing my story, my excitement about this journey, and my passion to get this out into the world. Thanks for helping me sew it all together!
Advance praise:

“Poignant and poetic, heartfelt and funny Reba knits a neat story of life, learning and love.  Readers will eagerly follow her yarn, and gain greater understanding of the stitches they use to create the fabric of their own lives.”  --- Laurie Graff, author, “You Have toKiss a Lot of Frogs” and “The Shiksa Syndrome”

""A beautiful, loving tribute to a wonderful woman, written by another wonderful woman, expressing her love and admiration for her teacher by imparting her inspiring insights into life. It's not just about knitting, it's about the stitches that bind together the important parts of our lives.""—Gene Krackehl, Author, “You Are The Healer, Discover your Miraculous Potential to Heal Yourself & Others”

""Who would think that great wisdom could be passed on by teaching and learning knitting? Not for knitting lovers only, this book is a how-to knit book, yes, but more importantly a story of healing and inspiring wisdom. Reba Linker knits these two threads craftily creating an easy, worthwhile read."" Marilyn Graman, Psychotherapist, co-Founder Lifeworks, Co-Author, “There is No Prince”, “How to Be Cherished”, and “The Female Power Within”
Where else can you find us?
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/FollowtheYarn2013
Twitter - https://twitter.com/FollowTheYarn

Find Reba @ http://rebalinker.com/follow_the_yarn or http://www.ravelry.com/people/Reba9

Story of My Book

My name is Amy J. Wilson and I am the author of Empathy for Change. I wrote this book because I could see that, as a society, we were on a race to the bottom and chasing a constant state of productivity, profits, ego, and objects over people. I had been running on that hamster wheel myself, burnt out after working nights and weekends on creating social change that I felt so passionate about but didn’t take the time to refill my coffers. When I paused to take a sabbatical in the middle of my career in late 2018, I reflected on my own experience and talked to many other people trying to heal the world. This book is an exploration of empathy as my biggest strength, what led me to burnout, and how we as a society can get out of our way and create a better world with more empathy.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover ways that you can interrupt our conditioned ways of thinking and step into empathy and connectedness. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for empathy and change in you. And then, ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you turn what you learned into action with a framework that I’ve devised after more than a decade of building cultures of innovation and change into where you live, work, and play.

In this book, you'll learn about empathy and 21st century change:
<ul>

• The different kinds of empathy — and why just saying you’re empathetic won’t cut it. Neuroscience has proven that we can learn new skills and unlearn old ones, and that includes working on our empathy muscle.
• A journey to find connection, community, and ultimately true belonging within yourself. Learn about the differences between being an empath, being highly sensitive, and applying empathy.
• How people and organizations around the country are applying empathy to deep-seated cultural challenges like systemic racism, capitalism, and poverty.

You will love this book if you are uneasy with the way our current structures are set up and are motivated to make change — both from within you and beyond. Empathy for Change Makers is a non-fiction book that speaks to those who want to enact change within their existing institutions and communities and people who are looking at inserting empathy and positive transformation for the first time.
The Book - Empathy for Change

The book is written in three parts:

Part One contains the introduction + additional chapters. I’ll define what we mean by empathy, the latest science that shapes it, and what I mean when I say “21st century change.” It will also explore the traits of an empathetic changemaker, how to become more empathetic yourself, and how to extend that to the communities in which you live, work, and play. As I’ve found, it takes being in community to both understand yourself more and also to learn how to build the empathy muscle we need to thrive.

Part Two contains chapters four through seven. In this part, I’ll transform the kinds of empathy into principles and a logical framework that anyone can use to create a culture of empathy into their lives and work. I’ll also explore the fields of change management and design and see how these fields are evolving to meet the needs of the 21st century. It’s in this section where the rubber hits the road — that you’ll explore how to put purpose and people first — and how that will turn into better programs, products, and cultures that work for everyone. Here is where you’ll learn to build a movement around culture change, not a mandate.

Part Three contains chapters eight through ten. It’s in these chapters where we get to put our framework into action to make real change happen. I’ll explore how some companies and organizations are inserting empathy into their work and how it’s turning past models of profits and ego into people first, which pays off in the long term. I’ll include incredible tips from some of the best storytellers in the world to use the art of story to connect and share empathy. Finally, I’ll explore what we see as the new normal. I’ll give some insights into the world that has been thrust upon us with the coronavirus pandemic and how this is new, fertile ground for the empathetic future we all deserve and crave.
What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
<ul>
• The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript
• The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
• The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
• The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
• The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
<ul>
• You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish:
• A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
• Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
• Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
• The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
• I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
• And more...
About the Author

Amy J. Wilson is an Technology Policy Fellow at the Aspen Institute Tech Policy Hub, a West Coast policy incubator training a new generation of tech policy entrepreneurs. As a tech expert, she’s learning how to apply policy and create outside-the-box solutions to society’s problems. She’s worked on technology challenges around social issues like homelessness and systemic racism in Oakland, California, and will be launching her newest project, People Powered Policy, in Summer 2020.

She has served as a White House Presidential Innovation Fellow (PIF), an entrepreneur-in-residence, for three years serving across two Administrations. While a PIF, she co-created with hundreds of public servants a shared language for innovation and change in the 21st century government: a six-point Innovation Playbook and 15-section Innovation Toolkit housed on Innovation.gov. Alongside that work, she launched The Better Government Movement that empowered 5,000 people across Federal, state, and local government to build their creative capacity and apply these skills to scale across governments everywhere. Before becoming a PIF, she was the pioneered the creation of Booz Allen Hamilton’s Innovation Blueprint and Ecosystem: products, tools, and events empowering employees to identify problems, generate ideas, and manage the innovation process. She has prototyped, piloted, tested, assessed, and scaled dozens of social change projects in her tenure.

Amy has been leading with empathy her whole life, but she had to take a test to help her realize her biggest strength was empathy. As a “highly-functioning” empath and highly sensitive person, Amy has had success across many sectors, but often at the expense of her mental health. After meeting her match while working at the highest levels of corporate consulting and the federal government, she was struggling with suicidal thoughts and deep burnout but knew there was a better way forward.

In December 2018, she took a sabbatical to slow down her life and think about what’s next. It’s during this time of slowing things down that she reflected and rediscovered her strength and passion for empathy. In Empathy for Change Makers, she’s pairing her passion and knowledge for of 21st century change with her innate strength of empathy to create a new blueprint that will help us lead movements towards larger cultural change.

For more information, you can connect with Amy at Amy.Jessica.Wilson@gmail.com and on LinkedIn [https://www.linkedin.com/in/AmyJWilson], on Instagram and Twitter @RealAmyJWilson. I also have a personal site at [https://www.amyjwilson.com/].
Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

• Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Empathy4Change and tag me as well as my publisher, @NewDegreePress so we can help amplify your efforts.
• You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
• Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Amy J. Wilson

So I have feelings

sometimes these feelings need expressing. every morning as soon as I get up I write three pages in my journal and sometimes I accidentally stumble into writing a poem to capture and express what I'm feeling that day. I'm usually very embarrassed by how honest these poems are, and, as such, I feel it is my solemn duty to
publish my own poetry book!
I still don't know if anyone will care to buy a copy but I wanted to see what it would be like to self-publish something close to my heart.
However... words are hard!! and they don't always convey the meaning I intend...
so?
I found an illustrator

The moment I saw her work, I knew Sachiko Shigeta was the perfect person to add some color and imagery to my thoughts. her illustrations are whimsical and deeply emotional and I'm still brought to tears when I see her beautiful artwork.
you can see her work here: https://www.sachikoshigeta.com/works
I'd like your help...
21 poems.
21 illustrations.
~48 pages including cover and title page.
setting, printing, shipping. OOF.
please help me accomplish my year-end goal and publish my first poetry book!
what do you get out of it?
<ul>
• collection of Eugene original poems with custom color illustrations, beautifully bound, signed and shipped to your door!
• a hug from me next time I see you
• the satisfaction of helping me achieve a goal of mine!!
The books will be printed and bound in the USA #MadeinAmerica and signed in Japan before they’re sent to your door!
if you’re interested in a copy (or three!) it would mean the world to me if you reserved one here and helped me print my first run.
campaign ends December 5th. I'll ship them out on December 12th.
