Let’s make our democracy work for the many and not just the few.

The Pluribus Project ─ a special initiative with the Aspen Institute ─ is changing the way political campaigns are run and won, so our elected officials work on behalf of broad public interests instead of moneyed interests or angry extremists. Our project is led by a dynamic team of social entrepreneurs with extensive experience at the intersection of politics, media, and technology who came together to address what we see as the defining challenge of our time.

Through a rigorous process with leading campaign experts, we have identified 14 Political Game Changers who we believe can help make our politics work for all of us. Please join us in supporting these projects so they can test their potentially transformative ideas in the 2016 election season.
Why this matters

Our elected officials heed in office who they need on the campaign trail, and the reality is that the conventional playbook for winning office involves relying on either the most passionate and extreme fringes of our society or moneyed interests seeking political influence. So whether we’re making decisions about how we manage our economy, protect our environment, or ensure our security, the full force of our federal government can be held hostage by hysteria or bought by the highest bidder.
But our nation is undergoing tectonic economic, demographic, and technological shifts.
The way our campaigns are run and won will change. The question is how?
The Representation Collaboratory

Over the last year, we have engaged more than 50 leading campaign experts from across the political spectrum to inform our analysis of how our campaigns are likely to evolve, based on those tectonic shifts.

Through a competitive open call, we selected 14 projects that we think could help change how the campaign game is played, so that our elected officials need and ultimately heed a broader diversity of the public. We want your support so we can test these potentially transformative innovations in this year’s election season.
The Political Game Changers

Below are the winning projects, organized into three different areas relevant to the future of campaigning. To support a specific project directly, either click on the “support this project” button beneath it or select the corresponding perk to the right. If you’d prefer to support the entire portfolio, select the Good Citizen or Collaboratory Membership perks. All funds will be received by our partner organization, Rock the Vote, and dispursed directly to the teams or to the entire Pluribus Project portfolio.
Leveraging People Power
How can campaigns activate broad, diverse networks of people to achieve campaign objectives with greater reliance on human resources and less reliance on financial resources?
A how-to manual for running a successful People Powered Campaign: The People’s Democracy Playbook from Take Back Our Republic
<table border=""0"" style=""width: 100%;border:none;margin-top:15px;"">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style=""vertical-align: top;padding-left:20px;"">

The former Republican campaign strategist who took down the House Majority Leader while being outspent 20:1 joins forces with the mastermind from several left-wing campaigns to develop an open source guide for running a $250,000 competitive congressional campaign.
</tr>
</tbody>

Getting more volunteers into the game:
Stronger U.S. Education Fund
<table border=""0"" style=""width: 100%;border:none;margin-top:15px;"">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style=""vertical-align: top;padding-left:20px;"">

An experienced Obama campaign operative combines the “snowflake model” for volunteer recruitment and empowerment with cutting edge research to prove that enlisting volunteers may not make consultants money, but it can scale and change the dynamics of a race.
</tr>
</tbody>
Lowering barriers & increasing impact for volunteers: Movement
<table border=""0"" style=""width: 100%;border:none;margin-top:15px;"">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style=""vertical-align: top;padding-left:20px;"">

An active military serviceman organized an ad hoc network of coders to build an app for making campaign field operations much more efficient and effective; it was adopted by the Sanders campaign and has been wildly successful. Now they want to make it open-source and available to anyone.
</tr>
</tbody>
Labor organizing for the networked age: OUR Walmart
<table border=""0"" style=""width: 100%;border:none;margin-top:15px;"">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style=""vertical-align: top;padding-left:20px;"">

Innovations in technology have changed the way that workers can connect and take action. OUR Walmart presents a model for ensuring the employees at Walmart (the largest employer of African Americans, Latinos and women in the United States) can leverage the power of their numbers through a peer-to-peer platform.
</tr>
</tbody>
The Power of a Pledge: Defend Our Future & UMass Amherst
<table border=""0"" style=""width: 100%;border:none;margin-top:15px;"">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style=""vertical-align: top;padding-left:20px;"">

Behavioral science research shows that committing to do something significantly increases the chances that you will follow through. A research team from UMass Amherst and Defend our Future is conducting ground breaking field experiments on how to translate a “pledge” into political power.
</tr>
</tbody>
Winning the (Future) Media War

Today’s rapidly changing media environment presents the potential to cultivate a less expensive and more constructive conversation between candidates and voters, as opposed to an arms race of attack ads that manipulate and demoralize the American public. The following projects look to turn that potential into a reality.
Building the courage to speak according to principled convictions and foster genuine discourse: Emily Ekins from Cato Institute
<table border=""0"" style=""width: 100%;border:none;margin-top:15px;"">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style=""vertical-align: top;padding-left:20px;"">

The conventional thinking is that speaking from principled convictions is no way to get elected. But new research suggests that people are open to being persuaded if they believe the speaker genuinely shares some of their values. Emily Ekins is assessing the effectiveness of this strategy for promoting more inclusive, evidence-based political discourse.
</tr>
</tbody>
Ensuring that any size campaign can leverage new media & communications technologies effectively: Telegraph from Lincoln
<table border=""0"" style=""width: 100%;border:none;margin-top:15px;"">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style=""vertical-align: top;padding-left:20px;"">

Campaigns that can’t afford highly paid digital consultants are unable to take advantage of the latest media and tech tools for communicating with and engaging constituents. Telegraph is a new platform that ensures that any campaign or civic cause can have access to valuable tech expertise and innovative digital strategies.
</tr>
</tbody>
Undermining the influence of ads and elevating the conversation: Block the Bias from Students for Liberty
<table border=""0"" style=""width: 100%;border:none;margin-top:15px;"">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style=""vertical-align: top;padding-left:20px;"">

Campaigns cost so much money primarily because of the expense of advertising. What if ads didn’t reach the people campaigns are paying to reach? SFL, the largest network of libertarian student organizations in the world, is encouraging young people to install ad-blocking software and promote more constructive online forums for discussion.
</tr>
</tbody>
A new 21st century public square: The UnConvention from the 92nd Street Y, Mic, and PRI
<table border=""0"" style=""width: 100%;border:none;margin-top:15px;"">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style=""vertical-align: top;padding-left:20px;"">

Young people don’t want to just be passive recipients of political content anymore; they want to be part of a conversation. The 92nd Street Y is partnering with Mic and Public Radio International to host the UnConvention, a multi-media, multi-platform conversation of, by, and for millennials about what matters to them this election season.
</tr>
</tbody>
Engaging Interested Bystanders

We can’t have a government responsive to broad public interests if the people who are active politically are not reflective of the full diversity of the electorate – including the many Americans who care about what is happening in their communities and country but feel too powerless or uninformed to participate. How can we get those whom Kate Krontiris and her colleagues on the Google Civic Innovation Team call Interested Bystanders off the sidelines and into the game?
Empowering election officials and civil society to increase voter turnout: Center for Technology and Civic Life
<table border=""0"" style=""width: 100%;border:none;margin-top:15px;"">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style=""vertical-align: top;padding-left:20px;"">

There are well established methods for increasing voter turnout. But those methods are typically deployed by campaigns, which tend to focus on the demographics likely to support their candidates. CTCL is giving government employees and civic leaders the tools and know-how they need to ensure that those who vote are more representative of the public at large.
</tr>
</tbody>
Increasing turnout in determinative primaries:  Echelon Insights
<table border=""0"" style=""width: 100%;border:none;margin-top:15px;"">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style=""vertical-align: top;padding-left:20px;"">

2026

The kind of transformation we are envisioning will not happen overnight. We have set our sights on 2026 – the 250th anniversary of the Declaration of Independence – as an appropriate timeline for our efforts to help restore the integrity of America’s system of elected representation. But change takes time, so we need to start now, and we need your help.

The beauty of our political process is that if just a few people win by using the People Powered Playbook, then others will take note, inspiring more candidates across the country to adopt these tactics and campaigns.
That’s what our system of government is supposed to be. And if we all chip in and do our part, that’s what it can be. Please join us.

","Let’s make our democracy work for the many and not just the few.

The Pluribus Project ─ a special initiative with the Aspen Institute ─ is changing the way political campaigns are run and won, so our elected officials work on behalf of broad public interests instead of moneyed interests or angry extremists. Our project is led by a dynamic team of social entrepreneurs with extensive experience at the intersection of politics, media, and technology who came together to address what we see as the defining challenge of our time.

Through a rigorous process with leading campaign experts, we have identified 14 Political Game Changers who we believe can help make our politics work for all of us. Please join us in supporting these projects so they can test their potentially transformative ideas in the 2016 election season.
Why this matters

Our elected officials heed in office who they need on the campaign trail, and the reality is that the conventional playbook for winning office involves relying on either the most passionate and extreme fringes of our society or moneyed interests seeking political influence. So whether we’re making decisions about how we manage our economy, protect our environment, or ensure our security, the full force of our federal government can be held hostage by hysteria or bought by the highest bidder.
But our nation is undergoing tectonic economic, demographic, and technological shifts.
The way our campaigns are run and won will change. The question is how?
The Representation Collaboratory

Over the last year, we have engaged more than 50 leading campaign experts from across the political spectrum to inform our analysis of how our campaigns are likely to evolve, based on those tectonic shifts.

Through a competitive open call, we selected 14 projects that we think could help change how the campaign game is played, so that our elected officials need and ultimately heed a broader diversity of the public. We want your support so we can test these potentially transformative innovations in this year’s election season.
The Political Game Changers

Below are the winning projects, organized into three different areas relevant to the future of campaigning. To support a specific project directly, either click on the “support this project” button beneath it or select the corresponding perk to the right. If you’d prefer to support the entire portfolio, select the Good Citizen or Collaboratory Membership perks. All funds will be received by our partner organization, Rock the Vote, and dispursed directly to the teams or to the entire Pluribus Project portfolio.
Leveraging People Power
How can campaigns activate broad, diverse networks of people to achieve campaign objectives with greater reliance on human resources and less reliance on financial resources?
A how-to manual for running a successful People Powered Campaign: The People’s Democracy Playbook from Take Back Our Republic

The former Republican campaign strategist who took down the House Majority Leader while being outspent 20:1 joins forces with the mastermind from several left-wing campaigns to develop an open source guide for running a $250,000 competitive congressional campaign.
Getting more volunteers into the game:Stronger U.S. Education Fund

An experienced Obama campaign operative combines the “snowflake model” for volunteer recruitment and empowerment with cutting edge research to prove that enlisting volunteers may not make consultants money, but it can scale and change the dynamics of a race.
Lowering barriers & increasing impact for volunteers: Movement

An active military serviceman organized an ad hoc network of coders to build an app for making campaign field operations much more efficient and effective; it was adopted by the Sanders campaign and has been wildly successful. Now they want to make it open-source and available to anyone.
Labor organizing for the networked age: OUR Walmart

Innovations in technology have changed the way that workers can connect and take action. OUR Walmart presents a model for ensuring the employees at Walmart (the largest employer of African Americans, Latinos and women in the United States) can leverage the power of their numbers through a peer-to-peer platform.
The Power of a Pledge: Defend Our Future & UMass Amherst

Behavioral science research shows that committing to do something significantly increases the chances that you will follow through. A research team from UMass Amherst and Defend our Future is conducting ground breaking field experiments on how to translate a “pledge” into political power.
Winning the (Future) Media War

Today’s rapidly changing media environment presents the potential to cultivate a less expensive and more constructive conversation between candidates and voters, as opposed to an arms race of attack ads that manipulate and demoralize the American public. The following projects look to turn that potential into a reality.
Building the courage to speak according to principled convictions and foster genuine discourse: Emily Ekins from Cato Institute

The conventional thinking is that speaking from principled convictions is no way to get elected. But new research suggests that people are open to being persuaded if they believe the speaker genuinely shares some of their values. Emily Ekins is assessing the effectiveness of this strategy for promoting more inclusive, evidence-based political discourse.
Ensuring that any size campaign can leverage new media & communications technologies effectively: Telegraph from Lincoln

Campaigns that can’t afford highly paid digital consultants are unable to take advantage of the latest media and tech tools for communicating with and engaging constituents. Telegraph is a new platform that ensures that any campaign or civic cause can have access to valuable tech expertise and innovative digital strategies.
Undermining the influence of ads and elevating the conversation: Block the Bias from Students for Liberty

Campaigns cost so much money primarily because of the expense of advertising. What if ads didn’t reach the people campaigns are paying to reach? SFL, the largest network of libertarian student organizations in the world, is encouraging young people to install ad-blocking software and promote more constructive online forums for discussion.
A new 21st century public square: The UnConvention from the 92nd Street Y, Mic, and PRI

Young people don’t want to just be passive recipients of political content anymore; they want to be part of a conversation. The 92nd Street Y is partnering with Mic and Public Radio International to host the UnConvention, a multi-media, multi-platform conversation of, by, and for millennials about what matters to them this election season.
Engaging Interested Bystanders

We can’t have a government responsive to broad public interests if the people who are active politically are not reflective of the full diversity of the electorate – including the many Americans who care about what is happening in their communities and country but feel too powerless or uninformed to participate. How can we get those whom Kate Krontiris and her colleagues on the Google Civic Innovation Team call Interested Bystanders off the sidelines and into the game?
Empowering election officials and civil society to increase voter turnout: Center for Technology and Civic Life

There are well established methods for increasing voter turnout. But those methods are typically deployed by campaigns, which tend to focus on the demographics likely to support their candidates. CTCL is giving government employees and civic leaders the tools and know-how they need to ensure that those who vote are more representative of the public at large.
Increasing turnout in determinative primaries:  Echelon Insights

Most congressional seats are considered safe for one of the parties, so the primary is the determinative election. Yet primary turnout is often paltry and dominated by ideologically extreme constituents. Leading Republican campaign strategists at Echelon are exploring how to ensure that the people who determine the representative of a district are more representative of that district.

Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders are the fastest growing demographic group in America, but too many of them are isolated from our democracy because they don’t have the language skills to participate. VoterVOX breaks through that barrier by connecting skilled volunteers with people in the field when they are most needed.

Why Help Us?
Who we are
Zip Zap Circus School is a vibrant social circus based in Cape Town, South Africa.

Founded in 1992 by Brent van Rensburg and Laurence Estève, this circus school proudly provides free circus and performing arts training for youth from different walks of life. Zip Zap is a diverse, loving family committed to teaching the invaluable life skills of trust, honesty, responsibility, teamwork and discipline, while training and playing in the circus.

The success of Zip Zap is internationally recognized, with professional performances in more than 16 countries and many artistic and public awards won. Their true achievement lies in the positive effect the circus has had in so many children's lives, and the opportunities to touch more are boundless.

Dr Zizz, the author of I CAN FLY, is a child psychologist who directed a show for Zip Zap children's circus in their early days (1997). That show was marked by tragedy when our poster boy, Shorty, drowned. The show went on. Twenty years later, with I CAN FLY, we have a chance to pay homage to that child and children across the world who dare to dream.
What we're doing
Your contribution, which allows us to publish the true story of Zip Zap, will do several things:
<ul>
• It will share Zip Zap's inspiring message worldwide. The book will travel wherever Zip Zap shows go, and be available for order online.
• It will bring their message into your own home and the homes of children you love.
• It will enable Zip Zap to continue doing this important work because half of the book's proceeds will go back to the circus.

• It will encourage our young illustrator, Ayanda Nombelwu, along his path as an artist, effectively creating his first job. A cut of the book's proceeds will go to him, in the interests of furthering his tertiary education.
• Zip Zap is a non-profit organization. Projects like this help spread word of what they do for kids so more backers can support them in the future.
What We Need & What You Get

This project has been over 3 years in the making. It started in June 2015, with an email to Zip Zap. It took Dr Zizz five months to write the text. Then, in between his schoolwork and circus practice, Ayanda Nombelwu, our child illustrator, drew for over a year!
Now we need just $5,400 (about R77,000) to bring I CAN FLY to print. That's not a lot!
(As this is a South African project, we give an approximate Rand value too:)
<ul>
• $1,400 (R20,000) gives us our first 1000 copies of the book on a very special print deal from Tandym Printers (Thank you, Tandym!)
• $400 (R5,000) pays Ayanda Nowbelwu an advance on the work he's done and enables him to buy a Wacom tablet so he can add digital colour to his own drawings!

• $1,400 (R20,000) pays the cartoonist (Chip Snaddon) who has been working all year to add colour to the line-drawings delivered by Ayanda Nombelwu. Chip initially offered to work for free, but no one should go unrewarded for their kindness.
• $900 (R13,000) pays Paul Morkel of Pedestrian Films who, at short notice, filmed and edited the heartfelt promo movie you see at the top of this campaign, spreading word of our work.
• $500 (R7,000) is budgeted for Indiegogo's deductions (a maximum of 10%).
• $400 (R5,000) pays the author, Dr Zizz, an advance on the work she's done.
• $400 (R5,000) pays Zip Zap, the publisher, an advance on the work they've done.

The unique perks for you as  a contributor are advance copies of the book gratefully signed by the author and illustrator, as well as mentions on social media and in the preface to the book itself. There are free tickets for you to a Zip Zap show if you are in Cape Town, as well as the chance to be mentioned and thanked at the start of the show. Not to mention a private tour of the brand new Zip Zap Academy plus our limited release Zip Zap diaries for 2019!

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will at least be able to print some books. But let's be positive! With ongoing support, InDemand will allow us to keep raising funds so that we can produce and publish the sequels to Lucky's story: Lucky in Love and Lucky and Friends (working titles). A whole series of books about children facing life's challenges head-on and winning!
The Impact

Your contribution will make a huge difference to so many lives, it's hard to calculate. Primarily the lives of children. However, children become adults - they shape the world of the future. You will be putting generations in touch with their personal power, and the grace that meets them when they use it wisely and humbly.

The author has been a child therapist since 2002 (16 years). She has seen the value in her practice of therapeutic stories as a way to uplift and support children in their life's journey. Stories are much more effective and impact more strongly than talking or lectures. Not all children have effective role models. We're all learning. I CAN FLY holds seeds of change for everyone, even the adults who are reading it aloud.
This is Dr Zizz's first children's book. She has produced a PhD, published a poetry collection, short stories and five novellas, and considers herself a writer at heart.
Out of choice, Ayanda Nombelwu draws for hours every day. His drawing ability has recently been estimated as that of a third year Art student's by a renowned tertiary institution (he's only 18).
Over 25 years, Zip Zap circus has become legend for the kind of passion that takes kids from the rough streets of Cape Town to performances at the White House and at Nelson Mandela’s birthday party.
We are confident that, together, we can deliver on all our promises, and then some.
Risks & Challenges

Dr Zizz says: ""Approaching Zip Zap to do a children's book, after our initial contact twenty years ago, was a risk in itself. Trying to write I CAN FLY was a risk (my first children's book). Asking Ayanda to illustrate was a risk - would we work well together? Going on Facebook to ask someone to add colour to our pictures, out of the goodness of his heart, was a risk. Asking a friend to shoot our promo movie was a risk - and what did I know about movie-making myself? Creating a fundraising campaign is a risk. Staying indoors because it might rain is no way to live your life. Who dares, grins.""

Zip Zap is used to creating miracles. They run numerous outreach programs. They offer subsidized accommodation to students in need of safe housing. In 2008 they erected a permanent circus dome for training and performances, and in 2017 they opened the doors of their very own academy! Read all about it here.

We trust that with help and continuing patience we can overcome any technical challenges on the publishing road and make our dreams come true. As Lucky shows in I CAN FLY, perseverance is key: ""If I fall I will stand up, look the audience in the eye, and do it again.""
Other Ways You Can Help
This is very important. Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Simply hit the Indiegogo share tools - it's super-quick and easy (top right, next to the movie).
Some people just can't contribute, and that's OK! It doesn't mean you can't help: if you send this link to a couple of people you think might be able to, that would be helping us enormously!
Follow this project on Twitter and Facebook and read our blog.
Bless you all and thank you so much for taking the time to consider our campaign.
And that's all there is to it.

Route 57 is a creative writing journal

We publish work by the students, alumni and staff of the University of Sheffield.
Our eleventh edition is available online and in print! We would like to raise money for next year by selling this beautiful book.
Can you help?
We want to distribute the incredible, diverse and remarkable writing our students produce by selling the book. Then, we want to use the money to fund next year's edition.

If you buy a copy, you will be ensuring that Route 57 continues to be published in print. 90% of the money raised from this campaign will go directly towards the design and print for the 2016 edition. The remainder will go to indiegogo and into banking charges.
The book

The book is lovely. Designed  by Swiss design studio Go! Grafik, it has 234 pages and features writing from 50 contributors, mostly current students but with some alumni, many of whom have had their work published elsewhere (some of these publications are available as thank yous for higher donations).

The illustrations are also by Go! Grafik: each one depicts a single line from the book. Go! Grafik are also producing a poster advertising the launch event on Tuesday May 12th (which we hope you can come to!).
Footprint Workers Co-operative are making A3 fine risograph prints of this poster in addition to riso postcard sets of the illustrations as further perks.
Thank you for supporting Route 57!

Especially those who have contributed their poetry, fiction, experimental writing, drama, literary non-fiction and much else. The journal was founded in 2006 by Professor Adam Piette. It's edited by staff and students, many of whom are involved with the Creative Writing MA. Have a look at our previous issues here. 
Many, many thanks to the poets and writers who have donated copies of their books as perks for this campaign. Thanks too to Camille Brouard, Kiran Dosanjh and Will Watts, the three English MA students who have helped shape the publication as part of their Work Experience module. They enjoyed it so much they have started their own imprint, Sorgenkind Press and will be publishing three collections of writing and poetry soon! Follow them here.
The Route 57 annual could not have been made without the funding from Arts Enterprise and the support of Sheffield Lyric Festival and the Centre for Poetry and Poetics.
Launch, postage and multiple copies

The 2015 annual will be available from Tuesday 12th May, when we are going to have a reading at 5.30pm in Jessop West, University of Sheffield. If you can't come then the book will be available from the foyer of Jessop West all week. Get in touch with any questions.
Note that you only have to buy postage once for every five books to a UK address. The multiple copy options include postage for free.
Other Ways You Can Help
You don't have to donate any money to the campaign in order to help. It would be great if you could spread the word to people who you think might be interested.

Grafik, it has 234 pages and features writing from 50 contributors, mostly current students but with some alumni, many of whom have had their work published elsewhere (some of these publications are available as thank yous for higher donations).

The illustrations are also by Go! Grafik: each one depicts a single line from the book. Go! Grafik are also producing a poster advertising the launch event on Tuesday May 12th (which we hope you can come to!).
Footprint Workers Co-operative are making A3 fine risograph prints of this poster in addition to riso postcard sets of the illustrations as further perks.
Thank you for supporting Route 57!

Especially those who have contributed their poetry, fiction, experimental writing, drama, literary non-fiction and much else. The journal was founded in 2006 by Professor Adam Piette. It's edited by staff and students, many of whom are involved with the Creative Writing MA. Have a look at our previous issues here. Many, many thanks to the poets and writers who have donated copies of their books as perks for this campaign. Thanks too to Camille Brouard, Kiran Dosanjh and Will Watts, the three English MA students who have helped shape the publication as part of their Work Experience module. They enjoyed it so much they have started their own imprint, Sorgenkind Press and will be publishing three collections of writing and poetry soon! The 2015 annual will be available from Tuesday 12th May, when we are going to have a reading at 5.30pm in Jessop West, University of Sheffield. If you can't come then the book will be available from the foyer of Jessop West all week. Get in touch with any questions.
Note that you only have to buy postage once for every five books to a UK address. The multiple copy options include postage for free.

La tierra del peregrino es una novela acerca del azar, de los caprichos del destino, y de cómo en ocasiones uno debe alejarse para terminar de encontrarse a sí mismo...

Tras sufrir un desengaño amoroso, Xavi decide echar tierra de por medio aceptando una proposición que le llevará a trabajar para una ONG en Croacia. Nos hallamos a las puertas del cambio de siglo y la guerra es la triste protagonista en los Balcanes. Pero el destino no se detiene y unos años más tarde llegará hasta Ljubljana donde encontrará empleo en la embajada española. En esa ciudad conocerá a una misteriosa joven eslovena que propiciará un cambio trascendental en su vida.
La tierra del peregrino traza un mapa de caminos cruzados, donde las personas entrelazan sus propios destinos y descubren que la vida puede estar tejida con pura magia.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Miguel Panés.

Miguel Panés Segarra no puede entender la vida sino es vinculada al arte y la creatividad. Todavía era un niño cuando empezó la carrera de piano que cursó en el Conservatorio del Liceo de Barcelona. Pero mucho antes ya había descubierto el dibujo y la escritura refugiado en la intimidad de su habitación. Los trazos de sus lápices se entrelazaron con las letras de sus relatos y sentimientos reflejados sobre una página en blanco. Decidió iniciar sus estudios de pintura/dibujo y arte dramático en la academia Mass-Media; taller experimental de arte y expresión situada en el Paral·lel barcelonés. Descubrió en la escena un mundo completamente nuevo, una fuente constante de emociones desbordadas que forjaron su personalidad artística, reforzando su realidad creativa.

En la década de los noventa hizo las maletas y viajó por América y Europa. República Dominicana, U.S.A., Irlanda, Italia,… fueron algunos de los destinos, pero fue en Eslovenia, país de origen de su mujer, donde hizo una pausa en este peregrinaje. En ese rincón verde de Europa pasaría 10 años junto a sus dos personas más amadas; su mujer y su hija. Fue allí donde se irían tejiendo las vivencias que con el tiempo decidirá reflejar en las páginas de su primera novela: La tierra del peregrino.
Actualmente vive en Sitges, cerca de su ciudad natal Barcelona, y compagina sus momentos creativos entre la pintura y su próximo proyecto literario; una recopilación de relatos cortos.
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.
<ul>
• Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
• Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
• Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La tierra del peregrino que saldría después a la venta.
Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Miguel Panés vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

What is Dysfluent? 

Irrespective of language or race, stammering—a kind of dysfluency—exists in every culture. To be dysfluent is to have the inability to create smooth, coherent speech. It impacts around 1% of the world’s population.

Dysfluent is a magazine about people who are proud of their stammers. Sharing the lives and experiences of people who stammer, it shows strength in owning your imperfections—communicative or otherwise.

As the video above explains, Dysfluent began as a college project (video courtesy of RTÉ & Eleanor Mannion). While visually the magazine has evolved, its intent is still the same.

 

What kind of things can I read in it? 

ARTICLES
Stammering or stuttering?
An introduction to the topic, and a guideline to understand the world of a person who stammers. 

Visualing the verbal
A look at Dysfluent Mono, a custom-made font designed to represent the interviewees’ unique voices. 

INTERVIEWS
James Connolly
Dublin native, now living in Berlin and a person who stammers.

Mark Dupré
Classical cellist and photographer living in Tallin and a person who stammers.

Veronica & Bevin Murphy
Mother and daughter who both stammer, and are members of the Irish Stammering Association (ISA).

Dr. Jonathon Linklater
Independent speech and language therapist, Development Manager of ISA and Past Chair of the Irish Association of Speech and Language Therapist, who also stammers.

Benjamin Cleary
Director of STUTTERER, the Oscar-winning short film. Benjamin doesn’t stammer. 
 

How do I support the magazine? 

By donating, you will be helping to make Dysfluent accessible to both people who stammer and those who don’t. That’s because I believe that stammering should be recognised and understood by as many people as possible. I would like Dysfluent to be available in magazine and book shops, alongside high-quality, contemporary magazines—not just available as a newsletter to people who stammer. 

Funding Dysfluent will help cast light on the day-to-day lives of people who stammer—a much underrepresented group in our everyday media. 

All funding for Dysfluent goes straight into the production of the first issue. If I exceed my target, all additional funds will go towards the next issue.

 

When will I receive my copy?

Shipping is free and is planned for January 2020. 
 

Where can I find more information?

Learn more at dysfluentmagazine.com, and follow Twitter and Instagram for any updates. Email hello@dysfluentmagazine.com if you've any questions.

Thank you!
Conor

Bamboo Whispers is an unprecedented collection of indigenous metrical poetry, or ambahan, from the Philippines.

The Mangyan are an indigenous people's group that have lived on the island of Mindoro for centuries. Their verse is a cultural gem that has been kept hidden since antiquity, conjuring their identities, struggles, and hopes through evocative, visceral metaphors. Much like Japanese haiku or the Malaysian pantoum, ambahan is written in native pre-colonial script and heptasyllabic verse.

Inscribed with a knife on bamboo stalks, ambahan is not only unique for its structure and medium, but also for its provenance, with no individual authorship -- this art form being a communal offering to the world.

Bamboo Whispers curates the one hundred of their  most representative ambahans, in two scripts and in four languages: in the original Hanunuo Mangyan, and translated into Filipino, Spanish, and English by poets.

With these diverse languages, and archival and fine art photography that provide a window to the Mangyan soul and way of life, the book aims not only to introduce the beauty and legacy of ambahans and Mangyan culture to the modern world, but also to invest in the preservation and sustained practice of this rarefied and vanishing craft.
What We Need & What You Get

The publication and proceeds of this book will fund the Mangyan Heritage Center's programs to teach the next generation of Mangyans to embrace their unique culture, literature, and script -- only one of three remaining in the Philippines today from over a dozen documented by a Spanish priest in the 1600s.
We need to raise $10,000 to fund the publication of the first 1,000 copies of Bamboo Whispers.
In return, you will get a copy of the book, signed by the editors, and will be invited to the public launch and reading of the books to be held in Spain, the UK, US, Hong Kong, and the Philippines.
There is no better way to preserve, promote, and bring indigenous cultural treasures to their rightful place in the world and beloved land.

MHC's website:  www.mangyan.org

Hello! My name is Jessikka and I'm an award-winning investigative journalist from Finland. I specialize in investigating Russia, extremism and information warfare. Immediately after I started covering pro-Russian online propaganda, I became a target of an extensive, international disinformation campaign.

This is me covering the Russian Troll Factory in St. Petersburg in February 2015. The Troll Factory produces pro-Kremlin social media propaganda  24/7.

You might have read my story in the New York Times or other news outlets.  You might even have seen some of the fabricated stories about me which are used to discredit my work and frame me as unreliable, like this professionally produced song which claims the Kremlin trolls only exist in my imagination. It's performed in Finnish by a wig-wearing actress playing me at my work place, Finnish Broadcasting Company.

Despite the attacks, I continued my investigations - thanks to supporters! Now I need your backing for a brand new investigative book on the information warfare waged by Russian President Vladimir Putin's regime.
Focus of my Book - the Kremlin's Cross-Border Influence

I wish I was the only international investigator of Putin's Russia to have been harassed, but there are many more targets like me. Therefore I will systematically collect and map data on the pro-Russian intimidation of civilians - internationally. The outcome will be published in my book Vladimir Putin's Troll Empire - an investigation into the Kremlin-affiliated influencing techniques of trolling, hacking, stalking and harassing people - even outside Russia's borders.

In my book I will disclose new details about the pro-Kremlin intimidation campaigns targeted at Western citizens who investigate, publish and comment on issues which Putin's regime would prefer to keep hidden.

In Russia, independent journalists, citizen activists and opposition figures often face harassment, threats and physical violence, and in the most tragic cases have been murdered. But the critics of Russia's political leadership are systematically being harassed in other countries, too.

I have interviewed and will interview individuals, who have been hacked, threatened and/or trolled by pro-Kremlin operators after voicing out their views or knowledge on Russia. My interviewees are active members of their communities: journalists, researchers, social media activists, authors, dissidents, analysts and other civilians living in Europe and even the USA.
The targets of pro-Russian intimidation often face serious consequences - Meet some of my interviewees:
<ul>
<li>
A public critic of the Kremlin who was falsely denounced by Russia as a criminal, and flagged to Interpol
<li>
A journalist who was smeared online, trolled and hacked by Russian hackers
<li>
A private tweeter who had his workplace information stalked and published in a story by the Russian state-owned ""news agency"" Sputnik
<li>
A journalist who was physically followed by the Russian security service FSB
<li>
A researcher who was targeted by a cyber espionage group linked to Russian military intelligence

I have chosen to interview people, who continue their work and activities, despite the harassment. These individuals' stories need to be told because they are a true inspiration to others. By distributing factual information, they protect the freedom of speech and democratic decision-making as well as promote basic human rights and strong civil societies in their own countries, but internationally, too.
This Book is Important - Russian Information Operations are Advancing

This book needs to be written, because the Russian information war is reaching and influencing ordinary people, their attitudes and actions as well as political decision-making not just inside Russia, but around Europe and further afield too. The Russian spy, troll, bot and hacker apparatus is trying to poison the public debate as far away as in the United States, by meddling in the presidential election.

In my previous investigations I uncovered the fact that in Finland, a country bordering Russia, the pro-Kremlin trolls have bullied and threatened many citizen commentators online, and succeeded in manipulating the public debate about Russia. Similar and more robust tools - such as groundless criminal complaints, or publishing defamatory books etc. - have been used to silence Kremlin's critics in Finland.

In my book I will provide insight of the Russian textbooks concerning information-psychological warfare as well as Russia's security services' methods of oppression. I will also map the most active internationally operating agents of influence connected to the Kremlin and/or the security services of Russian Federation.
GLOBSEC 2016 security conference in Bratislava: Me talking about fake social media profiles used to distribute Kremlin propaganda.

Russian information-psychological operations and cyber capabilities are constantly improved. Without sophisticated analysis it is impossible for the free, Western democracies to counter the infowar that they face. It is crucial to expose the ongoing hybrid warfare, and my ambition is that the book will provide a set of the most effective solutions on countering modern information aggression.

Even though I've already come across more instances thank I'd like of Russia-related intimidation targeted at civilians, I am eager to receive further tips. Please contact me and share your experiences and knowledge about pro-Russian smearing or hacking campaigns. If you want to share info publicly, please use the my book's hashtag #StopKremlinTrolls on social media.
(KINDLY NOTE:  If you happen to work in the Putin's regime and want to become a whistleblower - I would love to hear from you).
How are the Crowdfunded Finances used?
My project has started very promisingly, but I need your support to take it forward! It has the backing of various prominent experts as well as members of the public! This crowdfunding will pay for:
<ul>
<li>
Fact-finding research travel
<li>
Translations and transcription of interviews and troll materials
<li>
Analytical software and necessary hard- and software to improve my own data security.
<li>
A blogging platform to publish the most interesting pieces of the book and other fascinating information warfare related material
<li>
A professional to take photographs of my interviewees, the main characters of the book, and other help which I might need.

The more we manage to exceed my funding target, the more cool elements I will be able to include in my book! My dream is for the book to contain vivid visual infographics, photographs and screen caps: as the modern information war is waged in the cybersphere, it would be both entertaining and educating to bring the book to life with Augmented Reality application. That would create even more interest in the topic of the world of state-led deception! But developing an AR application is very expensive.

A successful crowdfunding also allows me to conduct my investigations independently and free of outside pressure. I aim to publish the book as soon as possible, but prioritize outstanding quality over quick delivery. At the moment I'm on leave from my job and able to focus totally on this investigation. Before the book is published, I will launch a blog in which I publish my most interesting findings.
Please add me as a friend on Facebook to follow the book's progress and follow me on Twitter @jessikkaaro
The Author: Investigative Journalist with Experience from Russia

I recently received the most prestigious Finnish journalism award -  the Bonnier Grand Prize - for my series of articles about Russian trolls, published in Finnish, English and Russian. My articles of Russian social media propaganda have been cited extensively in media and research papers worldwide. I have fans and readers around the world, even in Russia <3
My latest research ”Cyberspace war: Propaganda and Trolling as Warfare Tools” is recommended by various experts.

I am often invited to speak at conferences and to contribute to press freedom and cyber security projects. I train reporters, the general public and experts to detect and counter disinformation campaigns and give interviews regularly. I have studied journalism, international politics and Russian language at the University of Tampere, Finland, and worked as a journalist in Russia.
On LinkedIn  you will find contact info and my digital CV. It's a good idea to use encryption when communicating with me by phone - I strongly recommend the app Signal.
How to Contribute: Back my Campaign or Share Knowledge

Vladimir Putin's Troll Empire poses a threat to the stability, security and freedom of speech of many Western countries.  It challenges access to information and other core values of civilized democracies - in a brutal and unethical manner. So please fund my project and help expose and fight back against the Troll Empire. Small and large contributions are equally appreciated!

I am currently looking for an international publishing house for the English language edition of the book, which will be published alongside the Finnish version. The target audience is the general public, but it also serves experts/analysts, reporters, researchers, activists and policymakers. I am writing the book in universally interesting and easily digestible language.
If you do not have the chance to support my project financially, that is OK too! You can participate in raising awareness and sharing this campaign with others who might be in a position to help.
In any case, you're welcome to browse photos of me, my work and travels on Instagram, where I use the nick eijejee :)
Please use the #StopKremlinTrolls when discussing the topic on social media!
Me being interviewed at Bonnier Journalism Prize Gala on March 2016. I won the ""Best Article of the Year"" Category.

In my book I will disclose new details about the pro-Kremlin intimidation campaigns targeted at Western citizens who investigate, publish and comment on issues which Putin's regime would prefer to keep hidden.

In Russia, independent journalists, citizen activists and opposition figures often face harassment, threats and physical violence, and in the most tragic cases have been murdered. But the critics of Russia's political leadership are systematically being harassed in other countries, too.

I have interviewed and will interview individuals, who have been hacked, threatened and/or trolled by pro-Kremlin operators after voicing out their views or knowledge on Russia. My interviewees are active members of their communities: journalists, researchers, social media activists, authors, dissidents, analysts and other civilians living in Europe and even the USA.
The targets of pro-Russian intimidation often face serious consequences - Meet some of my interviewees:
A public critic of the Kremlin who was falsely denounced by Russia as a criminal, and flagged to Interpol
A journalist who was smeared online, trolled and hacked by Russian hackers
A private tweeter who had his workplace information stalked and published in a story by the Russian state-owned ""news agency"" Sputnik
A journalist who was physically followed by the Russian security service FSB
A researcher who was targeted by a cyber espionage group linked to Russian military intelligence

I have chosen to interview people, who continue their work and activities, despite the harassment. These individuals' stories need to be told because they are a true inspiration to others. By distributing factual information, they protect the freedom of speech and democratic decision-making as well as promote basic human rights and strong civil societies in their own countries, but internationally, too.
This Book is Important - Russian Information Operations are Advancing

This book needs to be written, because the Russian information war is reaching and influencing ordinary people, their attitudes and actions as well as political decision-making not just inside Russia, but around Europe and further afield too. The Russian spy, troll, bot and hacker apparatus is trying to poison the public debate as far away as in the United States, by meddling in the presidential election.

In my previous investigations I uncovered the fact that in Finland, a country bordering Russia, the pro-Kremlin trolls have bullied and threatened many citizen commentators online, and succeeded in manipulating the public debate about Russia. Similar and more robust tools - such as groundless criminal complaints, or publishing defamatory books etc. - have been used to silence Kremlin's critics in Finland.

In my book I will provide insight of the Russian textbooks concerning information-psychological warfare as well as Russia's security services' methods of oppression. I will also map the most active internationally operating agents of influence connected to the Kremlin and/or the security services of Russian Federation.
GLOBSEC 2016 security conference in Bratislava: Me talking about fake social media profiles used to distribute Kremlin propaganda.

Russian information-psychological operations and cyber capabilities are constantly improved. Without sophisticated analysis it is impossible for the free, Western democracies to counter the infowar that they face. It is crucial to expose the ongoing hybrid warfare, and my ambition is that the book will provide a set of the most effective solutions on countering modern information aggression.

Even though I've already come across more instances thank I'd like of Russia-related intimidation targeted at civilians, I am eager to receive further tips. Please contact me and share your experiences and knowledge about pro-Russian smearing or hacking campaigns. If you want to share info publicly, please use the my book's hashtag #StopKremlinTrolls on social media.
(KINDLY NOTE:  If you happen to work in the Putin's regime and want to become a whistleblower - I would love to hear from you).
How are the Crowdfunded Finances used?
My project has started very promisingly, but I need your support to take it forward! It has the backing of various prominent experts as well as members of the public! This crowdfunding will pay for:
Fact-finding research travel
Translations and transcription of interviews and troll materials
Analytical software and necessary hard- and software to improve my own data security.
A blogging platform to publish the most interesting pieces of the book and other fascinating information warfare related material
A professional to take photographs of my interviewees, the main characters of the book, and other help which I might need.

The more we manage to exceed my funding target, the more cool elements I will be able to include in my book! My dream is for the book to contain vivid visual infographics, photographs and screen caps: as the modern information war is waged in the cybersphere, it would be both entertaining and educating to bring the book to life with Augmented Reality application. That would create even more interest in the topic of the world of state-led deception! But developing an AR application is very expensive.

A successful crowdfunding also allows me to conduct my investigations independently and free of outside pressure. I aim to publish the book as soon as possible, but prioritize outstanding quality over quick delivery. At the moment I'm on leave from my job and able to focus totally on this investigation. Before the book is published, I will launch a blog in which I publish my most interesting findings.
Please add me as a friend on Facebook to follow the book's progress and follow me on Twitter @jessikkaaro
The Author: Investigative Journalist with Experience from Russia

I recently received the most prestigious Finnish journalism award -  the Bonnier Grand Prize - for my series of articles about Russian trolls, published in Finnish, English and Russian. My articles of Russian social media propaganda have been cited extensively in media and research papers worldwide. I have fans and readers around the world, even in Russia <3
My latest research ”Cyberspace war: Propaganda and Trolling as Warfare Tools” is recommended by various experts.

I am often invited to speak at conferences and to contribute to press freedom and cyber security projects. I train reporters, the general public and experts to detect and counter disinformation campaigns and give interviews regularly. I have studied journalism, international politics and Russian language at the University of Tampere, Finland, and worked as a journalist in Russia.
On LinkedIn  you will find contact info and my digital CV. It's a good idea to use encryption when communicating with me by phone - I strongly recommend the app Signal.
How to Contribute: Back my Campaign or Share Knowledge

Vladimir Putin's Troll Empire poses a threat to the stability, security and freedom of speech of many Western countries.  It challenges access to information and other core values of civilized democracies - in a brutal and unethical manner. So please fund my project and help expose and fight back against the Troll Empire. Small and large contributions are equally appreciated!

I am currently looking for an international publishing house for the English language edition of the book, which will be published alongside the Finnish version. The target audience is the general public, but it also serves experts/analysts, reporters, researchers, activists and policymakers. I am writing the book in universally interesting and easily digestible language.
If you do not have the chance to support my project financially, that is OK too! You can participate in raising awareness and sharing this campaign with others who might be in a position to help.
In any case, you're welcome to browse photos of me, my work and travels on Instagram, where I use the nick eijejee :)
Please use the #StopKremlinTrolls when discussing the topic on social media!
Me being interviewed at Bonnier Journalism Prize Gala on March 2016. I won the ""Best Article of the Year"" Category.

Welcome to Aeon Byte 2.0

Aeon Byte is one of the most exciting and far-seeing programs in the world of Webcasting.
Richard Smoley, author of Forbidden Faith: The Secret History of Gnosticism and Inner Christianity

For over seven years, Aeon Byte Gnostic Radio has been the leading voice in bringing the mysteries of ancient Gnosticism and other alternative traditions to a modern meaning. Best-selling authors, world-renowned scholars, Hollywood filmmakers, and counterculture mystics have been given a clear forum to spread dangerous truths that have helped countless individuals attain spiritual and mental freedom. But the other dangerous truth is that the Gnostic message is more relevant than ever with the rise of invisible police states, quicksand realities caused by medusa media, and conspiracy theories coming alive.
It’s time to make even more of an impact. It’s time for Aeon Byte 2.0

With the demands and opportunities of a changing landscape in media and technology, Aeon Byte Gnostic Radio needs to adapt in order to reach farther and even survive. This will include the highly-anticipated follow-up to Voices of Gnosticism, a full transformation into a multi-media entity, and a venturing into other exciting areas of the internet. It will result into a complete and interactive experience for you. Let us continue together to teach the world to write their own gospel and live their own myth.

""Aeon Byte is an invaluable resource for those interested in the history and continuing relevance of Gnosticism. With its wide range of scholars, independent voices, poets, thinkers and modern heretics, it is, for my money, one of the very best Gnostic sites on the internet, and a much-needed meeting place for like-minded souls in a world dominated by the forces the Gnostics personified as our old friend, Ialdabaoth and his archons."" 
Sean Martin, author of The Gnostics: The First Christian Heretics, The Cathars, and The Knights Templar
What will happen once Aeon Byte 2.0 is launched, in essence creating an even bigger heretical family:
<ul>
<li>

The anticipated follow-up to Voices of Gnosticism. The book has been both a commercial and critical success. Two years later, it’s time to release the follow-up, bringing in print more of the greatest scholars and mystics of our era, increasing the depth of the Gnostic sensibility. The book will include many of my own writings on crystalizing Gnosticism for a contemporary audience. It will expand the message of the first book, but it can also be a standalone work. The projected release date would be September, 2013.
<li>

Free resources. This will include future ebooks and transcripts of episodes beyond the books. And also a plethora of audio and video. The Gnostic Wisdom will be available in many more platforms, reaching a larger audience. This will assist in our continual growth! This would begin to be available before the end of 2013.
<li>

A revamped, streamlined website, blog, and audio/video/article resource center. Beyond making it all an easier and richer experience, visitors will be much more involved. This will include a subscription area, potential forum, and various resources where you will know the process of each show, from beginning to end, and give me your two shekels of wisdom whenever you desire. This would certainly be executed by October, 2013.
<li>

An expansion into video and an expansion into other topical arenas, without losing the Gnostic thrust. The truth is that I get approached by factions beyond the borders of religion and occultism. Even Occupy Wall Street has contacted me to interview its leadership. With more resources, I will be able to expand into parallel subjects. And all this means newer and more varied guests to enrich your experience. There will also be mini-documentaries in the future. This would certainly begin before October, 2013.

“It was a pleasure talking with Miguel and collaborating with him on matters of gnosis. What good fortune that we have this sort of opportunity to chat about things Gnostic on the radio! Sophia and her aeonic friends should be delighted.” Marvin Meyer, author The Gospel of Thomas: The Hidden Sayings of Jesus, The Gospels of Mary, Judas: The Definitive Collection of Gospels and Legends About the Infamous Apostle of Jesus, as well as editor of The Nag Hammadi Scriptures

""What a rare treat to hear side-by-side all of these voices musing about secrets of the Gnostics."" 
April D. DeConick, author of Recovering the Original Gospel of Thomas and The Thirteenth Apostle: What the Gospel of Judas Really Says
What I need and what for to make this all a reality:
<ul>
<li>
The follow-up to Voices of Gnosticism. Purchasing ISBN numbers and other licenses, basic printing fees, obtaining editing assistance, and graphic design will cost $1000.
<li>

Equipment. I’ve been running with the same loyal machines for over four years (and much of the basic software from 2006, from the early days of podcasting). But there is a new generation of Adobe Audition and Illustrator programs, among others, that will reign production with the times ($2500). These programs will go along one Titan computer and other equipment that won’t have electric tape keeping them together ($1500). Video software and gear will migrate part of the show into video interviews and mini-documentaries ($1200). Cost for all revamped technology and software will easily be a total $5200 (and that’s cutting some corners).
<li>

Advertising and promotion. For years, Aeon Byte Gnostic Radio has grown into an audience of thousands through word of mouth alone, but it can reach farther and for deeper for those who have ears to hear. As mentioned, this will include a new horizon of guests as well. An average Google Adword campaign is around $200, just to make a dent. Placing careful advertising campaigns will not dilute the program but enhance it. Cost for basic marketing. $1600.
<li>

New website and look. It’s time to overhaul all the sites. The reality is that search engines have punished the show because of fragmented content and bulkiness, a side effect of many years of growth. This also tends to confuse many visitors. By having a restructured look, creating a subscription service, building a forum, and fine tuning awkward areas, the experience will be vastly more enjoyable and interactive for you. This will include an approachable blog and resource center on Gnosticism and other heresies. Cost for subscription area and new store, as well as hiring a programmer and designer will be $4000.
<li>

Expansion. By expanding a budget, adding some extra equipment, and outsourcing production work, we can melt the Gnostic ethos with other counterculture movements. Beyond what I mentioned above, I have also been approached by various activist filmmakers who wish to create new messages from the ancient heresies. Cost will be $3000.
<li>

Exras. This reboot and overhauling will require more legal fees and training, finally making this venture a lean and effective business. There are blinds spots I need to close to get to the next level. Cost will be $3000. And course there are the taxes and fees that running this campaign demand.

In essence, this will make a more polished, professional, and pluralistic venture. Gnosis should be available to all, so please support this venture into helping more find their own Gnosis. Become and be involved in a growing heretical family and alternative media vehicle.

""Miguel Conner's Aeon Byte Gnostic Radio has opened up the study of Gnosticism in two ways. It provides a detailed appreciation of varied perspectives for those who are at the beginning of their interest. But it also and unusually steps outside of doctrinaire claims --fashionable among Fundamentalists and neo-Gnostics alike -- in order to get at the Gnostics as they were, not as many people today would like them to be.""
Bruce Chilton, best-selling author of The Way of Jesus, Abraham’s Curse & Rabbi Paul
What If I Don't Reach These Goals
The future direction of the show will be in question, but all books and subscription services will go through.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you've got holes in your pockets, spread the word and bang the drum. Share, share, and share!
If you’re unfamiliar with Aeon Byte Gnostic Radio, please visit: http://www.thegodabovegod.com

Okay, I'll shut-up now.
